detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: modern
trans: adj. 现代的，近代的；时髦的
n. 现代人；有思想的人

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

name: current
trans: adj. 现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: remove
trans: vt. 移动，迁移；开除；调动

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 解散；解雇；开除；让...离开；不予理会、不予考虑

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: representative
trans: adj. 典型的，有代表性的；代议制的

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: reverse
trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败
adj. 反面的；颠倒的；反身的

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: stock
trans: n. 股份，股票；库存；血统；树干；家畜
adj. 存货的，常备的；平凡的
vt. 进货；备有；装把手于…

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: suppose
trans: vt. 假设；认为；让（虚拟语气）；推想

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: guess
trans: vt. 猜测；认为；推测；猜中
n. 盖尔斯（美国服装品牌）

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

name: supreme
trans: adj. 最高的；至高的；最重要的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: willing
trans: adj. 乐意的；自愿的；心甘情愿的
v. 决心；用意志力驱使；将（财产等）遗赠某人（will的现在分词）

sentences.english: How much are they willing to pay?
sentences.chinese: 他们愿意付多少钱？

detailed_translations.english: prepared to do something, or having no reason to not want to do it

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: hurry
trans: v. 仓促（做某事）；催促；（朝某方向）迅速移动；迅速处理

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: achieve
trans: vt. 取得；获得；实现；成功
vi. 达到预期的目的，实现预期的结果，如愿以偿

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

name: automatic
trans: n. 自动机械；自动手枪
adj. 自动的；无意识的；必然的

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: automate
trans: vt. 使自动化，使自动操作

sentences.english: Cash machines automate two basic functions of a bank – deposits and withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 柜员机使银行的两个基本功能——存款和取款自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

name: mechanical
trans: adj. 机械的；力学的；呆板的；无意识的；手工操作的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: belief
trans: n. 相信，信赖；信仰；教义

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

sentences.english: The final cost could be as much as one billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 最后的费用可能高达十亿美元。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000,000

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: comment
trans: vi. 发表评论；发表意见

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: review
trans: n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅
vi. 回顾；复习功课；写评论

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: consideration
trans: n. 考虑；原因；关心；报酬

sentences.english: proposals put forward for consideration
sentences.chinese: 提请考虑的建议

sentences.english: They’ve got no consideration for others.
sentences.chinese: 他们一点都不为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: careful thought and attention, especially before making an official or important decision

name: constant
trans: adj. 不变的；恒定的；经常的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: continuous
trans: adj. 连续的，持续的；继续的；连绵不断的

sentences.english: continuous economic growth
sentences.chinese: 持续的经济增长

sentences.english: a continuous flow of information
sentences.chinese: 源源不断的信息

detailed_translations.english: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

name: corporation
trans: n. 公司；法人（团体）；社团；大腹便便；市政当局

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴；连队

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: deny
trans: vt. 否定，否认；拒绝给予；拒绝…的要求

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触
vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

sentences.english: She had all the normal childhood illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的常见病她小时候都得过。

sentences.english: Her mother was recovering from a serious illness.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲重病后正在逐渐康复。

sentences.english: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
sentences.chinese: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。

sentences.english: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
sentences.chinese: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

detailed_translations.english: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill

name: distraction
trans: n. 注意力分散；消遣；心烦意乱

sentences.english: I study in the library as there are too many distractions at home.
sentences.chinese: 我在图书馆学习，家里分心的事太多。

detailed_translations.english: something that stops you paying attention to what you are doing

name: distracted
trans: adj. 心烦意乱的；思想不集中的

sentences.english: She had seemed curiously distracted.
sentences.chinese: 她不知为什么显得心不在焉。

detailed_translations.english: anxious and unable to think clearly

name: due
trans: adj. 到期的；预期的；应付的；应得的

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: elite
trans: n. 精英；精华；中坚分子

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: appear
trans: vi. 出现；显得；似乎；出庭；登场

sentences.english: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.english: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.english: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.chinese: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.english: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.chinese: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.english: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

name: loom
trans: n. 织布机；若隐若现的景象
vi. 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见

sentences.english: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.
sentences.chinese: 文森特赫然出现在我面前，脸色苍白阴沉得像块墓碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 织布机；若隐若现的景象
detailed_translations.english: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见
detailed_translations.english: to appear as a large unclear shape, especially in a threatening way

name: employ
trans: vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: hire
trans: n. 雇用，租用；租金，工钱

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: exist
trans: vi. 存在；生存；生活；继续存在

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: generate
trans: vt. 使形成；发生；生殖；产生物理反应

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: genetic
trans: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: household
trans: n. 全家人，一家人；(包括佣工在内的)家庭，户
adj. 家庭的；日常的；王室的

sentences.english: household chores
sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.
sentences.chinese: …在全体成员均为男性的家庭里长大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭的， 家喻户晓的
detailed_translations.english: relating to looking after a house and the people in it
A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house

name: family
trans: n. 家庭；亲属；家族；子女；科；语族；族
adj. 家庭的；家族的；适合于全家的

sentences.english: Do you know the family next door?
sentences.chinese: 你认识隔壁那家人吗？

sentences.english: The Webb family still has its farm over there.
sentences.chinese: 韦伯家依然保留着那里的农场。

sentences.english: The family now live in London.
sentences.chinese: 那家人现居伦敦。

sentences.english: This house isn’t big enough for a family of seven.
sentences.chinese: 这房子住不下七口之家。

sentences.english: My family come from Scotland originally.
sentences.chinese: 我祖籍是苏格兰。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children

name: ignore
trans: vt. 驳回诉讼；忽视；不理睬

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: inequality
trans: n. 不平等；不同；不平均

sentences.english: People are concerned about corruption and social inequality.
sentences.chinese: 人们对腐败和社会不公感到担忧。

detailed_translations.english: an unfair situation, in which some groups in society have more money, opportunities, power etc than others

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: licence
trans: vt. 特许，许可；发给执照

sentences.english: The dealers applied for an export licence.
sentences.chinese: 经销商申请了出口许可证。

sentences.english: He was arrested for driving without a license.
sentences.chinese: 他因无照驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: The Tennessee Valley Authority applied for a license to operate the facility.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西河谷管理局申请了这个场所的经营执照。

sentences.english: The owner of land could grant a licence to cut and remove timber.
sentences.chinese: 土地所有者可发执照授权砍伐和运走木材。

sentences.english: I forgot to renew my licence.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记去办理执照展期了。

sentences.english: Persistent offenders face losing their licence.
sentences.chinese: 多次违规者将会被没收执照。

detailed_translations.english: an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

sentences.english: Regular exercise is part of a healthy lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼身体是健康生活方式的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: the way a person or group of people live, including the place they live in, the things they own, the kind of job they do, and the activities they enjoy

name: lifespan
trans: n. 寿命；预期生命期限；预期使用期限

name: lifetime
trans: n. 一生；寿命；终生；使用期

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

sentences.english: Her illness was caused mainly by stress.
sentences.chinese: 她的病主要是由精神压力引起的。

sentences.english: The workforce is mainly made up of women.
sentences.chinese: 员工主要是女性。

sentences.english: I don’t go out much, mainly because I have to look after the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我不大出去，主要是因为我得照看孩子们。

sentences.english: Increased sales during the summer were mainly due to tourism.
sentences.chinese: 夏季销售额增加主要是由旅游业带动的。

sentences.english: We talked about various things – work, mainly.
sentences.chinese: 我们谈了各种各样的事情——主要是谈工作。

detailed_translations.english: used to mention the main part or cause of something, the main reason for something etc

sentences.english: The work consists chiefly of interviewing the public.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是采访公众。

sentences.english: I lived abroad for years, chiefly in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我在国外生活了很多年，主要在意大利。

detailed_translations.english: mostly but not completely

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer’s instructions before using your new dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 使用新洗碗机之前，请先阅读厂家的说明书。

sentences.english: The fridge was sent back to the manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 那台冰箱被退还给厂家了。

detailed_translations.english: a company that makes large quantities of goods

name: mental
trans: adj. 精神的；脑力的；疯的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: mortal
trans: adj. 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

sentences.english: The gate is made of metal.
sentences.chinese: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。

sentences.english: a small black metal box
sentences.chinese: 一个黑色的金属小盒子

sentences.english: They traded in gold and other precious metals (= valuable metals used especially for making jewellery ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。

sentences.english: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal (= old metal that is melted and used again ) .
sentences.chinese: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: monitor
trans: n. 监视器；监听器；监控器；显示屏；班长

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: stimulate
trans: vi. 起刺激作用；起促进作用

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: necessity
trans: n. 需要；必然性；必需品

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: official
trans: adj. 官方的；正式的；公务的
n. 官员；公务员；高级职员

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: officer
trans: n. 军官，警官；公务员，政府官员；船长

sentences.english: a former Cabinet officer
sentences.chinese: 前内阁官员

sentences.english: a commanding officer of the SAS
sentences.chinese: 英国空军特种部队的一名指挥官

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position in an organization or the government

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: otherwise
trans: adv. 否则；另外；在其他方面
adj. 另外的；其他方面的；原本，本来

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: painful
trans: adj. 痛苦的；疼痛的；令人不快的

sentences.english: stiff painful joints
sentences.chinese: 僵硬疼痛的关节

sentences.english: Is your arm very painful?
sentences.chinese: 你的手臂很疼吗？

sentences.english: The neck becomes swollen and painful to the touch (= hurts when you touch it ) .
sentences.chinese: 脖子肿起来了，一碰就疼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛苦的，疼痛的，令人不快的
detailed_translations.english: if a part of your body is painful, it hurts

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: poll
trans: n. 投票；民意测验；投票数；投票所
adj. 无角的；剪过毛的；修过枝的
vt. 投票；剪短；对…进行民意测验；获得选票

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: addict
trans: n. 有瘾的人；入迷的人

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触
vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: indict
trans: vt. 控告，起诉； 揭发

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: privacy
trans: n. 隐私；秘密；隐居；隐居处

sentences.english: each individual’s right to privacy
sentences.chinese: 每个人的隐私权

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

name: program
trans: vt. 用程序指令；为…制订计划；为…安排节目
vi. 编程序；安排节目；设计电脑程式

sentences.english: Any large high-speed computer can be programmed to learn.
sentences.chinese: 任何大型高速计算机都可以通过编程获得学习能力。

detailed_translations.english: to give a computer a set of instructions that it can use to perform a particular operation

name: programme
trans: n. 计划，规划；节目；程序

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

name: recruit
trans: vi. 复原；征募新兵；得到补充；恢复健康
vt. 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: regular
trans: n. 常客；正式队员；中坚分子
adj. 定期的；有规律的；合格的；整齐的；普通的

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: regulate
trans: vt. 调节，规定；控制；校准；有系统的管理

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: relatively
trans: adv. 相当地；相对地，比较地

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: reliant
trans: adj. 依赖的；可靠的；信赖的

sentences.english: These people are not wholly reliant on Western charity.
sentences.chinese: 这些人并非完全依赖西方的施舍。

detailed_translations.english: dependent on someone or something

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件；必需品

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: recover
trans: vt. 恢复；弥补；重新获得
vi. 恢复；胜诉；重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: uncover
trans: vi. 发现；揭示；揭去盖子

sentences.english: When the seedlings sprout, uncover the tray.
sentences.chinese: 幼苗发芽后，揭开盘上的遮盖物。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something

name: routine
trans: n.  程序；日常工作；例行公事

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: satisfy
trans: vi. 令人满意；令人满足
vt. 满足；说服，使相信；使满意，使高兴

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

name: setting
trans: n. 环境；安装；布置； 沉落
v. 放置；沉没；使…处于某位置（set的ing形式）

sentences.english: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我在许多地方教过孩子，主要是在中学。

sentences.english: The heating system was already on its highest setting.
sentences.chinese: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: kind
trans: adj. 和蔼的；宽容的；令人感激的

sentences.english: Get me a sandwich – any kind will do.
sentences.chinese: 给我一份三明治，随便哪种都可以。

detailed_translations.english: one of the different types of a person or thing that belong to the same group

name: variety
trans: n. 多样；种类；杂耍；变化，多样化

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

name: specific
trans: adj. 特殊的，特定的；明确的；详细的； 具有特效的

sentences.english: games suitable for specific age groups
sentences.chinese: 适合特定年龄组的游戏

sentences.english: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

detailed_translations.english: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
particular details

name: special
trans: n. 特使，特派人员；特刊；特色菜；专车；特价商品
adj. 特别的；专门的，专用的

sentences.english: a special place in the classroom for reading
sentences.chinese: 教室里的阅读专区

sentences.english: No one receives special treatment.
sentences.chinese: 没有人享有特殊待遇。

sentences.english: Maria’s special recipe for apple pie
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚的苹果馅饼秘方

sentences.english: The good china was used only on special occasions .
sentences.chinese: 这些精美瓷器只在特殊场合使用。

sentences.english: Each village has its own special charm.
sentences.chinese: 每一座村子都有其独特的魅力。

detailed_translations.english: not ordinary or usual, but different in some way and often better or more important

name: stable
trans: adj. 稳定的；牢固的；坚定的

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: staple
trans: n. 主要产品；订书钉；主题；主食
adj. 主要的，大宗生产的；常用的；纺织纤维的

sentences.english: Oil is Nigeria’s staple export.
sentences.chinese: 石油是尼日利亚的主要出口产品。

sentences.english: a staple ingredient of comedy
sentences.chinese: 喜剧最重要的成分

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的； 经常需要的
detailed_translations.english: forming the greatest or most important part of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 订书钉，U形钉；主食；主要产品
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of thin wire that is pushed into sheets of paper and bent over to hold them together
to fasten two or more things together with a staple

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料
vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充
vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

sentences.english: You might only need it temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 可能你只是暂时的需要它。

sentences.english: Reparations were temporarily pretermitted.
sentences.chinese: 赔款暂时中止了。

sentences.english: He is temporarily acting for her in that post.
sentences.chinese: 他是暂时代理她的职务。

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: accordingly
trans: adv. 因此，于是；相应地；照著

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: tolerant
trans: adj. 宽容的；容忍的；有耐药力的

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: merciful
trans: adj. 仁慈的；慈悲的；宽容的

sentences.english: Merciful God, save us.
sentences.chinese: 仁慈的上帝，救救我们吧。

detailed_translations.english: being kind to people and forgiving them rather than punishing them or being cruel

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业率；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物
adj. 独特的，稀罕的； 唯一的，独一无二的

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: only
trans: adj. 唯一的，仅有的；最合适的

sentences.english: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
sentences.chinese: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。

sentences.english: There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.english: It’s only eight o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 才8点钟。

sentences.english: I was the only woman there.
sentences.chinese: 我是那里唯一的女性。

detailed_translations.english: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

name: workforce
trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area

name: staff
trans: adj. 职员的；行政工作的
vt. 供给人员；给…配备职员

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

sentences.english: Farmers struggling for survival strip the forests for agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 为生存而挣扎的农民们把森林伐光来作农业用地。

detailed_translations.english: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: anxious
trans: adj. 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: architecture
trans: n. 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: architecture
trans: n. 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: argument
trans: n. 论证；论据；争吵；内容提要

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: quarrel
trans: n. 吵架；反目；怨言；争吵的原因；方头凿

sentences.english: I wish you two would stop quarreling.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

sentences.english: Jacob left after a quarrel with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布和妻子吵了一架后走了。

detailed_translations.english: to have an argument
an angry argument or disagreement

sentences.english: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.english: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

name: dispute
trans: vt. 辩论；怀疑；阻止；抗拒

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembler
trans: n. 汇编程序；汇编机；装配工

sentences.english: In this example, the assembler template consists of assembly instructions.
sentences.chinese: 本例中，汇编程序模板由汇编指令组成。

sentences.english: This software logic can be written in a higher level programming language, or it can be executed as assembler logic on a computer chip.
sentences.chinese: 这里的软件逻辑可以使用较为高级的编程语言编写，可作为汇编程序逻辑在计算机芯片上执行。

sentences.english: This way, if you need to add a register to your code later, the assembler will auto-recalculate the new register numbers and you don't have to alter your register numbering convention.
sentences.chinese: 这样，如果您以后需要向代码中添加一个寄存器，那么汇编程序就会自动重新计算新寄存器的编号，您也不必更改自己的寄存器编号约定。

detailed_translations.chinese: 汇编程序；汇编机；装配工
detailed_translations.english: An assembler is a person, a machine, or a company that assembles the individual parts of a vehicle or a piece of equipment such as a computer

name: assign
trans: vt. 分配；指派； 赋值
vi. 将财产过户（尤指过户给债权人）

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: association
trans: n. 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: institute
trans: vt. 开始（调查）；制定；创立；提起（诉讼）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: society
trans: n. 社会；交往；社团；社交界

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: try
trans: vt. 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验

sentences.english: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: automatically
trans: adv. 自动地；机械地；无意识地

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: mechanically
trans: adv. 机械地；呆板地；物理上地

sentences.english: Never copy foreign things blindly or mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 不要盲目地或机械地照搬外国的东西。

sentences.english: There existed between Marius and her an all-powerful magnetism, which caused her to do, instinctively and almost mechanically, what Marius wished.
sentences.chinese: 在马吕斯和她之间有一种最强的磁力，能使她出自本能或几乎机械地照马吕斯的愿望行事。

sentences.english: Start your creative engine mechanically - One of the biggest misconceptions about creative work is that it can only be done when inspiration strikes.
sentences.chinese: 机械地启动你的创造引擎—— 最大的错误观念之一就是创造性的工作只能在灵感闪现的时候进行。

sentences.english: It helps point out some of the behavioral barriers you have in making better food choices.
sentences.chinese: 而且当你在选择更好的食物的时候它也可以帮助你指出一些行为障碍。

sentences.english: Both my mother and grandmother were diagnosed with depression. I saw more behavioral symptoms in them, but I knew they were taking medication and they seemed to have it under control.
sentences.chinese: 我的母亲和曾祖母都曾被诊断为抑郁症，在她们身上我见得更多的是行为的异常，但我知道她们也用药并且症状控制得似乎不错。

sentences.english: From behavioral quirks to brain cancer, researchers have looked for any health risks associated with cellphone radiation for years.
sentences.chinese: 从行为怪癖到脑癌，数年来研究人员一直在寻找与手机辐射有关的健康风险。

name: budget
trans: vt. 安排，预定；把…编入预算

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: campaign
trans: vi. 作战；参加竞选；参加活动

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

sentences.english: We regaled ourselves on caviar and champagne.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽情地享用鱼子酱和香槟酒。

sentences.english: Waiter: Sir, what would you like to drink, wine or champagne?
sentences.chinese: 服务员：先生，您想喝点什么？葡萄酒还是香槟酒？

sentences.english: French perfume, champagne, and bridges in Paris… want to know more? Then next time we will return to Paris, and you will learn more about her.
sentences.chinese: 还有法国的香水、香槟酒、巴黎的桥……。你想知道的更多吗？下次我们会谈到巴黎，您可以深入地了解她。

detailed_translations.english: a French white wine with a lot of  bubble s  , drunk on special occasions

sentences.english: This meat’s so tough I can hardly chew it!
sentences.chinese: 这肉太老了，我几乎嚼不动！

detailed_translations.english: the act of biting something many times with your teeth
to bite food several times before swallowing it

name: bite
trans: abbr. 机内测试设备（Built-In Test Equipment）

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

name: chief
trans: n. 首领；酋长；主要部分
adj. 首席的；主要的；主任的

sentences.english: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.english: Safety is our chief concern .
sentences.chinese: 安全问题是我们的头等大事。

sentences.english: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为人们更长寿了。

sentences.english: his chief rival for the job
sentences.chinese: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.english: the prosecution’s chief witness
sentences.chinese: 控方的主要证人

sentences.english: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
sentences.chinese: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 首领， 长官； 酋长， 族长
detailed_translations.english: the ruler of a tribe

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境，情况；事件；境遇

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

sentences.english: She recited a poem that she had learnt at school.
sentences.chinese: 她背诵了一首学校里学的诗。

detailed_translations.english: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

name: commute
trans: vt. 减刑；交换；用……交换；使……变成

sentences.english: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
减； 折合， 折偿； 上下班交通
detailed_translations.english: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨；诉苦；疾病；委屈

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: concentrate
trans: vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点；中心；清晰；焦距
vi. 集中；聚焦；调节焦距

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: connection
trans: n. 连接；关系；人脉；连接件

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

sentences.english: The connexion is not a simple derivation.
sentences.chinese: 这种连接并不只是衍生性的。

sentences.english: Syntactics is a subject to study abstract formal connexion among the signs.
sentences.chinese: 符号学是研究符号之间的抽象形式联系的学科。

sentences.english: Frequently consider the connexion of all things in the universe and their relation to one another.
sentences.chinese: 经常考虑宇宙中所有事物的联系和它们的相互关系。

name: relation
trans: n. 关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: contemporary
trans: n. 同时代的人；同时期的东西
adj. 当代的；同时代的；属于同一时期的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: context
trans: n. 环境；上下文；来龙去脉

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

sentences.english: He’ll phone on some pretext or other.
sentences.chinese: 他会以这样或那样的理由打电话的。

detailed_translations.english: a false reason given for an action, in order to hide the real reason

name: convince
trans: vt. 说服；使确信，使信服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: cooperation
trans: n. 合作，协作； 协力

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: current
trans: adj. 现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: democratic
trans: adj. 民主的；民主政治的；大众的

sentences.english: a democratic government
sentences.chinese: 民主政府

sentences.english: the role of the media in the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 民主进程中媒体的作用

detailed_translations.english: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

name: democratize
trans: vt. 使民主化；使大众化

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: depress
trans: vt. 压抑；使沮丧；使萧条

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: despair
trans: n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: desperation
trans: n. 绝望的境地；不顾一切拼命

sentences.english: a look of desperation
sentences.chinese: 绝望的眼神

detailed_translations.english: the state of being desperate

name: emphasise
trans: vt. （英）强调；加强…的语气（等于emphasize ）

sentences.english: I would emphasise three criteria.
sentences.chinese: 我想强调三条标准。

sentences.english: Many candidates go into interviews and are keen to emphasise their skills.
sentences.chinese: 在面试中，更多的候选人倾向于强调他们的专业技能。

sentences.english: They emphasise the significance of economic stability and social equality.
sentences.chinese: 他们强调了经济稳定、社会平等的重要性。

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点；中心；清晰；焦距
vi. 集中；聚焦；调节焦距

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区
vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。
