sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: criticise
trans: vt. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难
vi. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: crucial
trans: adj. 重要的；决定性的；定局的；决断的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: cruise
trans: n. 巡航，巡游；乘船游览

sentences.english: We were cruising along at 50 miles per hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们以每小时50英里的速度平稳行驶。

sentences.english: We fly at a cruising speed of 500 mph.
sentences.chinese: 我们以每小时500英里的巡航速度平稳飞行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巡航；以节省燃料的速度前进
detailed_translations.english: to move at a steady speed in a car, aircraft etc
a holiday on a large ship

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

name: clue
trans: n. 线索；（故事等的）情节
vt. 为…提供线索；为…提供情况

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus
sentences.chinese: 控制病毒扩散的措施

detailed_translations.english: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 控制， 约束； 路缘
detailed_translations.english: an influence which helps to control or limit something

name: restrain
trans: vt. 抑制，控制；约束；制止

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: decay
trans: n. 衰退， 衰减；腐烂，腐朽
vt. 使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落
vi. 衰退， 衰减；腐烂，腐朽

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: deficiency
trans: n. 缺陷，缺点；缺乏；不足的数额

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: desirable
trans: adj. 令人满意的；值得要的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: desire
trans: n. 欲望；要求，心愿；性欲
vt. 想要；要求；希望得到…

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

name: directly
trans: adv. 直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: disadvantage
trans: n. 缺点；不利条件；损失

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

name: disturb
trans: vt. 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: perturb
trans: vt. 扰乱；使…混乱；使…心绪不宁

sentences.english: What perturbs me is that magazine articles are so much shorter nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 让我不安的是现在杂志文章都短多了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 扰乱；使…混乱；使…心绪不宁
detailed_translations.english: If something perturbs you, it worries you quite a lot

name: dominate
trans: vt. 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位
vi. 占优势；处于支配地位

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

sentences.english: an employee’s average weekly earnings
sentences.chinese: 雇员的平均周薪

sentences.english: The company’s earnings have dropped by 5% in the first quarter.
sentences.chinese: 公司第一季度的利润下降了5%。

detailed_translations.english: the money that you receive for the work that you do

sentences.english: She is becoming famous in Australia and elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她在澳大利亚和其他地方渐渐出名了。

sentences.english: Kerala has less crime and alcoholism than elsewhere in India.
sentences.chinese: 喀拉拉邦的犯罪和酗酒现象少于印度的其他地区。

detailed_translations.english: in, at, or to another place

name: anywhere
trans: adv. 在任何地方；无论何处

sentences.english: I haven't got anywhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我没有任何地方住。

detailed_translations.english: in or to any place

sentences.english: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

sentences.english: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere (= or a similar place ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: environmentalist
trans: n. 环保人士；环境论者；研究环境问题的专家

detailed_translations.chinese: 环保人士；环境论者；研究环境问题的专家
detailed_translations.english: someone who is concerned about protecting the environment

name: naturalist
trans: n. 自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人
adj. 自然的（等于naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: I am sometimes described as a naturalist.
sentences.chinese: 有时我也被称作自然主义者。

sentences.english: An American naturalist wrote:"a patriot must always be ready to defend his country against its government".
sentences.chinese: 一位美国自然主义者写道：“爱国者要随时准备好为了保卫国家而与政府斗争！”

sentences.english: To illustrate this, let me refer to the naturalist science of the 19th century, and the effects it had on our opinions of life.
sentences.chinese: 为了诠释这点，我要引用下19世纪的自然主义科学及其它对我们的生活观念所产生的影响。

sentences.english: Ecologists argue that the benefits of treating sewage with disinfectants are doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 生态学家们认为用消毒剂处理污水的好处是值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies ecology

name: equivalent
trans: adj. 等价的，相等的；同意义的

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: equal
trans: n. 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物
adj. 平等的；相等的；胜任的

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: esteem
trans: vt. 尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: estimable
trans: adj. 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的

sentences.english: ...the estimable Miss Cartwright.
sentences.chinese: ...令人仰慕的卡特赖特小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: deserving respect and admiration

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: successive
trans: adj. 连续的；继承的；依次的；接替的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: extend
trans: vt. 延伸；扩大；推广；伸出；给予；使竭尽全力；对…估价
vi. 延伸；扩大；伸展；使疏开

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: expend
trans: vt. 花费；消耗；用光；耗尽

sentences.english: Children expend a lot of energy and may need more high-energy food than adults.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们耗能多，可能比成人需要更多高能量的食物。

detailed_translations.english: to use or spend a lot of energy etc in order to do something

sentences.english: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 地震非常难以预测。

sentences.english: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 给你添了麻烦，我十分抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: facility
trans: n. 设施；设备；容易；灵巧

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: faculty
trans: n. 科，系；能力；全体教员

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: fairly
trans: adv. 相当地；公平地；简直

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: feed
trans: n. 饲料；饲养；（动物或婴儿的）一餐
vt. 喂养；供给；放牧；抚养（家庭等）；靠…为生

sentences.english: Have you fed the cat?
sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: final
trans: n. 决赛；期末考试；当日报纸的末版
adj. 最终的；决定性的；不可更改的

sentences.english: The final episode will be shown tonight.
sentences.chinese: 最后一集将于今晚播出。

sentences.english: students preparing for their final examinations
sentences.chinese: 正在准备期末考试的学生

sentences.english: Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
sentences.chinese: 斯通正在拍摄越战三部曲的最后一部。

sentences.english: the final stages in their relationship
sentences.chinese: 他们之间关系的最后阶段

sentences.english: They scored in the final minutes of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们在比赛的最后几分钟得分。

sentences.english: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以提出建议，但是最终的决定权还是在客户自己手里。

detailed_translations.english: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

name: finale
trans: n. 结局；终曲；最后一场；最后乐章；尾声

sentences.english: the finale of a Broadway show
sentences.chinese: 一出百老汇表演的终场

sentences.english: a game with a dramatic finale
sentences.chinese: 结局颇具戏剧性的一场比赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 结局；终曲；最后一场；最后乐章；尾声
detailed_translations.english: the last part of a piece of music or of a show, event etc

name: flexibility
trans: n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: foster
trans: vt. 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: frequently
trans: adv. 频繁地，经常地；时常，屡次

sentences.english: He was frequently drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他经常喝醉。

detailed_translations.english: very often or many times

name: fully
trans: adv. 充分地；完全地；彻底地

sentences.english: The restaurant is fully booked this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今晚这家餐厅订满了。

sentences.english: Elisa has not fully recovered from the incident.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉莎还没有完全从这个事件中恢复过来。

sentences.english: I am fully aware of your problems.
sentences.chinese: 你的问题我全知道。

sentences.english: The changes in policy are fully described in the review.
sentences.chinese: 政策的变化在报告中有全面的描述。

sentences.english: I fully accept that what he says is true.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意，他的话属实。

sentences.english: This concept is discussed more fully in Chapter 9.
sentences.chinese: 这一概念在第九章中有更详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: completely

sentences.english: the increasing globalization of world trade
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易的日益全球化

detailed_translations.english: the process of making something such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this

sentences.english: For these reasons, the bank chose it as their development tool for their modernization project.
sentences.chinese: 出于这些理由，银行选择它作为其现代化项目的开发工具。

sentences.english: We must achieve modernization of science and technology, otherwise we will lag behind other nations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须实现科学技术现代化，否则我们要落后于其他国家。

sentences.english: Lead in the quality related industrialization process and assure product and process quality / quantity of supplied parts.
sentences.chinese: 领导的质量相关的工业化进程，确保供应商零部件产品和流程的质量/数量。

sentences.english: The basic goal of the reformists is the same: to realize the industrialization of economy and the democratization of politics.
sentences.chinese: 从整体上看，改良思想家的基本目标是一致的，即：实现经济工业化和政治民主化。

sentences.english: Urbanization, although seeming to be an irreversible result of population growth, is caused by both gentrification and industrialization in fact.
sentences.chinese: 城市化现象，虽然看起来是人口增长的必然结果，事实上是由士绅化与工业化所造成的。 。

detailed_translations.english: when a country or place develops a lot of industry

sentences.english: She dreamt of future glory as an Olympic champion.
sentences.chinese: 她梦想着将来能得到奥运冠军的荣誉。

sentences.english: Goran’s moment of glory came when he defeated Rafter.
sentences.chinese: 戈兰击败拉夫特，迎来了荣耀的一刻。

sentences.english: He began the season in a blaze of glory , scoring seven goals in as many games.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛季一开始他便光芒四射，七场比赛进了七个球。

detailed_translations.english: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot

sentences.english: ...he will meet with officials from several countries to discuss ways to promote good governance.
sentences.chinese: ...他将与诸国官员会面，讨论如何促进对国家的良性管理。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of governing

sentences.english: They run a small grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 他们经营一家小食品杂货店。

detailed_translations.english: food and other goods that are sold by a grocer or a supermarket

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区
vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: highlighter
trans: n. 荧光笔，高光色；轮廓色

name: ideology
trans: n. 意识形态；思想意识；观念学

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: ideological
trans: adj. 思想的；意识形态的

sentences.english: The party is split by ideological differences.
sentences.chinese: 意识形态上的差异造成该政党分裂。

detailed_translations.english: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas

sentences.english: After a period of enforced idleness, she found a new job.
sentences.chinese: 她在被迫闲散了一段时间之后，找到了份新工作。

name: diligence
trans: n. 勤奋，勤勉；注意的程度

sentences.english: Genius is nothing but labor and diligence.
sentences.chinese: 天才无非是工作和勤奋。

sentences.english: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.chinese: 我们要养成勤俭节约的好风气。

name: impulsive
trans: adj. 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

name: inclined
trans: v. 使…倾向（incline的过去分词）

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

name: indifference
trans: n. 漠不关心；冷淡；不重视；中立

sentences.english: Whether you stay or leave is a matter of total indifference to me (= I do not care ).
sentences.chinese: 你是留是走我根本无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: lack of interest or concern

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: innovative
trans: adj. 革新的，创新的；新颖的；有创新精神的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: institute
trans: vt. 开始（调查）；制定；创立；提起（诉讼）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: intellectual
trans: n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者
adj. 智力的；聪明的；理智的

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: intelligible
trans: adj. 可理解的；明了的；仅能用智力了解的

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: interpersonal
trans: adj. 人际的；人与人之间的

sentences.english: interpersonal skills
sentences.chinese: 人际交往技巧

sentences.english: interpersonal communication
sentences.chinese: 人际沟通

detailed_translations.chinese: 人与人之间的， 关于人与人之间关系的
detailed_translations.english: relating to relationships between people

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

sentences.english: Some parts of the report could be misinterpreted.
sentences.chinese: 报告的某些部分可能会被误解。

detailed_translations.english: to not understand the correct meaning of something that someone says or does, or of facts that you are considering

name: interview
trans: n. 接见，采访；面试，面谈
vt. 采访；接见；对…进行面谈；对某人进行面试

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

name: interviewer
trans: n. 采访者；会见者；面谈者；进行面试者

sentences.english: Being a good interviewer, however, requires much preparation and skill.
sentences.chinese: 不过，好的采访者需要许多准备和技巧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 采访者；会见者；面谈者；进行面试者
detailed_translations.english: the person who asks the questions in an interview

name: interviewee
trans: n. 被接见者；被访问者

sentences.english: Is there any interviewee who stands out as memorable?
sentences.chinese: 参加面试的人中有没有特别值得注意的？

detailed_translations.english: the person who answers the questions in an interview

name: isolate
trans: vt. 使隔离；使孤立；使绝缘

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: attorney
trans: n. 律师；代理人；检查官

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: lengthy
trans: adj. 漫长的，冗长的；啰唆的

sentences.english: A lengthy period of training is required.
sentences.chinese: 需要很长一段时间的培训。

sentences.english: An accident is causing some lengthy delays.
sentences.chinese: 一起事故造成长时间的延误。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time, often too long

sentences.english: a jacket with a silk lining
sentences.chinese: 有丝绸衬里的夹克

detailed_translations.english: a piece of material that covers the inside of something, especially a piece of clothing

sentences.english: a lightning attack
sentences.chinese: 闪电式突袭

detailed_translations.english: very fast, and often without warning
a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder

name: literary
trans: adj. 文学的；书面的；精通文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: logical
trans: adj. 合逻辑的，合理的；逻辑学的

sentences.english: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有住宅区，新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。

sentences.english: a logical conclusion
sentences.chinese: 合理的结论

detailed_translations.chinese: 逻辑的， 合乎常理的
detailed_translations.english: seeming reasonable and sensible

name: psychological
trans: adj. 心理的；心理学的；精神上的

sentences.english: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
sentences.chinese: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。

sentences.english: Freud’s psychological theories
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论

sentences.english: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
sentences.chinese: 病人的心理状态如何？

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour

sentences.english: With geological maps, books, and atlases you can find out all the proven sites of precious minerals.
sentences.chinese: 有了地质地图、书籍和地图册，你就可以找到所有已探明的珍贵矿藏的位置。

detailed_translations.english: Geological means relating to geology

name: lottery
trans: n. 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法

sentences.english: a lottery ticket
sentences.chinese: 彩票

sentences.english: Do you really think winning the lottery would make you happy?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为彩票中奖会带给你幸福吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法
detailed_translations.english: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

name: gamble
trans: vi. 赌博；孤注一掷；投机；打赌
vt. 赌博；孤注一掷；冒险假设

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

sentences.english: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了他的内阁。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.chinese: 赌博； 投机， 冒险
detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: lore
trans: n. 知识；学问；全部传说；（动物的）眼光知识

sentences.english: According to local lore, a ghost still haunts the castle.
sentences.chinese: 根据当地人的传说，城堡里至今仍然闹鬼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 知识；学问；全部传说；（动物的）眼光知识
detailed_translations.english: knowledge or information about a subject, for example nature or magic, that is not written down but is passed from person to person

name: luxury
trans: n. 奢侈，奢华；奢侈品；享受

sentences.english: He was leading a life of luxury in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚过着豪华舒适的生活。

sentences.english: The dress is lambswool – pure luxury.
sentences.chinese: 礼服是用羔羊毛制作的——绝对奢华。

sentences.english: luxuries like chocolate and perfume
sentences.chinese: 巧克力、香水之类的奢侈品

detailed_translations.english: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

name: luxuriant
trans: adj. 繁茂的；丰富的；奢华的；肥沃的

sentences.english: luxuriant black hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的黑发

sentences.english: luxuriant vegetation
sentences.chinese: 茂盛的草木

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；丰富的；奢华的；肥沃的
detailed_translations.english: growing strongly and thickly

name: luxurious
trans: adj. 奢侈的；丰富的；放纵的；特级的

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: makeup
trans: n. 化妆品；组成；补充；补考

sentences.english: Normally she wore little makeup, but this evening was clearly an exception.
sentences.chinese: 通常她很少化妆，可今晚显然是个例外。

sentences.english: There was some fatal flaw in his makeup, and as time went on he lapsed into long silences or became off-hand.
sentences.chinese: 他性格中有某种致命的缺陷，随着时间的推移，他要么陷入长时间沉默要么行为随便。

sentences.english: The ideological makeup of the unions is now radically different from what it had been.
sentences.chinese: 这些协会的意识形态构成如今与过去大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: Makeup consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance

sentences.english: the cosmetic industry
sentences.chinese: 化妆品行业

sentences.english: cosmetic products
sentences.chinese: 美容产品

sentences.english: Are you on the diet for health or cosmetic reasons?
sentences.chinese: 你节食是为了健康还是为了美丽？

sentences.english: ...the cosmetics counter of a department store.
sentences.chinese: …一个百货商店的化妆品专柜。

detailed_translations.english: intended to make your hair, skin, body etc look more attractive
Cosmetics are substances such as lipstick or powder, which people put on their face to make themselves look more attractive

name: massive
trans: adj. 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；原理，途径；进程；机械装置；技巧

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: millennial
trans: adj. 一千年的；千禧年的

name: moderate
trans: adj. 稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: modest
trans: adj. 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: conditioner
trans: n. 调节器；调节剂；调料槽

sentences.english: suntan lotion
sentences.chinese: 防晒露

detailed_translations.english: a liquid mixture that you put on your skin or hair to clean,  soften  , or protect it

name: momentum
trans: n. 势头； 动量；动力；冲力

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: necessarily
trans: adv. 必要地；必定地，必然地

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

sentences.english: We’re obviously going to need more help.
sentences.chinese: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。

sentences.english: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，这要花点时间。

sentences.english: Cost is obviously important.
sentences.chinese: 费用当然很重要。

sentences.english: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 她皱起眉头，显然感到不解。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

name: offering
trans: n. 提供；祭品；奉献物；牲礼

sentences.english: ...the holiest of the Shinto rituals, where offerings are made at night to the great Sun.
sentences.chinese: …神道教仪式中最神圣的部分，祭品在夜间献给伟大的太阳神。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to God

name: operation
trans: n. 操作；经营； 手术； 运算

sentences.english: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

detailed_translations.english: an action done by a computer

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: pessimism
trans: n. 悲观，悲观情绪；厌世主义

sentences.english: ...universal pessimism about the economy.
sentences.chinese: …对经济形势普遍的悲观看法。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that bad things will happen

name: option
trans: n.  选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: orient
trans: vt. 使适应；确定方向；使朝东

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: origin
trans: n. 起源；原点；出身；开端

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: original
trans: n. 原件；原作；原物；原型
adj. 原始的；最初的；独创的；新颖的

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

name: result
trans: n. 结果；成绩；答案；比赛结果

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌
vt. 使达到最高点；使竖起
vi. 消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: peer
trans: n. 贵族；同等的人；同龄人

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: peep
trans: n. 偷看；隐约看见，瞥见
vi. 窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫

sentences.english: "Fourteen minutes," Chris said, taking a peep at his watch.
sentences.chinese: “十四分钟，”克里斯瞥了一眼手表说道。

detailed_translations.english: a quick or secret look at something

detailed_translations.chinese: 窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫
detailed_translations.english: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially through a hole or opening

name: percentage
trans: n. 百分比；百分率，百分数

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .
sentences.chinese: 按百分比来看，这些数字很小。

detailed_translations.english: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: phrase
trans: n. 短语, 习语, 措辞, 乐句
vt. 措词, 将(乐曲)分成乐句

sentences.english: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: reference
trans: n. 参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

sentences.english: "Manners used to be enforced through fear and deference to the Maker, the monarch, and the men, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他继续说：“礼仪规范过去通过对上帝，君主和男子的畏惧和顺从得以实现。

sentences.english: The second virtue they develop is deference, the willingness to listen and learn from the moral and intellectual storehouses of the people you are trying to elp.
sentences.chinese: 他们发展的第二个美德是顺从敬意，乐意听从其他他们试图帮助的品行端正和智慧的人，并从他们知识宝库中学习。

sentences.english: In practice, each public school is an independent kingdom that pays nominal deference to education authorities.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每一所公办学校都是一个独立的王国，名义上顺从教育当局。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: absence
trans: n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: former
trans: n. 模型，样板；起形成作用的人
adj. 从前的，前者的；前任的

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: prioritize
trans: vi. 把事情按优先顺序排好

sentences.english: You need to prioritize your tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first

name: proceed
trans: vi. 开始；继续进行；发生；行进

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: production
trans: n. 成果；产品；生产；作品

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员
adj. 专业的；职业的；职业性的

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: expert

sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

sentences.chinese: 农舍以及其他的农场建筑

sentences.chinese: 附有英语字幕的法国电影

sentences.chinese: 《洛娜·杜恩》的副标题是《埃克斯穆尔的一个浪漫故事》。

detailed_translations.english: the words printed over a film in a foreign language to translate what is being said by the actors

sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

sentences.chinese: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

sentences.english: He tried to pass off a false Dagas on the auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 他试着把假的德加的画卖给拍卖人。

sentences.english: The most talkative is the least intelligent, and there is hardly a difference between an orator and an auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 话最多的人是最不聪明的人，在一个演说家和一个拍卖人之间，几乎没有分别。

sentences.english: The auctioneer shall state the drawbacks of auction targets to the bidders.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖人应当向竞买人说明拍卖标的的瑕疵。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of selling the things at an auction and who calls out how much money has already been offered for something

name: authenticate
trans: vt. 鉴定；证明…是真实的

sentences.english: The painting has been authenticated by experts.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画专家鉴定为真迹。

sentences.english: passwords which can authenticate electronic documents
sentences.chinese: 能够验证电子文档的密码

detailed_translations.english: to prove that something is true or real

name: automate
trans: vt. 使自动化，使自动操作

sentences.english: Cash machines automate two basic functions of a bank – deposits and withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 柜员机使银行的两个基本功能——存款和取款自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

name: mechanize
trans: vt. 使机械化；机动化；用机械装置

sentences.english: Only gradually are technologies being developed to mechanize the task.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地科技才发展到能使这项任务机械化。

detailed_translations.english: If someone mechanizes a process, they cause it to be done by a machine or machines, when it was previously done by people

name: availability
trans: n. 可用性；有效性；实用性

sentences.english: the availability of cheap flights
sentences.chinese: 有廉价机票出售

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being at hand when needed

sentences.english: Several men are awaiting trial for robbery.
sentences.chinese: 几个人因抢劫正在候审。

detailed_translations.english: to wait for something

name: aware
trans: adj. 意识到的；知道的；有…方面知识的；懂世故的

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

sentences.english: The old man grew vegetables in his backyard.
sentences.chinese: 老人在屋后院子里种了蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: a small area behind a house, covered with a hard surface

name: beat
trans: n. 拍子；敲击；有规律的一连串敲打
adj. 筋疲力尽的；疲惫不堪的
vi. 打；打败；拍打；有节奏地舒张与收缩

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

name: block
trans: n. 块；街区；大厦；障碍物
adj. 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的
vt. 阻止；阻塞；限制；封盖

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

name: bold
trans: adj. 大胆的，英勇的；黑体的；厚颜无耻的；险峻的

sentences.english: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.english: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

name: boom
trans: vi. 急速发展；发隆隆声

sentences.english: The boom has created job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

sentences.english: the economic boom of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.english: The economy went from boom to bust (=  from increasing to decreasing  ) very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

detailed_translations.english: a quick increase of business activity

name: campus
trans: n. （大学）校园；大学，大学生活；校园内的草地

sentences.english: a beautiful campus in New England
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰的一个美丽校园

detailed_translations.english: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live

name: capital
trans: n. 首都，省会；资金；大写字母；资本家
adj. 首都的；重要的；大写的

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: cautious
trans: adj. 谨慎的；十分小心的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: precautious
trans: a. 有防备的, 警惕的, 戒备的

name: characterise
trans: vt. 是…的特征; 以…为特征; 描述（人或物）的特性; 描绘

detailed_translations.chinese: 刻划……的性格；表示……的特性

name: characterize
trans: vt. 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: charitable
trans: adj. 慈善事业的；慷慨的，仁慈的；宽恕的

sentences.english: charitable groups
sentences.chinese: 慈善团体

sentences.english: a charitable donation
sentences.chinese: 慈善捐赠

detailed_translations.english: relating to giving help to the poor

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的，大方的；宽宏大量的；有雅量的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: sympathetic
trans: n. 交感神经；容易感受的人
adj. 同情的；交感神经的；共鸣的；赞同的；和谐的；合意的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

sentences.english: couples who deliberately remain childless
sentences.chinese: 故意不要孩子的夫妇

detailed_translations.english: having no children

sentences.english: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
sentences.chinese: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

detailed_translations.english: without a home

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: classical
trans: adj. 古典的；经典的；传统的；第一流的

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: classic
trans: n. 名著；经典著作；大艺术家
adj. 经典的；古典的，传统的；最优秀的

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

sentences.english: independent organizations and alliances
sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

name: coax
trans: vt. 哄；哄诱；慢慢将…弄好

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

sentences.english: Shake the rope and let the coils unwind.
sentences.chinese: 抖动绳索把绳圈展开。

sentences.english: a coil of wire
sentences.chinese: 一圈金属线

sentences.english: Mist coiled around the tops of the hills.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾盘绕着山巅。

detailed_translations.english: one ring of wire, rope etc in a continuous series
to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this

name: coin
trans: vt. 铸造（货币）；杜撰，创造

sentences.english: Toss a coin to see who goes first.
sentences.chinese: 抛硬币决定谁先来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
to make pieces of money from metal

name: collective
trans: n. 集团；集合体；集合名词
adj. 集体的；共同的；集合的；集体主义的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: mutual
trans: adj. 共同的；相互的，彼此的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: joint
trans: n. 关节；接缝；接合处，接合点；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉
adj. 共同的；连接的；联合的，合办的
vt. 连接，贴合；接合；使有接头

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: commitment
trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: liability
trans: n. 责任；债务；倾向；可能性；不利因素

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: complicate
trans: vt. 使复杂化；使恶化；使卷入

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: conclude
trans: vt. 推断；决定，作结论；结束

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: Well, at least I can face them all with a clear conscience (= the knowledge that you have done nothing wrong ) .
sentences.chinese: 好吧，至少我可以问心无愧地面对他们所有人。

sentences.english: I can’t tell you what to do – it’s a matter of conscience (= something that you must make a moral judgment about ) .
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你怎么办——这是良心问题。

sentences.english: a crisis of conscience among medical staff (= a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what is the right thing to do )
sentences.chinese: 医务人员中的良心危机

detailed_translations.english: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: compose
trans: vt. 构成；写作；使平静；排…的版

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

name: consistently
trans: adv. 一贯地；一致地；坚实地

sentences.english: Instead, we should be articulating guidelines that answer consistently the questions: Who should we support in the Middle East?
sentences.chinese: 而我们应该作为回答这一系列一致问题的清晰指向标。 例如，“在中东我们应该支持谁？”

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

sentences.english: She was enraged by his presumption.
sentences.chinese: 她被他的放肆激怒了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true because it is very likely

name: resumption
trans: n. 恢复；重新开始；取回；重获；恢复硬币支付

sentences.english: If the interruption cause is water flow system trouble, do not usewater right after supply resumption but keep it running around 2 minutes andmake sure water quality is acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 如因供水管路故障导致的停水，在供水恢复后，应打开水龙头放水2分钟左右，经确认水质合格后，方可使用。

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an activity again after stopping or being interrupted

name: content
trans: n. 内容，目录；满足；容量

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触
vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: deny
trans: vt. 否定，否认；拒绝给予；拒绝…的要求

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会合， 互相靠拢； 聚集， 集中； 趋近
detailed_translations.english: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing

name: diverge
trans: vi. 分歧；偏离；分叉；离题

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

sentences.english: American consumers prefer white eggs; conversely, British buyers like brown eggs.
sentences.chinese: 美国的消费者喜欢白色的鸡蛋，而英国的消费者却相反，他们喜欢棕色的鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: used when one situation is the opposite of another

sentences.english: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

name: correlation
trans: n.  相关，关联；相互关系

sentences.english: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.
sentences.chinese: …吸烟和疾病之间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two ideas, facts etc, especially when one may be the cause of the other

name: correspond
trans: vi. 符合，一致；相应；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
