sentences.english: He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 他对艺术很热衷，在我看来已经到了痴迷的程度。

sentences.english: She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession.
sentences.chinese: 她尽心尽力地照顾他，简直到了沉迷的地步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痴迷；困扰；[内科][心理] 强迫观念
detailed_translations.english: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else

name: obvious
trans: adj. 明显的；显著的；平淡无奇的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: occupation
trans: n. 职业；占有；消遣；占有期

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: oppressive
trans: adj. 压迫的；沉重的；压制性的；难以忍受的

sentences.english: The new laws will be just as oppressive as those they replace.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将跟被它所取代的那些法律一样不公正。

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫的；沉重的；压制性的；难以忍受的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a society, its laws, or customs as oppressive, you think they treat people cruelly and unfairly

name: outbreak
trans: n. （战争的）爆发；（疾病的）发作

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: overwhelmingly
trans: adv. 压倒性地；不可抵抗地

name: pave
trans: vt. 铺设；安排；作铺设之用

sentences.english: a paved courtyard
sentences.chinese: 地面铺砌过的院子

detailed_translations.english: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or  concrete

sentences.english: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
sentences.chinese: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。

sentences.english: a pavement cafe
sentences.chinese: 路边咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: conceive
trans: vt. 怀孕；构思；以为；持有

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: permanent
trans: adj. 永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: perpetual
trans: adj. 永久的；不断的；四季开花的；无期限的

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

sentences.english: He asked permission to leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 他请求离开房间的许可。

sentences.english: They cannot leave the country without permission.
sentences.chinese: 没有许可他们不得离开这个国家。

detailed_translations.english: the act of allowing sb to do sth, especially when this is done by sb in a position of authority

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: placement
trans: n. 布置；定位球；人员配置

name: popularity
trans: n. 普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: peculiarity
trans: n. 特性；特质；怪癖；奇特

sentences.english: The lack of a written constitution is a peculiarity of the British political system.
sentences.chinese: 没有一部成文宪法是英国政治制度的一大特点。

sentences.english: Margaret regarded her mother’s peculiarities with a fond tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特宽容地看待母亲的怪癖。

detailed_translations.english: something that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation etc

sentences.english: Skinner was the psychologist who popularized behavior modification.
sentences.chinese: 斯金纳就是那位使行为矫正概念得到普及的心理学家。

detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult subject or idea able to be easily understood by ordinary people who have no special knowledge about it

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: section
trans: n. 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节
vt. 把…分段；将…切片；对…进行划分
vi. 被切割成片；被分成部分

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: pose
trans: vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作
vt. 造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论
n. 姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: positively
trans: adv. 肯定地；明确地；断然地；乐观地

sentences.english: Some holiday destinations are positively dangerous .
sentences.chinese: 有些度假地真的很危险。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is true, especially when this seems surprising

name: possess
trans: vt. 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

sentences.english: Anaesthetics and bottle feeding were popular in the early postwar years.
sentences.chinese: 麻醉药和奶瓶喂养在战后早些年代非常流行。

detailed_translations.english: Postwar is used to describe things that happened, existed, or were made in the period immediately after a war, especially World War II, 1939-45

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
sentences.chinese: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品
vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: prevalent
trans: adj. 流行的；普遍的，广传的

sentences.english: the prevalent belief in astrology
sentences.chinese: 对占星术的普遍相信

detailed_translations.english: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

name: common
trans: adj. 共同的；普通的；一般的；通常的

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: beforehand
trans: adj. 提前的；预先准备好的

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: prior
trans: adj. 优先的；在先的，在前的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权； 优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: superficial
trans: adj. 表面的；肤浅的 ；表面文章的；外表的；（人）浅薄的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: prompting
trans: v. 促进；激起；鼓舞（prompt的ing形式）

name: propel
trans: vt. 推进；驱使；激励；驱策

sentences.english: a boat propelled by a small motor
sentences.chinese: 由小马达驱动的小船

sentences.english: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

detailed_translations.english: to move, drive, or push something forward

name: properly
trans: adv. 适当地；正确地；恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: improper
trans: adj. 不正确的，错误的；不适当的；不合礼仪的

sentences.english: 25 officers were investigated following allegations of improper conduct.
sentences.chinese: 25名警官被指控行为不当而受到调查。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or morally wrong

name: prosecute
trans: vt. 检举；贯彻；从事；依法进行
vi. 起诉；告发；作检察官

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: proclaim
trans: vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: declare
trans: vt. 宣布，声明；断言，宣称

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；述说；预示；播报
vi. 宣布参加竞选；当播音员

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: pursue
trans: vt. 继续；从事；追赶；纠缠

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: pursuit
trans: n. 追赶，追求；职业，工作

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

name: puzzle
trans: vt. 使…困惑；使…为难；苦思而得出

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格；条件；限制；赋予资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: certificate
trans: vt. 发给证明书；以证书形式授权给…；用证书批准

sentences.english: birth/death/marriage certificate (=giving details of someone’s birth, death, or marriage)
sentences.chinese: 出生/死亡/结婚证书

sentences.english: a degree certificate
sentences.chinese: 学位证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 证书，证件，执照；（毕业）文凭，合格证书
detailed_translations.english: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

name: diploma
trans: n. 毕业证书，学位证书；公文，文书；奖状

sentences.english: a High School diploma
sentences.chinese: 高中毕业文凭

detailed_translations.english: a document showing that a student has successfully completed their high school or university education

name: degree
trans: n. 程度，等级；度；学位；阶层

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: rare
trans: adj. 稀有的；稀薄的；半熟的
adj. 杰出的；极度的；非常好的

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的
adv. 仅仅；几乎不；几乎没有

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: rarity
trans: n. 罕见；珍贵；珍品（需用复数）；稀薄

sentences.english: Visitors were a rarity in the village.
sentences.chinese: 村里极少有外人来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罕见；珍贵；珍品（需用复数）；稀薄
detailed_translations.english: to not happen or exist very often

name: readily
trans: adv. 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: reduction
trans: n. 减少；下降；缩小；还原反应

sentences.english: strategies for noise reduction
sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

sentences.english: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
sentences.chinese: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

detailed_translations.english: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["weapons of mass destruction"]}
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
sentences.chinese: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏

sentences.english: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏， 毁灭； 消灭
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

name: reference
trans: n. 参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: quotation
trans: n.  报价单；引用语；引证

sentences.chinese: 下文引自19世纪的一篇旅行日记。

sentences.english: a dictionary of quotations
sentences.chinese: 引语词典，语录汇编

sentences.english: a quotation for car insurance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险的报价单

trans: n. 引用，引证； 传票；褒扬

sentences.chinese: 这篇文章开头引用了《哈姆雷特》中的一句话。

detailed_translations.english: a line taken from a book, speech etc

sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

trans: n. <主英>反射，反射光; 反射作用（等于reflection）

sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: His speech was an accurate reflexion of the public mood.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 他的讲话是公众情绪的准确反映

sentences.english: ...the reflexion of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:  …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: regardless
trans: adj. 不管的；不顾的；不注意的
adv. 不顾后果地；不管怎样，无论如何；不惜费用地

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: area
trans: n. 区域，地区；面积；范围

sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

detailed_translations.english: a particular part of a country, town etc

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

name: regulatory
trans: adj. 管理的；控制的；调整的

sentences.english: Perhaps the best reason for regulators to be suspicious about innovation is that so much of it in the modern world is aimed at facilitating regulatory and tax arbitrage.
sentences.chinese: 监管者之所以对创新怀有疑虑，最关键的原因可能在于，现代社会中太多创新的目的都是为监管和税收套利提供便利。

name: reject
trans: n. 被弃之物或人；次品
vt. 拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃

sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: relation
trans: n. 关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

trans: n. 亲戚；相关物； 关系词；亲缘植物
adj. 相对的；有关系的；成比例的

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else

name: relevant
trans: adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: unwilling
trans: adj. 不愿意的；不情愿的；勉强的

sentences.english: an unwilling helper
sentences.chinese: 勉强来帮忙的人

detailed_translations.english: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

name: render
trans: vt. 致使；提出；实施；着色；以…回报

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要； 履历，简历
vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: retreat
trans: n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: revival
trans: n. 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神；再生效

sentences.english: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something becomes active or strong again

name: survival
trans: n. 幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

trans: vt. 发动革命；彻底改革；宣传革命

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
sentences.chinese: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。

sentences.english: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
sentences.chinese: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

name: ritualistic
trans: adj. 仪式的；固守仪式的；惯例的

name: root
trans: vt. 生根，固定；根源在于

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: royal
trans: adj. 皇家的；盛大的；女王的；高贵的；第一流的

sentences.english: the royal palace
sentences.chinese: 王宫

sentences.english: the royal family
sentences.chinese: 王室

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

name: loyal
trans: adj. 忠诚的，忠心的；忠贞的
n. 效忠的臣民；忠实信徒

sentences.english: a loyal supporter of the team
sentences.chinese: 球队的忠实支持者

sentences.english: her many years of loyal service to the company
sentences.chinese: 她在公司多年的忠诚服务

sentences.english: loyal customers
sentences.chinese: 忠实客户

detailed_translations.english: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

sentences.english: companies that are polluting and destroying the environment

n. 敏感的人；有灵异能力的人

sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

Sharp is also an adverb

trans: adj. 钝的，不锋利的；生硬的；直率的

name: snack
trans: n. 小吃，快餐；一份，部分

sentences.chinese: 我赶紧吃了点零食。

sentences.english: Drinks and light snacks are served at the bar.

if a river, road, train, or line snakes somewhere, it moves in long twisting curves

trans: adj. 社交的；好交际的；友善的

sentences.chinese: 这个社会学家的发现是非常有趣的，因为他们在一次的说明我们现在做的和我们未来获得的结果有关系。

sentences.chinese: 美国不仅不应该存在社会阶级，而且那几乎是一个肮脏的词——用一位社会学家的话来说就是“美国所禁忌的思想”。

trans: adj. 庄严的，严肃的；隆重的，郑重的

trans: vt. 划分；除；分开；使产生分歧

trans: n. 赞助；发起；保证人的地位；教父母身份

trans: vt. 使…符合标准；使…标准化；使…统一

v. 使合乎标准；按标准校准；制定标准（standardize的过去分词）

sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

trans: n. 股份，股票；库存；血统；树干；家畜

vt. 进货；备有；装把手于…

sentences.chinese: 位于伦敦西区的一家有格调的饭店

sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.chinese: 研究所

sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.chinese: 这种情感是非常有趣的，是一种高傲和自卑的结合体。

sentences.chinese: 我的自卑和我对困难的恐惧都消失了。

sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.chinese: 这对于我的婚姻、持续性的成功和我可持续性的生活来说都是不公平的。

sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.chinese: 你只需要搜索艺术家、歌曲、相册、或者仅仅是一个随机搜索标签。

sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

name: tease

n. 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: transient
trans: n. 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: momentary
trans: adj. 瞬间的；短暂的；随时会发生的

sentences.english: There was a momentary pause.
sentences.chinese: 停顿了片刻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬间的；短暂的；随时会发生的

name: thus
trans: adv. 因此；从而；这样；如此

sentences.chinese: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁，因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

sentences.chinese: 中西部地区一个极小的社区

sentences.chinese: 耳环很小。

sentences.english: a tiny little baby
sentences.chinese: 丁点大的婴儿

sentences.english: She always felt a tiny bit sad.
sentences.chinese: 她总是感到一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: Bad teachers are a tiny minority .
sentences.chinese: 差老师只占极少数。

sentences.english: tiny pieces of paper
sentences.chinese: 碎纸屑片

name: giant
trans: n. 巨人；伟人； 巨大的动物

sentences.chinese: 一家电子产品巨头

sentences.english: a giant tortoise
sentences.chinese: 巨龟

detailed_translations.english: extremely big, and much bigger than other things of the same type

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨人，巨物；才智超群的人

name: tolerance
trans: n. 公差；宽容；容忍；公差

sentences.english: ...his tolerance and understanding of diverse human nature.
sentences.chinese: …他对各种人性的宽容和理解。

detailed_translations.english: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

trans: n. 接触；触觉；格调；少许
vt. 接触；触动；使轻度受害
vi. 触摸；涉及；接近；提到

sentences.english: She reached out to touch his arm.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。

sentences.english: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
sentences.chinese: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

sentences.english: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.english: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone

trans: n. 移动；步骤；迁居；策略
vi. 移动；搬家，迁移；离开

sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this

name: affect
trans: n. 情感；引起感情的因素
vt. 影响；感染；感动；假装

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

sentences.chinese: 女性必须在那些传统上被禁止的每一个领域中证明自己。

sentences.chinese: 正如我们所看到的那样，那些变更是跨学科的，并且在传统上并不属于版本工程学要求的一部分。

sentences.english: To be successful selling to them, you have to cater to their emotions and concerns more than ever before, even when selling products that men traditionally buy.
sentences.chinese: 为了成功的向她们推销，你必须比以往更加迎合这部分人群的情感和关切，甚至传统上由男人来购买的产品也是一样。

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: transformation
trans: n.  转化；转换；改革；变形

sentences.chinese: 近些年，电影业经历了巨大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: a complete change in someone or something

trans: n. 过渡；转变； 转换；变调

sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户

sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: shift
trans: n. 移动；变化；手段；轮班

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

sentences.english: ...a period of political uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: …一段政治不稳定时期。

detailed_translations.english: Uncertainty is a state of doubt about the future or about what is the right thing to do

name: ambiguity
trans: n. 含糊；不明确；暧昧；模棱两可的话

sentences.english: legal ambiguities
sentences.chinese: 法律上含混不清的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 含糊；不明确；暧昧；模棱两可的话
detailed_translations.english: the state of being unclear, confusing, or not certain, or things that produce this effect

name: universal
trans: adj. 普遍的；通用的；宇宙的；全世界的；全体的

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

name: common
trans: adj. 共同的；普通的；一般的；通常的

sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

trans: adj. 不必要的；多余的，无用的

trans: adj. 不切实际的；不实在的

sentences.chinese: 有些家长对老师抱着完全不切实际的期望。

name: unreliable
trans: adj. 不可靠的；靠不住的

sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的性能变得非常不稳定。

trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

trans: n. 紧急；催促；紧急的事

sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，打电话给警察。

sentences.chinese: 我欣赏这种紧迫的感觉因为我自己就能体会到。

sentences.english: However pressing the need and urgency of the problem one should not proceed without a plausible plan.
sentences.chinese: 无论需要多么紧迫，问题多么紧急，一个人不能没有看似有理的计划就开始行动。

sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

name: fade
trans: vi. 褪色；凋谢；逐渐消失

sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

name: vast
trans: n. 浩瀚；广阔无垠的空间
adj. 广阔的；巨大的；大量的；巨额的

sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的

sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

trans: adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。
