trans: adj. 生动的；鲜明的；鲜艳的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

sentences.english: vocational qualifications
sentences.chinese: 职业资格

detailed_translations.english: teaching or relating to the skills you need to do a particular job

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员
adj. 专业的；职业的；职业性的

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: vote
trans: n. 投票，选举；选票；得票数
vt. 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

sentences.english: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.
sentences.chinese: 他决定把余生奉献给科学研究。

detailed_translations.english: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: tough
trans: adj. 艰苦的，困难的；坚强的，不屈不挠的；坚韧的，牢固的；强壮的，结实的

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: watershed
trans: n. （美）流域；分水岭；集水区；转折点

sentences.english: The election of Mary Robinson in 1990 was a watershed in Irish politics.
sentences.chinese: 1990年玛丽·鲁滨逊的当选是爱尔兰政治的分水岭。

detailed_translations.chinese: （美）流域；分水岭；集水区；转折点
detailed_translations.english: an event or time when important changes happen in history or in your life

name: wealthy
trans: adj. 富有的；充分的；丰裕的

sentences.english: the wealthy nations of the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上的富国

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of money, possessions etc

sentences.english: Singing can create a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌能产生一种幸福感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健康， 幸福； 福利
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

name: widespread
trans: adj. 普遍的，广泛的；分布广的

sentences.english: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

name: common
trans: adj. 共同的；普通的；一般的；通常的

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: worthless
trans: adj. 无价值的；不值钱的；卑微的

sentences.english: The house was full of worthless junk.
sentences.chinese: 这房子里堆满了没有用的东西。

sentences.english: The information was worthless to me.
sentences.chinese: 这些资料对我毫无用处。

detailed_translations.english: something that is worthless has no value, importance, or use

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

sentences.english: I’ve never lived abroad before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未在国外生活过。

sentences.english: She often goes abroad on business.
sentences.chinese: 她经常出国公干。

sentences.english: We never travelled abroad when we were kids.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候从来没有去国外旅行过。

sentences.english: goods imported from abroad
sentences.chinese: 从国外进口的商品

sentences.english: The books about Harry Potter have been very popular, both at home and abroad .
sentences.chinese: 有关哈利·波特的书在国内外一直都很流行。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a foreign country

name: aboard
trans: adv. 在飞机上； 在船上；在火车上

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing all 200 people aboard.
sentences.chinese: 飞机失事，机上200人全部遇难。

sentences.english: The boat swayed as he stepped aboard.
sentences.chinese: 他上船时，船晃了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在飞机上；[船] 在船上；在火车上
detailed_translations.english: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
on or onto a ship, plane, or train

name: absolute
trans: adj. 绝对的；完全的；专制的

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: abundant
trans: adj. 丰富的；充裕的；盛产

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: ample
trans: adj. 丰富的；足够的；宽敞的

sentences.english: an ample bosom
sentences.chinese: 丰满的胸部

detailed_translations.english: more than enough

name: abuse
trans: n. 滥用；虐待；辱骂；弊端；恶习，陋习

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: accommodate
trans: vt. 容纳；使适应；供应；调解

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: accommodation
trans: n. 住处，膳宿；调节；和解；预订铺位

sentences.english: The price for the holiday includes flights and accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 度假的价格包括机票和住宿。

sentences.english: living accommodations for the crews
sentences.chinese: 船员的起居舱

sentences.english: travel and hotel accommodations
sentences.chinese: 旅行及酒店住宿

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["rented accommodation"]}
sentences.chinese: 租用的住处

sentences.english: secure accommodation for young offenders
sentences.chinese: 严密看管的少年犯囚室

sentences.english: Universities have to provide student accommodation for first-year students.
sentences.chinese: 大学必须为一年级生提供学生宿舍。

detailed_translations.english: a place for someone to stay, live, or work

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: accomplishment
trans: n. 成就；完成；技艺，技能

sentences.english: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说，这是很好的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

name: achievement
trans: n. 成就；完成；达到；成绩

sentences.english: His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.english: As we climbed the final few metres, we felt a sense of achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我们攀登最后几米的时候，有一种成就感。

detailed_translations.english: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

sentences.english: For 25 years, Darwin amassed evidence to support his theories.
sentences.chinese: 25年间，达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune after the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后，他积累了大量财富。

detailed_translations.english: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: precision
trans: n. 精度， 精密度；精确

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: acquaintance
trans: n. 熟人；相识；了解；知道

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

name: activate
trans: vt. 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

sentences.english: We continue to conduct tests, but increasingly, we conduct long conversations with her, acutely aware that our creation will raise many ethical questions on the part of the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续进行测试，但越来越多地，随着长时间的交谈，我们敏锐地意识到，我们的作品将在公众当中引起许多道德问题。

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应；改编；改编本，改写本

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

sentences.english: Tobacco is highly addictive .
sentences.chinese: 烟草很容易使人上瘾。

detailed_translations.english: if a substance, especially a drug, is addictive, your body starts to need it regularly and you are unable to stop taking it

name: adequate
trans: adj. 充足的；适当的；胜任的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: adequately
trans: adv. 充分地；足够地；适当地

sentences.english: They had equipped their workers adequately for such dangerous condition.
sentences.chinese: 他们让工人们充分装备起来， 以应付这样的危险情况。

sentences.english: I provided some teaser output, but this was not sufficently extensive nor well organized so that you could adequately interpret the results of the analysis.
sentences.chinese: 我提供了一些难处理的输出，但是这既不够充分也没进行很好的组织，以致您无法充分地解释分析结果。

sentences.english: a period of adjustment
sentences.chinese: 一段调整期

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

name: adolescent
trans: adj. 青春期的；未成熟的

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: adopt
trans: vt. 采取；接受；收养；正式通过

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

sentences.english: I’m afraid she’s also an adept liar.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕她还是一个撒谎专家。

detailed_translations.english: good at something that needs care and skill

sentences.english: Although it was a great hobby for her, she wanted to study aeronautics or astronomy as a career.
sentences.chinese: 不过这只是她一大爱好，她本想学习航空或天文作为职业。

detailed_translations.english: the science of designing and flying planes

name: aesthetic
trans: adj. 美的；美学的；审美的，具有审美趣味的

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: authentic
trans: adj. 真正的，真实的；可信的

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

sentences.english: an affectionate hug
sentences.chinese: 亲切的拥抱

detailed_translations.english: showing in a gentle way that you love someone and care about them

name: loving
trans: adj. 亲爱的；钟情的；忠诚的

sentences.english: What that child needs is plenty of loving care .
sentences.chinese: 那孩子所需要的是大量的关爱。

sentences.english: He’s very loving and affectionate with his sister.
sentences.chinese: 他很爱他的妹妹，和她很亲暱。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that shows you love someone

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: allege
trans: vt. 宣称，断言；提出…作为理由

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

name: agonizing
trans: adj. 苦恼的；痛苦难忍的
vt. 使极度痛苦；折磨（agonize的ing形式）
vi. 感到极度痛苦（agonize的ing形式）

sentences.english: He did not wish to die the agonizing death of his mother and brother.
sentences.chinese: 他不希望像他母亲和他兄弟那样痛苦地死去。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is agonizing causes you to feel great physical or mental pain

detailed_translations.chinese: 使极度痛苦；折磨（agonize的ing形式）

name: agonize
trans: vi. 感到极度痛苦；挣扎

sentences.english: As a mother, I agonize over what my children will inherit.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个母亲，我对我的孩子们将要继承的东西感到极度痛苦。

name: agony
trans: n. 苦恼；极大的痛苦；临死的挣扎

sentences.english: the agony of arthritis
sentences.chinese: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

detailed_translations.english: very severe pain

name: airy
trans: adj. 空气的；通风的；幻想的；轻快的；空中的

sentences.english: All the hotel’s bedrooms are light and airy.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的所有客房都明亮通风。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空气的；通风的；幻想的；轻快的；空中的
detailed_translations.english: an airy room or building has plenty of fresh air because it is large or has a lot of windows

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: alike
trans: adv. 以同样的方式；类似于

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

sentences.english: an oath of allegiance
sentences.chinese: 效忠宣誓

sentences.english: The people here have strong political allegiances .
sentences.chinese: 这里的民众政治忠诚度很高。

detailed_translations.english: loyalty to a leader, country, belief etc

name: allocate
trans: vt. 分配；拨出；使坐落于

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: alternative
trans: n. 二中择一；供替代的选择
adj. 供选择的；选择性的；交替的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: altogether
trans: adv. 完全地；总共；总而言之

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: ambition
trans: n. 野心，雄心；抱负，志向

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

sentences.english: The dollar has fallen in value amid rumors of weakness in the US economy.
sentences.chinese: 在一片美国经济疲软的传言中，美元贬值了。

sentences.english: Demonstrators ripped up the national flag amid shouts of ‘Death to the tyrants!’
sentences.chinese: 示威者在“处死暴君！”的叫喊声中将国旗撕得粉碎。

detailed_translations.english: while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening – used in writing or news reports

sentences.english: During some trials, an audible tone was played through the headphones, either amidst white noise or on its own, and afterwards the participants were asked if they had noticed it.
sentences.chinese: 在一些测试中，耳机里会播放一些可被听见的声音，该声音或混杂于白噪音中，或单独播放，之后，参与者将被问及是否注意到这些声音。

name: amplify
trans: vt. 放大，扩大；增强；详述

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: analyst
trans: n. 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者

sentences.english: Political analysts expect the Conservatives to win.
sentences.chinese: 政治分析家预计保守党获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: anonymous
trans: adj. 匿名的，无名的；无个性特征的

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: appearance
trans: n. 外貌，外观；出现，露面

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: emergence
trans: n. 出现，浮现；发生；露头

sentences.english: The day after that, the emergence of a new competitor.
sentences.chinese: 今后的每一天都可能出现新的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Language emerges and develops with the emergence and development of society.
sentences.chinese: 语言是随着社会的产生而产生，随着社会的发展而发展的。

sentences.english: They prefer to wait for the emergence of a new physics theory of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们更倾向于等待新的可以解释一切的理论的出现.

detailed_translations.english: when something begins to be known or noticed

name: applicable
trans: adj. 可适用的；可应用的；合适的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: applicant
trans: n. 申请人，申请者；请求者

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

name: appointment
trans: n. 任命；约定；任命的职位

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: appreciation
trans: n. 欣赏，鉴别；增值；感谢

sentences.english: He was presented with a watch in appreciation of his long service.
sentences.chinese: 他获赠一块手表，作为对其长期服务的感谢。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being grateful for something someone has done

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: approve
trans: vt. 批准；赞成；为…提供证据

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: consent
trans: n. 同意；（意见等的）一致；赞成

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

name: agree
trans: vi. vi. 同意，意见一致；约定，商定
vt. 同意，赞成；承认；约定，商定

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: rise
trans: n. 上升；高地；增加；出现
vt. 使…飞起；使…浮上水面
vi. 上升；增强；起立；高耸

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

name: array
trans: n. 数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

sentences.english: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: asset
trans: n. 资产；优点；有用的东西；有利条件；财产；有价值的人或物

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: assistance
trans: n. 援助，帮助；辅助设备

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

name: assure
trans: vt. 保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: reassure
trans: vt. 使…安心，使消除疑虑

sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

name: attorney
trans: n. 律师；代理人；检查官

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: awareness
trans: n. 意识，认识；明白，知道
n. 人群对品牌或产品的认知

sentences.english: Health officials have tried to raise awareness (=  improve people’s knowledge  ) about AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

name: awful
trans: adj. 可怕的；极坏的；使人敬畏的

sentences.english: The weather was awful.
sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

name: terrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；很糟的；令人讨厌的

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: awkward
trans: adj. 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: bang
trans: n. 刘海；重击；突然巨响
adv. 直接地；砰然地；突然巨响地

sentences.english: The baby kept banging the table with his spoon.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝不停地拿调羹敲桌子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 猛击， 猛撞； 发出砰的一声， 砰砰地响
detailed_translations.english: to hit something hard, making a loud noise
a painful blow to the body when you hit against something or something hits you
to hit something hard, making a loud noise

sentences.english: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 1999年他被披露几近破产。

sentences.english: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀加剧，破产个案也会增加。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to pay your debts

name: barely
trans: adv. 仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: hardly
trans: adv. 几乎不，简直不；刚刚

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: belt
trans: vt. 用带子系住；用皮带抽打

sentences.english: He unbuckled his leather belt.
sentences.chinese: 他解开皮带。

detailed_translations.english: a band of leather, cloth etc that you wear around your waist to hold up your clothes or for decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 用带子系住；用皮带抽打
detailed_translations.english: to fasten something with a belt

name: bend
trans: vt. 使弯曲；使屈服；使致力；使朝向
vi. 弯曲，转弯；屈服；倾向；专心于

sentences.english: Lee bent and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

detailed_translations.english: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
to become curved and no longer flat or straight
a curved part of something, especially a road or river

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: benign
trans: adj. 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: malignant
trans: adj.  恶性的；有害的；有恶意的
n. 保王党员；怀恶意的人

sentences.english: She developed a malignant tumour in her breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的乳房长了个恶性肿瘤。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 恶性的；有害的；有恶意的
detailed_translations.english: a malignant disease is one such as  cancer  , which can develop in an uncontrolled way and is likely to cause someone’s death

sentences.english: Or put it on your busines card, billboard or a bumper sticker.
sentences.chinese: 或者把它放在你的名片、布告板、或者缓冲器中。

sentences.english: I tell teams working on print ads to start by creating a billboard.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉平面广告的工作团队，从制作一个广告牌开始。

sentences.english: Stop being some company's billboard, and show us YOU.
sentences.chinese: 停止做公司的广告牌，向我们展示 你自己 。

detailed_translations.english: a large sign used for advertising

sentences.english: The book contains few biographical details.
sentences.chinese: 此书包含的生平细节很少。

detailed_translations.english: Biographical facts, notes, or details are concerned with the events in someone's life

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or works in biology

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: blunder
trans: vi. 跌跌撞撞地走；犯大错

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: blunt
trans: adj. 钝的，不锋利的；生硬的；直率的

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: sharp
trans: adj. 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
adv. 急剧地；锐利地；突然地

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

sentences.english: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentences.chinese: 不要过桥，而是向左急转下到纤道上去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
detailed_translations.english: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sharp is also an adverb

name: boast
trans: n. 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物
vt. 夸口说，自吹自擂说；以有…而自豪

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

sentences.english: Do not brag or bluff.
sentences.chinese: 不要自夸和虚张声势。

sentences.english: It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.english: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.chinese: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

name: border
trans: vt. 接近；与…接壤；在…上镶边

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: bounds
trans: v. 跳跃；弹回；限定；邻接（bound的三单形式）

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: broad
trans: adj. 宽的，辽阔的；显著的；大概的

sentences.english: We went along a broad passage.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在一条宽阔的走廊上。

sentences.english: He was six feet tall, with broad shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，肩膀宽阔。

detailed_translations.english: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

name: board
trans: n. 董事会；木板；甲板；膳食
vt. 上（飞机、车、船等）；用板盖上；给提供膳宿

sentences.english: a board meeting
sentences.chinese: 董事会会议

sentences.english: a board member
sentences.chinese: 董事会成员

detailed_translations.english: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

name: broadly
trans: adv. 明显地；宽广地；概括地；露骨地；粗鄙地

sentences.english: The president broadly got what he wanted out of his meeting.
sentences.chinese: 总统大体上得到了他想从会议中得到的东西。

name: broker
trans: vt. 以中间人等身分安排...
vi. 作为权力经纪人进行谈判

sentences.english: a real estate broker
sentences.chinese: 房地产经纪人

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells things such as  share s  in companies or foreign money for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为权力经纪人进行谈判

name: brutal
trans: adj. 残忍的；野蛮的，不讲理的

sentences.english: a brutal man
sentences.chinese: 一个凶残的男人

detailed_translations.english: very cruel and violent

name: burdensome
trans: adj. 繁重的；累赘的；恼人的

sentences.english: ...a burdensome debt.
sentences.chinese: …一笔沉重的债务。

sentences.english: The load was too burdensome.
sentences.chinese: 负担太繁重了。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as burdensome, you mean it is worrying or hard to deal with

name: bureaucratic
trans: adj. 官僚的；官僚政治的

sentences.english: Bureaucratic delays are inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义所致的延误是不可避免的。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of complicated official rules and processes

sentences.english: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
sentences.chinese: 水管爆裂，房子被水淹了两英尺。

sentences.english: a sudden burst of activity/energy/anger/enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 活动 / 能量 / 怒火 / 热情的迸发

detailed_translations.english: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

sentences.english: ‘Multimedia’ has been a buzzword in the computer industry for years.
sentences.chinese: “多媒体”这个词语在计算机行业里已经流行多年了。

detailed_translations.english: a word or phrase from one special area of knowledge that people suddenly think is very important

sentences.english: Keep it simple and avoid the use of jargon.
sentences.chinese: 简单点，避免使用术语。

detailed_translations.english: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval

name: by-product
trans: n. 副产品；附带产生的结果；意外收获

sentences.english: The raw material for the tyre is a byproduct of oil refining.
sentences.chinese: 这种轮胎的原料是汽油提炼的副产品。

detailed_translations.english: something additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process

sentences.english: ...the two fundamentally opposed social systems, capitalism and socialism.
sentences.chinese: …两种根本对立的社会制度，资本主义与社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which businesses belong mostly to private owners, not to the government

sentences.english: They declared for socialism.
sentences.chinese: 他们表示拥护社会主义。

sentences.english: We should rally under the banner of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当在社会主义的旗帜下团结起来。

sentences.english: From the Left: Yes! Yes, exactly what socialism is.
sentences.chinese: 从左边的回答：是的，这就是社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens

name: carefree
trans: adj. 无忧无虑的；不负责的

sentences.english: He thought back to the carefree days of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他回想起自己无忧无虑的童年时代。

sentences.english: a carefree attitude
sentences.chinese: 无所谓的态度

detailed_translations.english: having no worries or problems

name: caution
trans: n. 小心，谨慎；警告，警示

sentences.english: The physician must exercise caution when prescribing antidepressants.
sentences.chinese: 医师在开抗抑郁药处方时必须谨慎。

sentences.english: Business leaders are cautioning against hasty action that would hamper flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 企业领导人被告诫不要贸然采取行动，以免把事情搞僵。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very careful to avoid danger or risks
to warn someone that something might be dangerous, difficult etc

name: warn
trans: vi. 发出警告，发出预告

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: chancellor
trans: n. 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官

sentences.english: Helmut Kohl, the former German Chancellor
sentences.chinese: 赫尔穆特•科尔，德国前总理

detailed_translations.chinese: 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官
detailed_translations.english: the Chancellor of the Exchequer

sentences.english: This headmaster is very modest.
sentences.chinese: 这位校长很谦虚。

sentences.english: Our headmaster rattled on for at least two hours at the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 我们的校长在开学典礼上唠唠叨叨地讲了至少两个小时。

sentences.english: Before the door of the headmaster's office,she stopped and re-collected herself for a while.
sentences.chinese: 在校长办公室门前，她停步片刻使自己镇静下来。

detailed_translations.english: a male teacher who is in charge of a school

name: chronic
trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: circuit
trans: n.  电路，回路；巡回；一圈；环道

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: civilian
trans: adj. 民用的；百姓的，平民的

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

sentences.english: Perhaps intelligence and civilisation are not what we should be concentrating on.
sentences.chinese: 也许智能和文明不属于我们应该关注的问题。

sentences.english: If I have understood you correctly, you are proposing to do nothing to prevent the likely collapse of industrial civilisation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对你的理解正确的话，你在主张不做任何事情去防止可能的工业文明的崩溃。

sentences.english: Let us examine our history and see how men - the master race for all of our recorded history in almost every corner of every human civilisation - have fared so far.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，让我们检查一下我们的历史，并且看看男性——在我们所有现存历史，几乎每一个人类文明的角落都是统治者的族群，是如何发展的。

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: civilise
trans: vt. 教化；文明化；使开化
vi. 变成文明社会（等于civilize）

sentences.english: And the mission to civilise that was the colonial kind of project is now a mission to civilise France's own population.
sentences.chinese: 文明化工程在过去本是殖民性质的工程，可现在它却成了教化法国自己人口的工程。

name: civilize
trans: vt. 使文明；教化；使开化

sentences.english: Ellis was credited with civilizing the Texas prison system.
sentences.chinese: 据信是埃利斯改良了得克萨斯州的监狱制度。

sentences.english: The missionaries went out to civilize other places.
sentences.chinese: 传教士们去异国他乡教化当地人民。

detailed_translations.english: to educate and improve a person or a society; to make sb's behaviour or manners better

sentences.english: Letters may be edited for length and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 信件可能要加以修改以求篇幅合适，意思明了。

sentences.english: a lack of clarity in the law on property rights
sentences.chinese: 产权法律含糊不清

detailed_translations.english: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

sentences.english: We aim to offer good value and service to all our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We’ve had several letters from satisfied customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了几封顾客表示满意的来信。

sentences.english: He’s one of our regular customers .
sentences.chinese: 他是我们的一个老主顾。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys goods or services from a shop, company etc

name: cling
trans: vi. 坚持，墨守；紧贴；附着

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: stick
trans: n. 棍；手杖；呆头呆脑的人

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

sentences.english: an appointment at an outpatient clinic
sentences.chinese: 门诊预约

detailed_translations.english: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

sentences.english: The drug has undergone extensive clinical trials (= tests to see if it is effective in treating people ) .
sentences.chinese: 该药已经过大量的临床试验。

sentences.english: The therapy has helped people with clinical depression (= a strong feeling of sadness, for which you need medical help ) .
sentences.chinese: 该疗法对临床抑郁症病人有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: relating to treating or testing people who are sick

name: coincidence
trans: n. 巧合；一致；同时发生

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

sentences.english: The company is building the centre in collaboration with the Institute of Offshore Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合作， 协作； 勾结
detailed_translations.english: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

sentences.english: a teacher training college
sentences.chinese: 师范学院

sentences.english: Donna left school and went to art college.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜中学毕业后进了艺术学院。

sentences.english: Some people who want to go to college still can’t get there.
sentences.chinese: 有些想上大学的人仍然无法如愿。

detailed_translations.english: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill

name: combine
trans: n. 联合收割机；联合企业
vt. 使化合；使联合，使结合

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: unite
trans: vt. 使…混合；使…联合；使…团结

sentences.english: Our goal is to unite the opposition parties and defeat the President.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是联合各反对党挫败总统。

detailed_translations.english: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

name: commemorate
trans: vt. 庆祝，纪念；成为…的纪念

sentences.english: a parade to commemorate the town’s bicentenary
sentences.chinese: 庆祝该镇建立200周年的游行

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

name: commit
trans: vt. 犯罪，做错事；把...交托给；指派…作战；使…承担义务

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金；犯；委任；委任状
vt. 委任；使服役；委托制作

sentences.chinese: 日本人精益求精的经营哲学

sentences.chinese: 她差不多要放弃找个丈夫的希望了。

detailed_translations.english: to discover, see, or get something that you have been searching for

name: devise
trans: vt. 设计；想出；发明；图谋；遗赠给

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

name: advise
trans: vt. 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

name: revise
trans: vi. 修订；校订；复习功课

sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: digit
trans: n. 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽

sentences.english: Her telephone number differs from mine by one digit.
sentences.chinese: 她的电话号码跟我的差一个数字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽
detailed_translations.english: one of the written signs that represent the numbers 0 to 9

name: diligence
trans: n. 勤奋，勤勉；注意的程度

sentences.english: Genius is nothing but labor and diligence.
sentences.chinese: 天才无非是工作和勤奋。

sentences.english: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.chinese: 我们要养成勤俭节约的好风气。

name: disadvantaged
trans: n. 弱势团体；不利条件
adj. 贫困的；处于不利地位的；社会地位低下的
v. 使处于不利地位（disadvantage的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: disadvantaged areas of the city
sentences.chinese: 城市贫困地区

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫困的；处于不利地位的；社会地位低下的
detailed_translations.english: having social problems, such as a lack of money or education, which make it difficult for you to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于不利地位（disadvantage的过去式和过去分词）

name: deprived
trans: adj. 缺少食物的；缺乏足够教育的

sentences.english: He could see the disappointment in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看到了她眼中的失望。

sentences.english: Several people expressed disappointment at the delay.
sentences.chinese: 有好几个人对这次延误表示失望。

sentences.english: She hid her bitter disappointment .
sentences.chinese: 她把深深的沮丧掩饰起来。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of unhappiness because something is not as good as you expected, or has not happened in the way you hoped

sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

name: discard
trans: n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

sentences.chinese: 请随订单附上支票。

sentences.chinese: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。

sentences.chinese: 家人同意切断她的生命维持系统。

sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

sentences.chinese: 这是那种你要么喜欢要么讨厌的电影。

sentences.english: He hates his job.

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

sentences.chinese: 拆弹专家

sentences.english: ways to handle disruptive pupils

trans: vt. 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

vt. 把暴晒于场上；使上场

sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.chinese: 我过去常在那里玩多米诺骨牌游戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多米诺骨牌；面具；化装外衣

sentences.chinese: 持久和平的前景难料。

sentences.chinese: “一切都会顺顺当当的，你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

sentences.chinese: 这个统计数据大有问题。

sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: drug
trans: n. 药；毒品；麻醉药；滞销货
vt. 使服麻醉药；使服毒品；掺麻醉药于

sentences.english: a drug used in the treatment of cancer
sentences.chinese: 用于治疗癌症的一种药物

sentences.english: (= ordered for people ) by doctors can be extremely hazardous if used in the wrong way.
sentences.chinese: 医生开的处方药如果使用不当是非常危险的。

sentences.chinese: 大型制药公司利润丰厚。

sentences.chinese: 他用水冲排水沟。

sentences.chinese: 船儿无助地顺着排水沟漂流直到有人看见他。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: undramatic
trans: adj. 平淡无奇的；缺乏戏剧性的；不适合戏剧的

sentences.english: A duplicate copy should be made for the county record office.
sentences.chinese: 应该制作一个副本呈交县档案室。

sentences.english: a duplicate key
sentences.chinese: 配制的钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的， 复制的
detailed_translations.english: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的东西，复制品
detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制， 复印； 重复
detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing

name: echo
trans: vi. 随声附和；发出回声

sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall

trans: n. 经济学；国家的经济状况

sentences.english: a Harvard professor of economics
sentences.chinese: 哈佛大学的经济学教授

detailed_translations.english: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used

trans: n. 经济学者；节俭的人

sentences.english: This led me, as a behavioral economist, to an intriguing hypothesis.
sentences.chinese: 这让我，作为一个行为经济学家，想到一个有趣的假设。

sentences.english: However, the economist cannot simply give those answers and leave it at that.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经济学家不能仅仅给出那样的答案就算了事。

sentences.chinese: 张帆： 定义和解释一个概念，一般是经济学家或者MBA老师做的。

name: editor

sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编
