trans: n. 自我；自负；自我意识

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

sentences.english: students’ sense of self-esteem
sentences.chinese: 学生的自尊心

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being satisfied with your own abilities, and that you deserve to be liked or respected

name: eligible
trans: n. 合格者；适任者；有资格者
adj. 合格的，合适的；符合条件的；有资格当选的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: embody
trans: vt. 体现，使具体化；具体表达

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: empathy
trans: n. 神入；移情作用；执着
n. 感同身受；同感；共鸣

sentences.english: Having begun my life in a children's home, I have great empathy with the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 在一家儿童福利院长大使我对这些小孩子们怀有深深的同感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同感， 移情； 全神贯注
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: empirical
trans: adj. 经验主义的，完全根据经验的；实证的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: theoretical
trans: adj. 理论的；理论上的；假设的；推理的

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

sentences.english: Action and experimentation are the cornerstones of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 行动和尝试是经验主义的基石。

sentences.english: Another kind of empiricism has to do with where we get our knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 另一种经验主义与我们从哪里获取知识有关。

sentences.english: OK, so that's one kind of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 好，这是一种经验主义。

detailed_translations.english: the belief in basing your ideas on practical experience

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: able
trans: adj. 能； 有能力的；能干的

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

sentences.english: one of my more able students
sentences.chinese: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

detailed_translations.english: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

name: enact
trans: vt. 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

sentences.english: With encouragement, Sally is starting to play with the other children.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉受到了鼓励，开始和其他孩子玩起来。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["words of encouragement"]}
sentences.chinese: 鼓励的话

detailed_translations.english: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them

sentences.english: They were still driving away at the encyclopaedia.
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在孜孜不倦地编写那部百科全书。

sentences.english: I might do an eighth book for charity, a kind of encyclopaedia of the world so that I could use all the extra material that's not in the books ... we'll see!
sentences.chinese: 我可能出于慈善的目的写第八本书，大概是有关这个世界的百科全书，这样我可以使用书中没能出现的所有额外材料······敬请期待！

sentences.english: An encyclopaedia's-worth of knowledge feels trivialised when it can be generated with just a few strokes on the keyboard, just as the live chatter of the world becomes so much waste paper.
sentences.chinese: 当仅靠敲打几下键盘就能创作出那样的作品时，一种百科全书式的学问感瞬间变得微不足道，正如同那对这个世界鲜活的唠叨变成这里的一堆废纸那样。

sentences.english: the Encyclopedia of Music
sentences.chinese: 音乐百科全书

detailed_translations.english: a book or cd, or a set of these, containing facts about many different subjects, or containing detailed facts about one subject

sentences.english: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

name: endeavour
trans: vt. 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

name: endless
trans: adj. 无止境的；连续的；环状的；漫无目的的

sentences.english: an endless stream of visitors
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的游客

sentences.english: The possibilities are endless.
sentences.chinese: 有无限的可能性。

sentences.english: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
sentences.chinese: 他麻烦太多了——毒品、枪支、敲诈——说都说不完。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount, size, or number

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: stand
trans: n. 站立；立场；看台；停止

sentences.english: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。

sentences.english: She stood in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她站在门口。

sentences.english: (= do not move ) and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 站好别动，听我说。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there (= stand and not do anything ) – help me!
sentences.chinese: 不要光站在那里，帮帮我！

detailed_translations.english: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合
vt. 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: engine
trans: n. 引擎，发动机；机车，火车头；工具

sentences.english: Is the engine running smoothly?
sentences.chinese: 发动机运转平稳吗？

sentences.english: We were stranded with engine trouble on a deserted highway.
sentences.chinese: 我们因发动机故障而被困在空无一人的公路上。

sentences.english: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 1941年，火车可能已由蒸汽机车来牵引了。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

sentences.english: Progressive enhancement helps us to do that because it forces us to focus on the content and build out from there.
sentences.chinese: 渐进增强能够帮助我们做到这一点，因为它让我们关注内容并且从内容开始构建。

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；承包人；主办者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

sentences.english: I envisioned a future of educational excellence.
sentences.chinese: 我展望了一个有着优质教育的未来。

detailed_translations.english: to imagine something that you think might happen in the future, especially something that you think will be good

name: imagine
trans: vi. 想像；猜想；想像起来

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

name: episode
trans: n. 插曲；一段情节；插话；有趣的事件

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: equation
trans: n. 方程式，等式；相等； 反应式

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

sentences.english: There must be an error in our calculations.
sentences.chinese: 我们的计算肯定有错。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake

sentences.english: Everybody rushing about on some incomprehensible errand someone forced him to do at pain of death.
sentences.chinese: 大家都忍受着死亡的痛苦被迫地抢着做一些令人难以理解的差事。

sentences.english: They can view a list of errands that match their interest profile, and, by entering a price, can bid to perform the errand.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查看与他们的兴趣简档匹配的差事列表，并且，通过输入价格，可以为执行差事投标。

sentences.english: Get them a drink or a coffee, do a chore for them, offer to do an errand, anything they’d appreciate, really.
sentences.chinese: 为人递上一杯饮料或咖啡，做一些零星杂务，为别人提供一份差使等等使人感激的事情。 真的。

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: abrupt
trans: adj. 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: corrupt
trans: adj. 腐败的，贪污的；堕落的
vt. 使腐烂；使堕落，使恶化

sentences.english: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.english: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

name: paper
trans: vi. 贴糊墙纸；发交通违章传票

sentences.english: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
sentences.chinese: 我给你找张纸，你好把号码写下来。

sentences.english: Do you have a pen and paper?
sentences.chinese: 你有笔和纸吗？

sentences.english: the 1998 White Paper on political reform
sentences.chinese: 1998年政治改革白皮书

sentences.english: a paper on the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 一篇关于南北战争的论文

detailed_translations.english: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质；精华；香精

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: ethical
trans: adj. 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: evaluation
trans: n. 评价； 评估；估价；求值

sentences.english: We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.
sentences.chinese: 我们要对新系统进行合理的评估。

sentences.english: They took some samples of products for evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽取了一些产品样本以作评估。

detailed_translations.english: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is

name: evenly
trans: adv. 均匀地；平衡地；平坦地；平等地

sentences.english: The profits will be split evenly between the three of us.
sentences.chinese: 利润将由我们三人平分。

sentences.english: ‘I warned you not to phone me, ’ he said evenly.
sentences.chinese: “我告诫过你不要给我打电话。”他平静地说。

detailed_translations.english: divided in an equal way

name: uneven
trans: adj. 不均匀的；不平坦的； 奇数的

sentences.english: She walked back carefully over the uneven ground.
sentences.chinese: 她小心翼翼地从凹凸不平的地面上走回来。

detailed_translations.english: not smooth, flat, or level

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: summon
trans: vt. 召唤；召集；鼓起；振作

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: excel
trans: vi. (在某方面)胜过(或超过)别人

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: conclude
trans: vt. 推断；决定，作结论；结束

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible

name: exemplary
trans: adj. 典范的；惩戒性的；可仿效的

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: exempt
trans: n. 免税者；被免除义务者
adj. 被免除的；被豁免的

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: exhaustion
trans: n. 枯竭；耗尽；精疲力竭

sentences.english: We can define burnout as exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把burnout (燃尽)解释为 exhaustion (耗尽)。

sentences.english: Could not this very Socratic way be  a sign of collapse, exhaustion, sickness, and the dissolution of the  anarchic instinct?
sentences.chinese: 这个非常苏格拉底式的方法不能是无法无天的天性的崩塌、耗尽、疾患和解体的一个信号？

detailed_translations.english: when all of something has been used

name: empty
trans: adj. 空的；无意义的；无知的；徒劳的
vt. 使失去；使…成为空的

sentences.english: an empty box
sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 空瓶子

sentences.english: an empty space behind the desk
sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

sentences.english: The fuel tank’s almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 燃油箱快要空了。

detailed_translations.english: having nothing inside

name: exhibit
trans: n. 展览品；证据；展示会
vt. 展览；显示；提出（证据等）

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: expense
trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: expire
trans: vi. 期满；终止；死亡；呼气

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

sentences.english: You have to grant us control explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 你们必须允许我们明确地控制。

sentences.english: Tell them explicitly you want to continue the friendship.
sentences.chinese: 明确地告诉他们你想继续这段友谊。

sentences.english: Therefore, you need to include these in your source files explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 因此，您需要将这些都明确地包含进源文件中。

name: exploitation
trans: n. 开发，开采；利用；广告推销；剥削

detailed_translations.english: the development and use of minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: extensive
trans: adj. 广泛的；大量的；广阔的

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

name: external
trans: adj. 外部的；表面的； 外用的；外国的；外面的

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: internal
trans: adj. 内部的；里面的；体内的；（机构）内部的

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝；消失；消灭；废止

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: extravagant
trans: adj. 奢侈的；浪费的；过度的；放纵的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的；可能的；可实行的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；成果，资料；回复

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: femininity
trans: n. 温柔；柔弱性；女子本性

sentences.english: You don’t have to lose your femininity to be an independent, successful woman.
sentences.chinese: 成为独立成功的女性并非就会失去女人味。

detailed_translations.english: qualities that are considered to be typical of women, especially qualities that are gentle, delicate, and pretty

name: fetch
trans: vt. 取来；接来；到达；吸引

sentences.english: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅从浴室拿来一条毛巾。

sentences.english: Fetch me a glass of water.
sentences.chinese: 给我拿杯水来。

detailed_translations.english: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

sentences.english: Two flashes mean danger.
sentences.chinese: 两次闪光表示危险。

sentences.english: Lightning flashed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 头顶上电光闪闪。

detailed_translations.english: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

name: glow
trans: n. 灼热；色彩鲜艳；兴高采烈
vi. 发热；洋溢；绚丽夺目

sentences.english: The bedside lamp glowed dimly.
sentences.chinese: 床头灯发出暗淡的光。

sentences.english: The fireplace was still glowing with the remains of last night’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉中，隔夜的余烬依然在微微发光。

sentences.english: The red tip of his cigarette was glowing in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他那红红的烟头在黑暗中幽幽发光。

sentences.english: The moisturizer gave my face a healthy glow that lasted all day.
sentences.chinese: 这种润肤霜给我脸上带来了持续整天的一种健康的红光。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or  reflect  a soft steady light
A glow is a pink colour on a person's face, usually because they are healthy or have been exercising

name: glare
trans: n. 刺眼；耀眼的光；受公众注目

sentences.english: The old woman glared at him.
sentences.chinese: 那个老妇人怒视着他。

sentences.english: The sun glared down on us.
sentences.chinese: 刺眼的阳光照在我们身上。

sentences.english: She gave him a hostile glare.
sentences.chinese: 她狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.english: a special screen to reduce glare
sentences.chinese: 一种可以减弱刺眼强光的特殊屏幕

detailed_translations.english: to look angrily at someone for a long time
a long angry look

sentences.english: The river glittered in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下河面波光粼粼。

detailed_translations.english: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 灿烂的光辉； 耀眼， 辉煌
detailed_translations.english: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light

sentences.english: The sea sparkled in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下大海碧波闪耀。

sentences.english: The crystal chandelier sparkled.
sentences.chinese: 那水晶枝形吊灯闪闪发光。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发光，闪耀，闪烁；活跃，焕发
detailed_translations.english: to shine in small bright flashes

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 闪耀， 闪烁； 活力， 生气
detailed_translations.english: a bright shiny appearance, with small points of flashing light

name: flaw
trans: n. 瑕疵，缺点；一阵狂风；短暂的风暴；裂缝，裂纹
v. 使生裂缝，使有裂纹；使无效；使有缺陷
vi. 生裂缝；变的有缺陷

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: florist
trans: n. 花商，种花人；花卉研究者

sentences.english: He bought her some roses at the florist's in the mall.
sentences.chinese: 他在购物中心的花店里为她买了一些玫瑰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花商，种花人；花卉研究者
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells flowers and indoor plants for the home

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: forge
trans: n. 熔炉，锻铁炉；铁工厂

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

sentences.english: Kiribati, formerly known as the Gilbert Islands
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯，旧称吉尔伯特群岛

sentences.english: This elegant hotel was formerly a castle.
sentences.chinese: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

detailed_translations.english: in earlier times

name: formulate
trans: vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

sentences.english: the forthcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将到来的选举

sentences.english: Keep an eye on the noticeboards for forthcoming events .
sentences.chinese: 请注意布告牌上的活动预告。

detailed_translations.english: a forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon

name: founder
trans: n. 创始人；建立者；翻沙工
vi. 失败；沉没；倒塌；变跛

sentences.english: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻在蜜月之后不久便触礁了。

detailed_translations.english: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: frame
trans: n. 框架；结构； 画面
adj. 有木架的；有构架的
vt. 设计；建造；陷害；使…适合

sentences.english: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

name: framework
trans: n. 框架，骨架；结构，构架

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["electoral fraud"]}
sentences.chinese: 选举欺诈

sentences.english: She was found guilty of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺诈， 诈骗； 骗子
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

sentences.english: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to what has already been said

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: fuse
trans: n. 保险丝，熔线；导火线，雷管
vt. 使融合；使熔化，使熔融

sentences.chinese: 两根13安培的保险丝

sentences.english: I taught him how to change a fuse .
sentences.chinese: 我教他怎么换保险丝。

sentences.chinese: 一枚炸弹在导火线已被点燃后的最后一刻被解除。

sentences.english: The skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five.

detailed_translations.english: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

detailed_translations.english: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius
sentences.chinese: 天才之作

detailed_translations.english: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

name: genuine
trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

sentences.english: They must genuinely like one another, and work well together.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须真诚地喜欢对方，并且能一起有效地工作。

name: genuine
trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: glare
trans: n. 刺眼；耀眼的光；受公众注目

sentences.english: The old woman glared at him.
sentences.chinese: 那个老妇人怒视着他。

sentences.english: The sun glared down on us.
sentences.chinese: 刺眼的阳光照在我们身上。

sentences.english: She gave him a hostile glare.
sentences.chinese: 她狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.english: a special screen to reduce glare
sentences.chinese: 一种可以减弱刺眼强光的特殊屏幕

detailed_translations.english: to look angrily at someone for a long time
a long angry look

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: globally
trans: adv. 全球地；全局地；世界上

name: governmental
trans: adj. 政府的；政治的；统治上的

sentences.english: an attempt to restrict governmental power
sentences.chinese: 限制政府权力的尝试

detailed_translations.english: of a government, or relating to government

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: governor
trans: n. 主管人员；统治者，管理者； 调节器；地方长官

sentences.english: He was governor of Iowa in the late 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 他是20世纪70年代末爱荷华州的州长。

sentences.english: the prison governor
sentences.chinese: 监狱长

detailed_translations.english: the person in charge of governing a state in the US

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: grab
trans: n. 攫取；霸占；夺取之物
vt. 攫取；霸占；将…深深吸引

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

sentences.english: people motivated by jealousy and greed
sentences.chinese: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪吃的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

name: habitual
trans: adj. 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的

sentences.english: James took his habitual morning walk around the garden.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯又像往常习惯的那样绕花园作晨间散步去了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的
detailed_translations.english: doing something from habit, and unable to stop doing it

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver

name: halt
trans: vi. 停止；立定；踌躇，犹豫

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: quit
trans: vt. 离开；放弃；停止；使…解除
adj. 摆脱了…的；已经了结的

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

sentences.english: Cash cuts have halved the number of places available on training courses.
sentences.chinese: 经费削减使培训名额减少了一半。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something by a half

name: handy
trans: adj. 便利的；手边的，就近的；容易取得的；敏捷的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: useful
trans: adj. 有用的，有益的；有帮助的

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

name: hardship
trans: n. 困苦；苦难；艰难险阻

sentences.english: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
sentences.chinese: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策

sentences.english: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生经济非常困难。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

sentences.chinese: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲

sentences.english: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到困难，就给我打电话。

sentences.english: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

detailed_translations.english: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

trans: adj. 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: delay
trans: n. 延期；耽搁；被耽搁或推迟的时间

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

trans: n. 危险，冒险；冒险的事
vt. 赌运气；冒…的危险，使遭受危险

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

sentences.english: Danger! No boats beyond this point.
sentences.chinese: 危险！船只不可越过此处。

sentences.english: The refugees believe that their lives are in danger .
sentences.chinese: 难民认为他们有生命危险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed

name: headline
trans: n. 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
vt. 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

sentences.english: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

sentences.english: He looked up towards the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 他仰望苍穹。

detailed_translations.english: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

name: hell
trans: n. 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力
int. 该死；见鬼（表示惊奇、烦恼、厌恶、恼怒、失望等）

sentences.english: I’ve come one hell of a long way to get here.
sentences.chinese: 我走了老远的路才到这里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力
detailed_translations.english: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions

detailed_translations.chinese: 该死；见鬼（表示惊奇、烦恼、厌恶、恼怒、失望等）
detailed_translations.english: used when you are very angry with someone

sentences.english: They first set out to convert the heathen.
sentences.chinese: 他们最初打算教化异教徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not connected with the Christian religion or any of the large established religions – used to show disapproval
not connected with or belonging to the Christian religion or any of the large established religions

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；增高；加强；使更显著

sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: heroic
trans: adj. 英雄的；英勇的；记叙英雄及其事迹的；夸张的

sentences.english: her heroic efforts to save her family
sentences.chinese: 她拯救家人的英勇行为

sentences.english: Lawrence’s heroic struggle against his destiny
sentences.chinese: 劳伦斯与命运的勇敢抗争

sentences.english: She portrayed him as a heroic figure .
sentences.chinese: 她把他描述为英雄人物。

sentences.english: He said his advice was: "No heroics, stay within the law."
sentences.chinese: 他说他的意见是：“不要有逞能行为，要依法办事。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 英雄的；英勇的；记叙英雄及其事迹的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people
If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: hindrance
trans: n. 障碍；妨碍；妨害；阻碍物

sentences.english: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.chinese: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

sentences.english: his humour and charm
sentences.chinese: 他的幽默感和魅力

sentences.english: Greg’s feeble attempt at humour
sentences.chinese: 格雷格干巴巴的幽默

sentences.english: English humour
sentences.chinese: 英国式幽默

sentences.english: It’s vital to have a sense of humor in this job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作必须具备幽默感。

sentences.english: The host puts the contestants at ease with his own brand of humour .
sentences.chinese: 主持人以他别具一格的幽默让参赛者放松心情。

sentences.english: He showed flashes of humor that delighted the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他不时冒出些幽默话逗得观众忍俊不禁。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or tendency to think that things are funny, or funny things you say that show you have this ability
to do what someone wants or to pretend to agree with them so that they do not become upset

sentences.english: I like your sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你的 幽默感。

sentences.english: His remarks participated of the sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 他的话里带有几分幽默感。

sentences.english: She loved everything about him -- his personality, his humor, the way he dressed.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他的一切——他的性格，他的幽默，还有他的衣着打扮。

name: idealize
trans: vt. 使理想化；理想化地描述

sentences.english: Society continues to idealize the two-parent family.
sentences.chinese: 社会依然把双亲家庭视为理想家庭。

sentences.english: an idealized view of marriage
sentences.chinese: 理想化的婚姻观

detailed_translations.english: to imagine or represent something or someone as being perfect or better than they really are

name: illiterate
trans: adj. 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: vast
trans: n. 浩瀚；广阔无垠的空间
adj. 广阔的；巨大的；大量的；巨额的

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

name: implication
trans: n. 含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想；曝光（衡量广告被显示的次数。打开一个带有该广告的网页，则该广告的impression 次数增加一次）

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: inadequacy
trans: n. 不适当，不充分；不完全；不十分

sentences.english: the inadequacy of local health care
sentences.chinese: 当地医疗保健服务的不足

detailed_translations.english: the fact of not being good enough in quality, ability, size etc for a particular purpose

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不充分的，不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

sentences.english: Mammals have an inborn fear of snakes.
sentences.chinese: 哺乳动物天生害怕蛇。

sentences.english: Good taste is inborn and cannot be learned.
sentences.chinese: 好的鉴赏力是与生俱来的，无法通过后天习得。

detailed_translations.english: an inborn quality or ability is one you have had naturally since birth

sentences.english: The electronic sensor has been adapted to fit on a newborn baby.
sentences.chinese: 电子传感器已被改装以适应新生儿。

sentences.english: Mild jaundice in the newborn is common and often clears without treatment.
sentences.chinese: 新生儿有轻微的黄疸较为常见，通常会不治自愈。

detailed_translations.english: A newborn baby or animal is one that has just been born
The newborn are babies or animals who are newborn

name: firstborn
trans: adj. 头生的；第一胎生的

sentences.english: She was my firstborn.
sentences.chinese: 她是我的长女。

detailed_translations.english: Someone's firstborn is their first child

name: incapable
trans: adj. 不能的；无能力的；不能胜任的

sentences.english: He seemed incapable of understanding how she felt.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎不能理解她的感受。

sentences.english: Seventy-five percent of the electorate believe his party is incapable of government.
sentences.chinese: 75%的选民都认为他领导的政党无能力执政。

detailed_translations.english: not able to do something

name: incident
trans: adj.  入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: event
trans: n. 事件，大事；项目；结果

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: incidentally
trans: adv. 顺便；偶然地；附带地

sentences.english: Incidentally, where were you born?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

sentences.english: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说一下，这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

detailed_translations.english: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of

sentences.english: My natural inclination was to say no.
sentences.chinese: 我生性爱说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that makes you want to do something

name: disinclination
trans: n. 不感兴趣；厌恶；不起劲

sentences.english: the increasing disinclination of farm workers’ children to consider a job in farming
sentences.chinese: 农场工人的子女越来越不愿意务农的趋势

detailed_translations.english: a lack of willingness to do something

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: index
trans: n. 指标；指数；索引；指针

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

sentences.english: financial inducements to attract good job candidates
sentences.chinese: 吸引优秀人才前来应征的经济诱因

detailed_translations.english: a reason for doing something, especially something that you will get as a result

name: indulge
trans: vt. 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: indulgence
trans: n. 嗜好；放纵；纵容；沉溺

sentences.english: An occasional glass of wine was his only indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔喝杯葡萄酒是他唯一的嗜好。

detailed_translations.english: the habit of allowing yourself to do or have whatever you want, or allowing someone else to do or have whatever they want

name: indulgence
trans: n. 嗜好；放纵；纵容；沉溺

sentences.english: An occasional glass of wine was his only indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔喝杯葡萄酒是他唯一的嗜好。

detailed_translations.english: the habit of allowing yourself to do or have whatever you want, or allowing someone else to do or have whatever they want

name: industrial
trans: n. 工业股票；工业工人
adj. 工业的，产业的；从事工业的；供工业用的；来自勤劳的

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

sentences.english: She was an industrious and willing worker.
sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is industrious works hard

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: affectation
trans: n. 做作；矫揉造作；假装

sentences.english: Calling everyone ‘darling’ is just an affectation.
sentences.chinese: 逢人就叫“亲爱的”很做作。

detailed_translations.english: a way of behaving, speaking etc that is not sincere or natural

sentences.english: My father expected perfection from all of us.
sentences.chinese: 父亲期望我们都尽善尽美。

sentences.english: the search for technical perfection
sentences.chinese: 对技术的精益求精

detailed_translations.english: the state of being perfect

name: inferiority
trans: n. 自卑；下属；次等；下部

sentences.english: This kind of sentiment is a very interesting combination of superiority and inferiority.
sentences.chinese: 这种情感是非常有趣的，是一种高傲和自卑的结合体。

sentences.english: My sense of inferiority, my fear of handicaps, dropped away.
sentences.chinese: 我的自卑和我对困难的恐惧都消失了。

sentences.english: the intellectual superiority of humans over other animals
sentences.chinese: 人类相比其他动物所具有的智力优势

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

name: ingredient
trans: n. 原料；要素；组成部分

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: element
trans: n. 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

name: live
trans: adj. 活的；生动的；实况转播的；精力充沛的

sentences.english: He lives just across the street from me.
sentences.chinese: 他就住在我街对面。

sentences.english: We live only a few miles from the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。

sentences.english: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
sentences.chinese: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。

sentences.english: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到那地方，就觉得不想住在那儿。

sentences.english: Does Paul stilllive here?
sentences.chinese: 保罗还住在这儿吗？

sentences.english: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们还在找住的地方。

sentences.english: They’ve finally found a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

sentences.english: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home(= live with their parents ).
sentences.chinese: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。

sentences.english: I’m quite happy living alone.
sentences.chinese: 我一个人住很开心。

sentences.english: The house has 3,600 square feet of living space(= the areas of a house you live in ).
sentences.chinese: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

detailed_translations.english: if you live in a place, you have your home there
not dead or artificial

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

name: reject
trans: n. 被弃之物或人；次品
vt. 拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语
vt. 提出…作为反对的理由

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: insatiable
trans: adj. 贪得无厌的；不知足的

sentences.english: A section of the reading public has an insatiable appetite for dirty stories about the famous.
sentences.chinese: 阅读大众中有一部分人对名人的风流韵事的欲望总是无法满足。

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more and more of something

name: insensitive
trans: adj. 感觉迟钝的，对…没有感觉的

sentences.english: ...women's and Latino organizations that say he is insensitive to civil rights.
sentences.chinese: …指责他漠视民权的女性和拉丁美洲人的组织。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感觉迟钝的，对…没有感觉的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is insensitive to a situation or to a need does not think or care about it

name: insidious
trans: adj. 阴险的；隐伏的；暗中为害的；狡猾的

sentences.english: an insidious trend towards censorship of the press
sentences.chinese: 实行新闻审查的潜在趋势

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；隐伏的；暗中为害的；狡猾的
detailed_translations.english: an insidious change or problem spreads gradually without being noticed, and causes serious harm

name: insistence
trans: n. 坚持，强调；坚决主张

sentences.english: ...her insistence on personal privacy.
sentences.chinese: …她对个人隐私权的坚持。

detailed_translations.english: when you demand that something should happen and refuse to let anyone say no

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

sentences.english: the installation and maintenance of alarm systems
sentences.chinese: 警报系统的安装和维护

sentences.english: The whole computer installation was nearly new.
sentences.chinese: 整套电脑设备几乎是全新的。

sentences.english: nuclear installations
sentences.chinese: 核设施

detailed_translations.english: when someone fits a piece of equipment somewhere

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: instantly
trans: adv. 立即地；马上地；即刻地

sentences.english: All four victims died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 四名受害人全部当即死亡。

sentences.english: The information was instantly available.
sentences.chinese: 信息即时可得。

detailed_translations.english: immediately

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: distinct
trans: adj. 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: intact
trans: adj. 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: integrity
trans: n. 完整；正直；诚实；廉正

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: intellect
trans: n. 智力，理解力；知识分子；思维逻辑领悟力；智力高的人

sentences.english: He combined a formidable intellect with a talent for speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他不但智力超群，而且口才出众。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand things and to think intelligently

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；情报工作；情报机关；理解力；才智，智慧；天分

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: intensive
trans: adj. 加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: intuition
trans: n. 直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

name: contention
trans: n. 争论，争辩；争夺；论点

sentences.english: His case has become a source of contention between civil liberties activists and the government.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子已变成了公民自由活动家们和政府之间的争论缘由。

detailed_translations.english: a strong opinion that someone expresses

name: intentional
trans: adj. 故意的；蓄意的；策划的

sentences.english: I did trip him, but it wasn’t intentional.
sentences.chinese: 我的确把他绊倒了，但不是故意的。

detailed_translations.english: done deliberately and usually intended to cause harm

name: accidental
trans: n. 次要方面；非主要的特性；临时记号
adj. 意外的；偶然的；附属的；临时记号的

sentences.english: an accidental discharge of toxic waste
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料的意外排放

sentences.english: Buy an insurance policy that covers accidental damage .
sentences.chinese: 购买一份意外损害保单。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意外的；偶然的；附属的；临时记号的
detailed_translations.english: happening without being planned or intended

detailed_translations.chinese: 次要方面；非主要的特性；临时记号

name: interaction
trans: n. 相互作用； 交互作用

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

adj. 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的

sentences.english: the inner ear

sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: intimate
trans: adj. 亲密的；私人的；精通的；有性关系的

vt. 使…转化；使…颠倒；使…反转；使…前后倒置

sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕倒扣过来放到一个盘子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠倒的事物；倒置物；倒悬者

sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

trans: n. 日报，杂志；日记；分类账

sentences.chinese: 《英国医学杂志》

sentences.english: He decided to keep a journal.
sentences.chinese: 他决定记日记。

sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.chinese: 他于八十年代早期在澳大利亚开始了他的新闻事业。

to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

sentences.chinese: 我祖母教过我编织。

sentences.chinese: 她在织毛衣。

sentences.chinese: 她爬上梯子。

sentences.chinese: 他从梯子上摔下来受了伤。

sentences.chinese: 新一轮成人识字[扫盲]运动

sentences.chinese: 一位博学的教授

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

name: illogical
trans: adj. 不合逻辑的；不合常理的

sentences.chinese: 毫无道理的惧怕

sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

plain and easy to see

sentences.chinese: 工党的竞选宣言

sentences.chinese: 保守党将于明天发表他们的宣言。

sentences.chinese: 他们巧妙地操纵股票市场而大赚其钱。

sentences.chinese: 经过培训的劳动力

sentences.chinese: 增加警力的计划

sentences.english: marital problems

sentences.english: the increase in marital breakdown
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂的增多

detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

name: martial

sentences.chinese: 军乐

detailed_translations.english: connected with war and fighting

name: masculine

sentences.chinese: 这些窗帘很好，但我更喜欢男性化一点的。

sentences.chinese: 她的嗓音非常男性化。

sentences.chinese: 打猎是典型的男性消遣活动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 男性的；阳性的；男子气概的

name: feminine
trans: adj. 女性的；妇女（似）的；阴性的；娇柔的

sentences.chinese: 传统的女性角色

sentences.english: Dianne loved pretty feminine things.
sentences.chinese: 黛安娜喜爱漂亮有女人味的东西。

detailed_translations.english: relating to being female

sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

name: maximal
trans: adj. 最高的，最大的；最全面的

name: minimal
trans: adj. 最低的；最小限度的

sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

trans: vt. 取…最大值；对…极为重视
vi. 尽可能广义地解释；达到最大值

sentences.chinese: 我们要充分利用空间。

sentences.chinese: 用中火把调味汁煮到变稠，同时烧水准备煮意大利面。
