sentences.chinese: 我们正在加快农业机械化的步伐。

sentences.english: The fundamental way out for agriculture lies in mechanization.
sentences.chinese: 农业的根本出路在于机械化。

sentences.english: A: The most common for all of us is probably the mechanization and heavy dependency on technology.
sentences.chinese: 解答：最常见的可能就是机械化带来的一些结果和我们对于科技的过度依赖。

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

name: mechanize
trans: vt. 使机械化；机动化；用机械装置

sentences.english: Only gradually are technologies being developed to mechanize the task.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地科技才发展到能使这项任务机械化。

detailed_translations.english: If someone mechanizes a process, they cause it to be done by a machine or machines, when it was previously done by people

name: membership
trans: n. 资格；成员资格；会员身份

sentences.english: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你应该随身携带会员卡。

sentences.english: Membership fees are being increased this year.
sentences.chinese: 会费今年提高了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会员身份， 会籍； 全体会员， 会员数
detailed_translations.english: when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

name: mentality
trans: n. 心态； 智力；精神力；头脑作用

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick mentality
sentences.chinese: 一夜暴富的心态

sentences.english: I can’t understand the mentality of the people who are behind this kind of violence.
sentences.chinese: 我不能理解这种暴力行为的幕后指使者是什么心态。

detailed_translations.english: a particular attitude or way of thinking, especially one that you think is wrong or stupid

name: mortality
trans: n. 死亡数，死亡率；必死性，必死的命运

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大的；重要的，值得考虑的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

name: metaphor
trans: n. 暗喻，隐喻；比喻说法

sentences.english: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
sentences.chinese: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。

sentences.english: a very creative use of metaphor
sentences.chinese: 隐喻的独到运用

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing

sentences.english: In Book One alone there are four primary instances of what we can think of as this primary simile dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 仅第一本里就有四个主要的例证,我们可以看作最初的明喻来源的动力。

sentences.english: Lister said people should follow the 1946 advice of writer George Orwell: "Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特说人们最好遵循作家乔治·奥威尔1946年提出的建议：“不要使用那些在各种出版物上频繁出现的暗喻、明喻或其他修辞格。”

sentences.english: The simile is a common device and a useful one, but similes coming in rapid fire, one right on top of another, are more distracting than illuminating.
sentences.chinese: 明喻是常用的修辞术，也很好用，但是像连珠炮式的比喻与其说是富有启发性，不如说是在转移注意力。

detailed_translations.english: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

name: mightily
trans: adv. 强烈地，激烈地；非常地

name: mighty
trans: adj. 有力的；强有力的；有势力的

sentences.english: the mighty Mississippi river
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的密西西比河

sentences.english: a mighty army
sentences.chinese: 强大的军队

detailed_translations.chinese: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的
detailed_translations.english: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
very

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: mild
trans: adj. 温和的；轻微的；淡味的；文雅的；不含有害物质的的
n. （英国的一种）淡味麦芽啤酒

sentences.english: His voice was soft and mild.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音轻柔温和。

sentences.english: a mild herbicide
sentences.chinese: 药力温和的除草剂

detailed_translations.english: a mild person has a gentle character and does not easily get angry

name: wild
trans: adj. 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["wild animals"]}
sentences.chinese: 野生动物

sentences.english: a field full of wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 遍地野花的田野

sentences.english: animals both wild and domesticated
sentences.chinese: 野生动物和家养动物

detailed_translations.chinese: 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: living in a natural state, not changed or controlled by people
in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people
if plants run wild, they grow a lot in an uncontrolled way

name: milestone
trans: n. 里程碑，划时代的事件

sentences.english: He said the launch of the party represented a milestone in Zambian history.
sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

name: landmark
trans: n. 陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事
adj. 有重大意义或影响的

name: minimal
trans: adj. 最低的；最小限度的

sentences.english: The storm caused only minimal damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.english: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.english: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

name: minor
trans: adj. 未成年的；次要的；较小的；小调的；二流的
n. 未成年人；小调；副修科目

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

name: misconception
trans: n. 误解；错觉；错误想法

sentences.english: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 说佩吉以前极其富有，这是一个错误的看法。

detailed_translations.english: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly

name: miserable
trans: adj. 悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: misplace
trans: vt. 放错地方；忘记把…放在什么地方；错误地信任某人

sentences.english: Oh dear, I seem to have misplaced the letter.
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，我好像忘了把信放在什么地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放错地方；忘记把…放在什么地方；错误地信任某人
detailed_translations.english: to lose something for a short time by putting it in the wrong place

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

sentences.english: missionary work
sentences.chinese: 传教工作

sentences.english: a missionary hospital
sentences.chinese: 教会医院

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of missionaries
someone who has been sent to a foreign country to teach people about Christianity and persuade them to become Christians

name: mobility
trans: n. 移动性；机动性； 迁移率

sentences.english: It improves the strength and mobility of joints.
sentences.chinese: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

name: mock
trans: adj. 仿制的，模拟的，虚假的，不诚实的

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: moderately
trans: adv. 适度地；中庸地；有节制地

sentences.english: He drinks moderately.
sentences.chinese: 他喝酒有节制。

detailed_translations.english: in a way which is not extreme or stays within reasonable limits

sentences.english: ‘And I think you’ve got to have an awful lot of talent to then go and do what the Beatles did – he says modestly.
sentences.chinese: 我想你一定得有相当出众的才华才能达到甲壳虫所达到的高度——他（书作者）说的很谨慎。

name: moisture
trans: n. 水分；湿度；潮湿；降雨量

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: monopoly
trans: n. 垄断；垄断者；专卖权

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

name: mortal
trans: adj. 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: mental
trans: adj. 精神的；脑力的；疯的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: mortality
trans: n. 死亡数，死亡率；必死性，必死的命运

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

sentences.english: Hundreds of people gathered to mourn the slain president.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千人聚集在一起悼念遇刺的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

name: movement
trans: n. 运动；活动；运转；乐章

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: motion
trans: n. 动作；移动；手势；请求；意向；议案

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: muscle
trans: vt. 加强；使劲搬动；使劲挤出

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

name: mute
trans: adj. 哑的；沉默的；无声的
vt. 减弱……的声音；使……柔和
n. 哑巴；弱音器；闭锁音

sentences.english: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
sentences.chinese: 比利还是站在那儿一声不吭，一副不服气的样子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer

name: cute
trans: adj. 可爱的；漂亮的；聪明的，伶俐的

sentences.english: a cute little puppy
sentences.chinese: 一只逗人爱的小狗

sentences.english: The baby’s so cute.
sentences.chinese: 这婴儿真可爱。

sentences.english: That’s a really cute outfit.
sentences.chinese: 那套衣服真漂亮。

detailed_translations.english: very pretty or attractive

name: nasty
trans: adj. 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: hasty
trans: adj. 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: tasty
trans: adj. 美味的；高雅的；有趣的
n. 可口的东西；引人入胜的东西

sentences.english: a simple but tasty meal
sentences.chinese: 简单而可口的饭菜

detailed_translations.english: food that is tasty has a good taste, but is not sweet

detailed_translations.chinese: 可口的东西；引人入胜的东西

name: nationwide
trans: adj. 全国范围的；全国性的

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country
Nationwide is also an adverb

sentences.english: After a while, we naturally started talking about the children.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我们自然而然地谈起了孩子。

sentences.english: naturally occurring chemicals
sentences.chinese: 天然存在的化学物质

detailed_translations.english: in a way that you would expect

name: certainly
trans: adv. 当然；行（用于回答）；必定

sentences.english: They’re certainly not mine.
sentences.chinese: “请给我来杯啤酒。”“好的，先生。”

sentences.english: ‘I’d like a beer, please.’ ‘Certainly, sir.’
sentences.chinese: “请给我来杯啤酒。”“好的，先生。”

sentences.english: ‘Can I come along?’ ‘Certainly.’
sentences.chinese: “我可以一起去吗？”“当然可以。”

detailed_translations.english: without doubt

name: unnaturally
trans: adv. 故意地；违反习俗地；不合乎自然规律地

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: neighbourhood
trans: n. 邻近；周围；邻居关系；附近一带

sentences.english: Be quiet! You’ll wake up the whole neighbourhood!
sentences.chinese: 安静点！ 你会把邻居全都吵醒的！

sentences.english: She grew up in a quiet neighborhood of Boston.
sentences.chinese: 她是在波士顿一个清静的街区里长大的。

detailed_translations.english: the area around you or around a particular place, or the people who live there

name: neighborhood
trans: n. 附近；街坊；接近；街区

sentences.english: Iterates may be categorized into stable and unstable sets depending on whether a neighborhood under iteration converges or diverges. Some move toward stability, others away.
sentences.chinese: 根据一个受迭代影响的社区是聚合还是发散，迭代可以被归类到稳定和不稳定集。有些转向稳定，有些转离。

name: network
trans: n. 网络；广播网；网状物

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

name: noble
trans: adj. 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
vt. 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

sentences.english: She puts her baby in this nursery and then goes back to work.
sentences.chinese: 她把孩子送到这家托儿所然后回去上班。

sentences.english: The garden, developed over the past 35 years, includes a nursery.
sentences.chinese: 这个有35年历史的花园里有一个苗圃。

detailed_translations.english: a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

sentences.english: In studying a problem, we must shun subjectivity, one-sidedness and superficiality.
sentences.chinese: 研究问题，忌带主观性、片面性和表面性。

sentences.english: This does not, however, commit me to subjectivity because the means by which they are made are social and conventional.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这不会使我有主观性，这是因为,他们的手段是社交的，是传统的。

sentences.english: Third, there is enough subjectivity in a mapping that you would probably tailor any existing mapping anyway, just to create consistency with your environment.
sentences.chinese: 第三，在映射的过程中有足够的主观能动性使得你很可能裁剪任何已有的映射，创造同你的环境的一致性。

name: obscure
trans: adj. 昏暗的，朦胧的；晦涩的，不清楚的；隐蔽的；不著名的，无名的
vt. 使…模糊不清，掩盖；隐藏；使难理解
n. 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: obsession
trans: n. 痴迷；困扰； 强迫观念

sentences.english: Gambling became an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
sentences.chinese: 他迷上赌博，最后失去了一切。

sentences.english: The game pachinko became a national obsession.
sentences.chinese: 弹珠机游戏已经风靡全国。

sentences.english: He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 他对艺术很热衷，在我看来已经到了痴迷的程度。

sentences.english: She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession.
sentences.chinese: 她尽心尽力地照顾他，简直到了沉迷的地步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痴迷；困扰；[内科][心理] 强迫观念
detailed_translations.english: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: instruct
trans: vt. 指导；通知；命令；教授

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: occupy
trans: vt. 占据，占领；居住；使忙碌

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: occupier
trans: n. 居住人；占有者；占用者

name: occurrence
trans: n. 发生；出现；事件；发现

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

sentences.english: operational activities/costs/difficulties
sentences.chinese: 营运上的活动 / 成本 / 困难

sentences.english: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。

sentences.english: The new system became operational in March.
sentences.chinese: 新的系统于3月份启用。

sentences.english: Our main offices are now fully operational.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the operation of a business, government etc

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语
vt. 提出…作为反对的理由

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: protest
trans: adj. 表示抗议的；抗议性的

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: orderly
trans: adj. 有秩序的；整齐的；值班的
n. 勤务兵；传令兵；护理员

sentences.english: She needs to organize her ideas in a more orderly way.
sentences.chinese: 她需要把自己的想法组织得更有条理些。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有秩序的；整齐的；值班的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way
someone who does unskilled jobs in a hospital

name: chaotic
trans: adj. 混沌的；混乱的，无秩序的

sentences.english: a chaotic mixture of images
sentences.chinese: 杂乱无章的各种图像

detailed_translations.english: a chaotic situation is one in which everything is happening in a confused way

name: ordinary
trans: adj. 普通的；平凡的；平常的
n. 普通；平常的人（或事）

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

name: general
trans: n. 一般；将军，上将；常规
adj. 一般的，普通的；综合的；大体的

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

name: outline
trans: n. 轮廓；大纲；概要；略图
vt. 概述；略述；描画…轮廓

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: output
trans: n. 输出，输出量；产量；出产

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: outsourcing
trans: n. 外包；外购；外部采办

name: outward
trans: adj. 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
adv. 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
n. 外表；外面；物质世界

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: overvalue
trans: vt. 对…估价过高；过分重视

sentences.english: Society undervalues staying at home and looking after children.
sentences.chinese: 社会低估了待在家里照看孩子的意义。

sentences.english: Analysts claim that the firm’s assets were undervalued by £300 million.
sentences.chinese: 分析员称公司资产被低估了三亿英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is less important or valuable than they really are

name: owe
trans: vt. 欠；感激；应给予；应该把……归功于

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: panic
trans: adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: panicky
trans: adj. 恐慌的；惊慌失措的

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: paradoxically
trans: adv. 自相矛盾地；似非而是地；反常地

sentences.english: Paradoxically, the prohibition of liquor caused an increase in alcoholism.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾的是，禁酒反而导致酗酒的增加。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect

name: parallel
trans: adj. 平行的；类似的，相同的

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

sentences.english: paralysis of the lower body
sentences.chinese: 下半身瘫痪

sentences.english: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it

name: partly
trans: adv. 部分地；在一定程度上

sentences.english: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。

sentences.english: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。

sentences.english: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
sentences.chinese: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作，部分原因是母亲病了。

sentences.english: The group is funded partly by the government.
sentences.chinese: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

detailed_translations.english: to some degree, but not completely

name: passionate
trans: adj. 热情的；热烈的，激昂的；易怒的

sentences.english: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。

sentences.english: a very passionate young man
sentences.chinese: 一位感情热烈的年轻人

sentences.english: a passionate lover
sentences.chinese: 富有激情的爱人

sentences.english: a passionate kiss
sentences.chinese: 激情的一吻

detailed_translations.english: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

name: patience
trans: n. 耐性，耐心；忍耐，容忍

sentences.english: He doesn't have the patience to wait.
sentences.chinese: 他没有耐心等。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or sth annoying without complaining

name: patrol
trans: n. 巡逻；巡逻队；侦察队

sentences.english: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
sentences.chinese: 安全部队加强了对该地区的巡逻。

detailed_translations.english: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

sentences.english: It has been suggested the founders were not true patriots but men out to protect their own interests.
sentences.chinese: 有人指出创建者并非真正的爱国者，而是一些维护自己利益的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

sentences.english: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气里充斥着柴油的气味。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it

name: permissive
trans: adj. 许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的

sentences.english: parents who are too permissive
sentences.chinese: 太过放任的父母

sentences.english: a permissive society
sentences.chinese: 放纵的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的
detailed_translations.english: not strict, and allowing behaviour that many other people would disapprove of

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

name: persistence
trans: n. 持续；固执；存留；坚持不懈；毅力

sentences.english: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了经理的职位，不懈坚持终于有了回报。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

detailed_translations.english: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

sentences.english: Doctors had tried to dissuade patients from smoking.
sentences.chinese: 医生曾试图说服病人不要抽烟。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone not to do something

name: pessimistic
trans: adj. 悲观的，厌世的；悲观主义的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: plausible
trans: adj. 貌似可信的，花言巧语的；貌似真实的，貌似有理的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: player
trans: n. 运动员，比赛者；游戏者，做游戏的人；演奏者，表演者；演员；播放器

sentences.english: a game for four players
sentences.chinese: 四人玩的游戏

sentences.english: a tennis/rugby/chess, etc. player
sentences.chinese: 网球、橄榄球、国际象棋等选手

detailed_translations.english: a person who takes part in a game or sport

name: pledge
trans: n. 保证，誓言；抵押；抵押品，典当物
vt. 保证，许诺；用……抵押；举杯祝……健康

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: undertake
trans: vt. 承担，保证；从事；同意；试图

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: plot
trans: vt. 密谋；绘图；划分；标绘

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: slot
trans: n. 位置；狭槽；水沟；硬币投币口

sentences.english: Alan dropped another quarter into the slot on the pay phone.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦往付费电话的投币口里又塞了一枚 25 分的硬币。

sentences.english: He was slotting a CD into a CD player.
sentences.chinese: 他正把一张光盘放入光盘播放器中。

sentences.english: The car seat belt slotted into place easily.
sentences.chinese: 那个汽车安全带很容易就扣好了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…放入狭长开口中； 把…纳入其中， 使有位置
detailed_translations.english: If you slot something into something else, or if it slots into it, you put it into a space where it fits

name: plug
trans: vi. 塞住；用插头将与电源接通

sentences.english: the bath plug
sentences.chinese: 浴缸塞子

sentences.english: an electric plug
sentences.chinese: 电源插头

sentences.english: We used mud to plug up the holes in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 我们用泥堵住了房顶上的漏洞

detailed_translations.english: a round flat piece of rubber used for stopping the water flowing out of a bath or  sink
to fill or block a small hole

name: bug
trans: n. 臭虫，小虫；故障；窃听器
vt. 烦扰，打扰；装窃听器

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: pointless
trans: adj. 无意义的；钝的；不尖的；不得要领的

sentences.english: Life just seemed pointless to me.
sentences.chinese: 生活对我来说简直没什么意义。

sentences.english: a pointless quarrel
sentences.chinese: 无谓的争吵

detailed_translations.english: worthless or not likely to have any useful result

sentences.english: Women were becoming more politically active.
sentences.chinese: 妇女在政治上变得越来越活跃。

sentences.english: a politically sensitive issue
sentences.chinese: 政治上敏感的问题

sentences.english: Politically, raising the minimum wage is good for the Democrats.
sentences.chinese: 从政治上来说，提高最低工资对民主党有好处。

detailed_translations.english: in a political way

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: statesman
trans: n. 政治家；国务活动家

sentences.english: a respected elder statesman
sentences.chinese: 一位受人尊敬的政界元老

detailed_translations.english: a political or government leader, especially one who is respected as being wise and fair

name: poorly
trans: adj. 身体不舒服的；心情恶劣的
adv. 贫穷地；贫乏地；不充分地

sentences.english: Matt’s wife’s been very poorly.
sentences.chinese: 马特的妻子身体一直不好。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is poorly, they are ill

sentences.english: a potentially dangerous situation
sentences.chinese: 有潜在危险的局势

detailed_translations.english: something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

sentences.english: spray from the waves
sentences.chinese: 海浪溅起的水雾

sentences.english: a new hair styling spray
sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.english: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.
sentences.chinese: 她往身上喷了香水。

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road

name: fray
trans: vt. 使磨损；变得令人紧张、急躁

sentences.english: Three civilians were injured during the fray.
sentences.chinese: 三个平民在冲突中受伤。

sentences.english: The fabric is very fine or frays easily.
sentences.chinese: 这种布料很细，或者说是容易磨损。

sentences.english: The stitching had begun to fray at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 边缘处的针脚已经开始磨损了。

detailed_translations.english: an argument or fight

detailed_translations.chinese: 使磨损；变得令人紧张、急躁
detailed_translations.english: If something such as cloth or rope frays, or if something frays it, its threads or fibres start to come apart from each other and spoil its appearance

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的
