sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 可预言地, 不出所料地

sentences.english: The landscape has remained predominantly rural in appearance.
sentences.chinese: 该风景看上去主要保留了乡村风貌。

detailed_translations.english: You use predominantly to indicate which feature or quality is most noticeable in a situation

name: pregnant
trans: adj. 怀孕的；富有意义的

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: preliminary
trans: n. 准备；预赛；初步措施
adj. 初步的；开始的；预备的

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: presumably
trans: adv. 大概；推测起来；可假定

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

sentences.english: a fire prevention officer
sentences.chinese: 消防官员

sentences.english: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure (= it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened ) .
sentences.chinese: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

detailed_translations.english: when something bad is stopped from happening

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: privileged
trans: adj. 享有特权的；有特别恩典的
v. 给予…特权；免除（privilege的过去分词）

sentences.english: Kylie feels fortunate to be in such a privileged position because of her successful TV career.
sentences.chinese: 凯莉觉得由于成功的电视生涯而使自己处于这样优越的地位真是幸运。

detailed_translations.english: having a special advantage or a chance to do something that most people cannot do

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的；赚钱的；有益的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: progressive
trans: n. 改革论者；进步分子

sentences.english: a progressive administration
sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.english: progressive and forward-looking policies
sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党进步派和保守派之间分歧很大。

detailed_translations.english: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
A progressive is someone who is progressive

name: prompt
trans: n. 提示；付款期限；DOS命令：改变DOS系统提示符的风格
adj. 敏捷的，迅速的；立刻的
vt. 提示；促进；激起；（给演员）提白

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: promptly
trans: adv. 迅速地；立即地；敏捷地

sentences.english: A reply came very promptly.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有了答复。

detailed_translations.english: without delay

name: property
trans: n. 性质，性能；财产；所有权

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: protective
trans: adj. 防护的；关切保护的；保护贸易的

sentences.english: protective clothing
sentences.chinese: 防护服

sentences.english: Sunscreen provides a protective layer against the sun’s harmful rays.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜提供了一层抵挡阳光中有害光线的防护层。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended for protection

name: watchful
trans: adj. 注意的；警惕的；警醒的

sentences.english: The entrances are guarded by watchful security staff.
sentences.chinese: 入口处由警惕的保安人员把守。

sentences.english: His eyes were watchful.
sentences.chinese: 他目光警惕。

detailed_translations.english: very careful to notice what is happening, and to make sure that everything is all right

name: provoke
trans: vt. 驱使；激怒；煽动；惹起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

sentences.english: Their work permits have been revoked.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工作许可证被吊销了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a law, decision, or agreement is no longer effective

name: prudent
trans: adj. 谨慎的；精明的；节俭的

sentences.english: prudent house buyers
sentences.chinese: 谨慎的购房者

detailed_translations.english: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

sentences.english: Any school trip requires careful planning.
sentences.chinese: 学校的任何出游活动都需要周密的安排。

detailed_translations.english: giving a lot of attention to details

name: psychiatrist
trans: n. 精神病学家，精神病医生

sentences.english: He and his wife live in North Carolina, where he is a psychiatrist.
sentences.chinese: 他和妻子住在卡罗莱纳州北部，他是一名精神病医生。

sentences.english: Under the new law, then, you could visit a psychiatrist with the same frequency with which you visit your ENT and receive the same level of reimbursement in each case.
sentences.chinese: 然而根据新法，你可以看精神病医师的次数和看眼睛、鼻子和喉咙的次数一样多，而且每次看完之后可以享受同样的报销水平。

sentences.english: “The notion that behavior modification can bring about true happiness is as bogus as can be,” says psychiatrist Charles Goodstein, MD, of New York University.
sentences.chinese: 纽约大学医学博士、精神病学家查尔斯.古德斯坦说：“行为修正能够带来真正的快乐的观念是相当虚假的。”

detailed_translations.english: a doctor trained in the treatment of mental illness

name: psychologist
trans: n. 心理学家，心理学者

sentences.english: a clinical psychologist
sentences.chinese: 临床心理学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained in psychology

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

name: publicity
trans: n. 宣传，宣扬；公开；广告；注意

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

name: publicly
trans: adv. 公然地；以公众名义

sentences.english: She and her family agreed never to discuss the matter publicly.
sentences.chinese: 她和家人一致同意，绝不公开讨论那件事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is intended for anyone to know, see, or hear

name: qualify
trans: vt. 限制；使具有资格；证明…合格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

sentences.english: The statistics are highly questionable.
sentences.chinese: 这个统计数据大有问题。

detailed_translations.english: not likely to be true or correct

name: doubtful
trans: adj. 可疑的；令人生疑的；疑心的；不能确定的

sentences.english: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 持久和平的前景难料。

sentences.english: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful .
sentences.chinese: “一切都会顺顺当当的，你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

detailed_translations.english: probably not true or not likely to happen

name: radical
trans: n. 基础；激进分子； 原子团； 根数
adj. 激进的；根本的；彻底的

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: radioactive
trans: adj.  放射性的；有辐射的

sentences.english: the problem of how to dispose of radioactive waste
sentences.chinese: 如何处理放射性废物的问题

sentences.english: a consignment of highly radioactive plutonium
sentences.chinese: 发送的一批高放射性钚

detailed_translations.chinese: 放射性的， 有辐射能的
detailed_translations.english: a radioactive substance is dangerous because it contains  radiation (= a form of energy that can harm living things )

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: rail
trans: n. 铁轨；扶手；横杆；围栏
vt. 铺铁轨；以横木围栏

sentences.english: the American rail system
sentences.chinese: 美国铁路系统

sentences.english: a high-speed rail network
sentences.chinese: 一个高速铁路网络

sentences.english: Passengers want a better rail service .
sentences.chinese: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
sentences.chinese: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

sentences.english: I need to buy a rail ticket .
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张火车票。

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票价

detailed_translations.english: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路
detailed_translations.english: the railway system

name: randomly
trans: adv. 随便地，任意地；无目的地，胡乱地；未加计划地

sentences.english: They throw out all of these behaviors randomly.
sentences.chinese: 它们的这些行为都是随机的。

sentences.english: It mimics a memory leak by randomly placing some of these arrays (~20% of them) into a list.
sentences.chinese: 它通过随机将这些数组的一部分（大约 20%）放入一个列表来模拟内存泄漏。

name: rap
trans: vt. 抢走；轻敲；敲击致使；使着迷

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ he rapped impatiently.
sentences.chinese: “得了吧。”他不耐烦地厉声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to say the words of a rap song

detailed_translations.chinese: 敲击，急敲；突然厉声说出；责备，训斥
detailed_translations.english: to say something loudly, suddenly, and in a way that sounds angry
a series of quick sharp hits or knocks

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: irrational
trans: adj. 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的

sentences.english: an irrational fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: readership
trans: n. 读者人数；读者们；读者的身分

sentences.english: They are hoping that the paper will have quite a wide readership .
sentences.chinese: 他们希望这份报纸会有很多读者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 读者的身分, 读者人数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who read a particular newspaper or magazine regularly

name: realistic
trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: reasonable
trans: adj. 合理的，公道的；通情达理的

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: unreasonable
trans: adj. 不合理的；过度的；不切实际的；非理智的

sentences.english: I think he’s being unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他是在无理取闹。

detailed_translations.english: not fair or sensible

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: repel
trans: vt. 击退；抵制；使厌恶；使不愉快

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。

detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

sentences.english: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
sentences.chinese: 保留收据以备退货之需。

sentences.english: Can you give me a receipt?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我一个收条吗？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

name: recipient
trans: n. 容器，接受者；容纳者
adj. 容易接受的，感受性强的

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: recipe
trans: n. 食谱； 处方；秘诀；烹饪法

sentences.english: a recipe book
sentences.chinese: 一本烹饪书

detailed_translations.english: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

name: reckless
trans: adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的；粗心大意的

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

name: reconsider
trans: vt. 重新考虑；重新审议

sentences.english: He should reconsider his decision to resign.
sentences.chinese: 他应该重新考虑辞职的决定。

sentences.english: We want you to come. Please reconsider.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望你来，请你重新考虑一下。

detailed_translations.english: to think again about something in order to decide if you should change your opinion or do something different

name: recording
trans: v. 录音；记录；录像（record的ing形式）

sentences.english: ...a video recording of a police interview.
sentences.chinese: …一盘警察询问的录像带。

detailed_translations.english: the act of storing sound or images on tape or  disc s

name: recover
trans: vt. 恢复；弥补；重新获得
vi. 恢复；胜诉；重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

sentences.english: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面，但损害已经造成了。

detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong

name: refrain
trans: vi. 节制，克制；避免；制止

sentences.english: Mrs. Hardie refrained from making any comment.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪太太忍住了没做任何评论。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something that you want to do
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

name: restrain
trans: vt. 抑制，控制；约束；制止

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: refuge
trans: vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: refugee
trans: n. 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者

sentences.english: Refugees were streaming across the border.
sentences.chinese: 难民正涌过边境。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["refugee camps"]}
sentences.chinese: 难民营

detailed_translations.chinese: 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

name: regulate
trans: vt. 调节，规定；控制；校准；有系统的管理

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: reign
trans: n. 统治；统治时期；支配
vi. 统治；支配；盛行；君临

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

name: rule
trans: vt. 统治；规定；管理；裁决；支配

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料
vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充
vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料
vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充
vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: rejection
trans: n. 抛弃；拒绝；被抛弃的东西；盖帽

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

sentences.english: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
sentences.chinese: 示威者被赶出大厅。

sentences.english: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
sentences.chinese: 两个发动机突然熄火，飞机在下降的同时开始喷出燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语
vt. 提出…作为反对的理由

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: reliance
trans: n. 信赖；信心；受信赖的人或物

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: relief
trans: n. 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: adj. 宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；修道的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

sentences.english: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔斯最终同意了，但很勉强。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: comment
trans: vi. 发表评论；发表意见

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: review
trans: n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅
vi. 回顾；复习功课；写评论

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: reminder
trans: n. 暗示；提醒的人/物；催单

sentences.english: a reminder from the dentist for your check-up
sentences.chinese: 牙医寄来的检查提醒函

detailed_translations.english: something, for example a letter, that reminds you to do something which you might have forgotten

name: renaissance
trans: n. 文艺复兴（欧洲14至17世纪）

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: renew
trans: vt. 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要； 履历，简历
vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: renewable
trans: adj. 可再生的；可更新的；可继续的

sentences.english: It’s a six-month lease but it’s renewable.
sentences.chinese: 租期六个月，但是可以续签。

sentences.english: a renewable visa
sentences.chinese: 可延期的签证

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement or official document is renewable, you can make it continue for a further period of time after it ends

name: representation
trans: n. 代表；表现；表示法；陈述

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

sentences.english: She expressed resentment at being interviewed by a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 她对于被一个社会工作者面试表示了怨恨。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of anger because something has happened that you think is unfair

name: resistance
trans: n. 阻力；电阻；抵抗；反抗；抵抗力

sentences.english: Rebel gunmen have put up strong resistance.
sentences.chinese: 持枪的叛乱分子负隅顽抗。

sentences.english: disease resistance
sentences.chinese: 抗病能力

detailed_translations.english: fighting against someone who is attacking you

name: resistant
trans: adj. 抵抗的，反抗的；顽固的

sentences.english: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.
sentences.chinese: 一些人对锻炼的主意非常抵制。

detailed_translations.english: not damaged or affected by something

name: resolution
trans: n.  分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事
vt. 决定；溶解；使…分解；决心要做…

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事
vt. 决定；溶解；使…分解；决心要做…

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: settle
trans: vi. 解决；定居；沉淀；下陷

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: respectively
trans: adv. 分别地；各自地，独自地

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

name: restructure
trans: vt. 调整；重建；更改结构

sentences.english: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
sentences.chinese: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

detailed_translations.english: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: reserve
trans: n. 储备，储存；自然保护区；预备队；缄默； 储备金

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品
vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

sentences.english: ...the reviewer for Atlantic Monthly.
sentences.chinese: …《大西洋月刊》的评论员。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes about new books, plays, films etc in a newspaper or magazine

name: revise
trans: vi. 修订；校订；复习功课

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: correct
trans: adj. 正确的；恰当的；端正的

sentences.english: If my calculations are correct, we’re about ten miles from Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 如果我计算得没错的话，我们离埃克塞特大约十英里。

sentences.english: Score one point for each correct answer .
sentences.chinese: 答对一题得一分。

sentences.english: You are absolutely correct, the Missouri is the longest river in the US.
sentences.chinese: 你说的完全正确，密苏里河是美国最长的河流。

sentences.english: Some eyesight problems are relatively easy to correct.
sentences.chinese: 有些视力问题比较容易矫正。

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes
to make something right or to make it work the way it should

name: revive
trans: vt. 使复兴；使苏醒；回想起；重演，重播
vi. 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: survive
trans: vt. 幸存；生还；幸免于；比...活得长

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: rigour
trans: n. 严格；严厉；苛刻；精确

sentences.english: The prince had performed his social duties with professional rigour.
sentences.chinese: 王子以职业性的严谨履行了他的社会职责。

detailed_translations.english: If something is done with rigour, it is done in a strict, thorough way

name: rigor
trans: n. 严厉；精确；苛刻；僵硬

sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

name: risky
trans: adj. 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的

sentences.english: Doctors say it’s too risky to try and operate.
sentences.chinese: 医生说动手术风险太大。

sentences.english: Buying a secondhand car is a risky business .
sentences.chinese: 买二手汽车是有风险的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的
detailed_translations.english: involving a risk that something bad will happen

name: rival
trans: vt. 与…竞争；比得上某人

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: robotic
trans: adj. 机器人的，像机器人的；自动的

sentences.english: the space shuttle’s robotic arm
sentences.chinese: 航天飞机的机械臂

detailed_translations.chinese: 机器人的； 像机器人的， 呆板而机械的
detailed_translations.english: robotic equipment etc is related to robots or is part of a robot

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: scared
trans: v. 使害怕（scare的过去分词）

sentences.english: At first, he was really scared.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始时他非常害怕。

detailed_translations.english: frightened of something, or nervous about something

name: sacrifice
trans: vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: sanction
trans: n. 制裁，处罚；认可；支持
vt. 制裁，处罚；批准；鼓励

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的
adv. 仅仅；几乎不；几乎没有

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

name: scorn
trans: n. 轻蔑；嘲笑；藐视的对象
vi. 表示轻蔑；表示鄙视

sentences.english: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们对这个提议报以轻蔑的态度。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻蔑， 鄙视； 拒绝， 不屑
detailed_translations.english: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

sentences.english: She despised her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

trans: n. 移动性；机动性； 迁移率

sentences.chinese: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

name: staple
trans: n. 主要产品；订书钉；主题；主食
adj. 主要的，大宗生产的；常用的；纺织纤维的

sentences.english: Oil is Nigeria’s staple export.
sentences.chinese: 石油是尼日利亚的主要出口产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的； 经常需要的
detailed_translations.english: forming the greatest or most important part of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 订书钉，U形钉；主食；主要产品
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of thin wire that is pushed into sheets of paper and bent over to hold them together
to fasten two or more things together with a staple

sentences.english: Thousands of people will starve if food doesn’t reach the city.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不能运到那座城市，成千上万的人就要饿死。

sentences.english: pictures of starving children
sentences.chinese: 饥饿儿童的照片

sentences.english: They’ll either die from the cold or starve to death (= die from lack of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要么会冻死，要么会饿死。

detailed_translations.english: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

sentences.english: They say that one sad story is tragic, but a thousand of them is a statistic.
sentences.chinese: 他们说一个悲惨的故事是悲剧，但一千个这样的故事就只是一个统计了。

sentences.english: You can track your time many different ways but some of the best apps that I have found for Android and iPhone are great when you are on the run and need to get a quick statistic to use for planning.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过许多不同的方式来追踪你的时间，但是我发现当你正在进行或者为了制订计划需要快速统计时，一些适用于安卓手机或者苹果手机的应用软件十分有效。

detailed_translations.english: a single number which represents a fact or measurement

sentences.english: The report contains a great deal of statistical information.
sentences.chinese: 该报告包含大量统计资料。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the use of statistics

name: status
trans: n. 地位；状态；情形；重要身份

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

sentences.english: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。

sentences.english: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
sentences.chinese: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

detailed_translations.english: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

sentences.chinese: 电脑行业的结构性改变

sentences.chinese: 这次地震造成了轻微的结构破坏。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the structure of something

trans: n. 订户；签署者；捐献者

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出

name: substantially
trans: adv. 实质上；大体上；充分地

sentences.english: There are one or two minor differences, but they’re substantially the same text.
sentences.chinese: 这些文本有一两处细微差异，但大体上是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that in many ways something is true, the same, different etc

name: suburban
trans: adj. 郊区的，城郊的；土气的；见闻不广的

sentences.english: a quiet, suburban street
sentences.chinese: 一条安静的郊区街道

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区的，城郊的；土气的；见闻不广的
detailed_translations.english: related to a suburb, or in a suburb

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: succession
trans: n. 连续；继位；继承权； 演替

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

name: successive
trans: adj. 连续的；继承的；依次的；接替的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: persistent
trans: adj. 固执的，坚持的；持久稳固的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

sentences.english: the suffering of the refugees after the war
sentences.chinese: 战后难民所遭受的苦难

sentences.english: the pain and suffering caused by road accidents
sentences.chinese: 交通事故造成的痛苦

detailed_translations.english: serious physical or mental pain

name: superior
trans: n. 上级，长官；优胜者，高手；长者
adj. 上级的；优秀的，出众的；高傲的

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的

someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

name: supposedly
trans: adv. 可能；按照推测；恐怕

name: surpass
trans: vt. 超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: surplus
trans: n. 剩余； 顺差；盈余；过剩

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: remainder
trans: n.  余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人
vt. 廉价出售；削价出售
vi. 廉价出售；削价出售

sentences.english: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人

trans: n. 幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

sentences.chinese: 他因有违职业道德的行为被停职六个月。

detailed_translations.english: when something is officially stopped for a period of time

trans: vt. 维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

name: sustainable
trans: adj. 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

sentences.english: Some birds have a highly developed sense of taste.
sentences.chinese: 有些鸟的味觉很发达。

sentences.english: She has such good taste.
sentences.chinese: 她的品位很高雅。

detailed_translations.english: the sense by which you know one food from another

trans: vt. 给……调味；给……增添风趣

sentences.chinese: 你要哪种味道的，巧克力还是香草？

detailed_translations.english: the particular taste of a food or drink

name: tear
trans: n. 眼泪, （撕破的）洞或裂缝, 撕扯
vt. 撕掉, 扯下, 扰乱

sentences.english: The children were all in tears .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们全都哭了。

sentences.english: She came home in floods of tears .
sentences.chinese: 她泪流满面地回到家里。

sentences.english: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
sentences.chinese: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。

sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

name: rear
trans: n. 后面；屁股；后方部队
adj. 后方的；后面的；背面的

sentences.chinese: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。

sentences.english: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟笼养成功。

sentences.chinese: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑，除非你确有需要。

sentences.english: I finally gave in to the temptation and had a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我最终还是屈从诱惑，抽了一支烟。

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: dissertation
trans: n. 论文，专题；学术演讲

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

name: tight
trans: adj. 紧的；密封的；绷紧的；麻烦的；严厉的；没空的；吝啬的

sentences.english: tight jeans
sentences.chinese: 紧身牛仔裤

sentences.english: My shoes were so tight that I could hardly walk.
sentences.chinese: 鞋子很紧，我几乎不能走路。

sentences.english: The jacket is rather a tight fit (= it fits too tightly ) .
sentences.chinese: 这件夹克衫太紧了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧的；密封的；绷紧的；麻烦的；严厉的；没空的；吝啬的
detailed_translations.english: tight clothes fit your body very closely, especially in a way that is uncomfortable
very firmly or closely

sentences.chinese: 把螺丝拧紧。

sentences.english: I’d put the new tyre on, but I hadn’t tightened up the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 我把新轮胎装上了，但没有上紧轮子。

detailed_translations.english: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it

sentences.english: You’ll need a spanner to loosen that bolt.
sentences.chinese: 你需要扳手来拧开那个螺栓。

sentences.english: The screws have loosened.
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

sentences.english: Harry loosened his tie.
sentences.chinese: 哈里松开了领带。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

name: tobacco
trans: n. 烟草，烟叶；烟草制品；抽烟

sentences.english: ...Cuba's tobacco crop.
sentences.chinese: …古巴的烟草作物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 烟草，烟叶；烟草制品；抽烟
detailed_translations.english: the dried brown leaves that are smoked in cigarettes, pipes etc

name: trace
trans: n. 痕迹，踪迹；微量； 迹线；缰绳
vt. 追踪，查探；描绘；回溯

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: track
trans: n. 轨道；足迹，踪迹；小道
vt. 追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: trail
trans: n. 小径；痕迹；尾部；踪迹；一串，一系列
vt. 追踪；拖；蔓延；落后于
vi. 飘出；蔓生；垂下；拖曳
