sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: trace
trans: n. 痕迹，踪迹；微量； 迹线；缰绳
vt. 追踪，查探；描绘；回溯

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: trail
trans: n. 小径；痕迹；尾部；踪迹；一串，一系列
vt. 追踪；拖；蔓延；落后于
vi. 飘出；蔓生；垂下；拖曳

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: transmit
trans: vt. 传输；传播；发射；传达；遗传

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: broadcast
trans: n. 广播；播音；广播节目
vt. 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）

sentences.english: The interview was broadcast live across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这次采访向整个欧洲进行了现场直播。

detailed_translations.chinese: 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）
detailed_translations.english: to send out radio or television programmes
a programme on the radio or on television

name: treatment
trans: n. 治疗，疗法；处理；对待

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

name: cure
trans: n. 治疗；治愈； 疗法
vt. 治疗；治愈；使硫化；加工处理
vi. 治病；痊愈；受治疗；被硫化；被加工处理

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

sentences.english: I can get you tickets for the show but it’ll be tricky.
sentences.chinese: 我能给你弄到演出的票，但会很费事。

detailed_translations.english: a tricky person is clever and likely to deceive you

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机； 触发器；制滑机

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: trivial
trans: adj. 不重要的，琐碎的；琐细的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: turbulence
trans: n. 骚乱，动荡； 湍流；狂暴

detailed_translations.english: irregular and violent movements of air or water that are caused by the wind

name: turnover
trans: n. 翻覆； 营业额；流通量；半圆卷饼；失误
adj. 翻过来的；可翻转的

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

sentences.english: We aim to provide a service that is balanced and unbiased.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是提供一种公平公正的服务。

sentences.english: an unbiased observer
sentences.chinese: 一名公正的观察员

detailed_translations.english: unbiased information, opinions, advice etc is fair because the person giving it is not influenced by their own or other people’s opinions

name: unconscious
trans: adj. 无意识的；失去知觉的；不省人事的；未发觉的

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

name: unconsciously
trans: adv. 不知不觉；无意识地

sentences.english: He unconsciously switched a tree with his cane when he talked to her.
sentences.chinese: 在和她讲话时，他无意识地用手里的鞭子抽打着一棵树。

name: unconventional
trans: adj. 非常规的；非传统的；不依惯例的

sentences.english: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.chinese: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个奇才。

sentences.english: He was known for his unconventional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因另类行为而出名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非传统的, 不合惯例的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society

name: underground
trans: n. 地下；地铁；地道；地下组织；秘密活动；先锋派团体
adj. 地下的；秘密的；先锋派的

sentences.english: This animal spends most of its life underground.
sentences.chinese: 这种动物一生中的大部分时间都待在地下。

sentences.english: nuclear waste buried deep underground
sentences.chinese: 深埋在地下的核废物

detailed_translations.english: under the earth’s surface

detailed_translations.chinese: 地下的；秘密的；先锋派的
detailed_translations.english: below the surface of the earth

detailed_translations.chinese: 地下；地铁；地道；地下组织；秘密活动；先锋派团体
detailed_translations.english: a railway system under the ground

name: underline
trans: n. 下划线；下期节目预告
vt. 强调；在…下面划线；预告

sentences.english: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
sentences.chinese: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区
vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: undermine
trans: vt. 破坏，渐渐破坏；挖掘地基

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: weaken
trans: vt. 减少；使变弱；使变淡

sentences.english: Over the last two years the president’s position has weakened.
sentences.chinese: 过去两年来，总统的地位被削弱了。

sentences.english: Changes in policy have weakened the power of the trade unions.
sentences.chinese: 政策的变化削弱了工会的力量。

sentences.english: The absence of this witness has weakened the case against the accused.
sentences.chinese: 这名证人的缺席削弱了对被告的指控力度。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful
to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful

name: uneasy
trans: adj. 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: unusually
trans: adv. 非常；异乎寻常地；显著地

name: update
trans: vt. 更新；校正，修正；使现代化

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

sentences.english: upward pressure on bank interest rates
sentences.chinese: 针对银行利率的越来越大的压力

sentences.english: They climbed upward along the steep cliffs surrounding the village.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着环绕村庄的陡峭悬崖向上爬。

sentences.english: 'There,' said Jack, pointing upwards.
sentences.chinese: “那儿，”杰克往上指着说。

detailed_translations.english: increasing to a higher level
If someone moves or looks upward, they move or look up towards a higher place

name: utterly
trans: adv. 完全地；绝对地；全然地；彻底地，十足地

sentences.english: You look utterly miserable.
sentences.chinese: 你看起来很痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong

sentences.english: Dogs must be vaccinated against distemper.
sentences.chinese: 犬类必须接种疫苗以防犬热病。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person or animal from a disease by giving them a vaccine

name: vain
trans: adj. 徒劳的；自负的；无结果的；无用的

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

sentences.english: In this example, the validation fails.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，验证失败。

sentences.english: In the next tip in this series, we'll examine the other side of validation: exception handling.
sentences.chinese: 在本系列的下一篇技巧文章中，我们将研究验证的另一方面：异常处理。

name: variable
trans: n.  变量；可变物，可变因素
adj. 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的， 畸变的

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: variety
trans: n. 多样；种类；杂耍；变化，多样化

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: vary
trans: vt. 改变；使多样化；变奏

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: addict
trans: n. 有瘾的人；入迷的人

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触
vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: indict
trans: vt. 控告，起诉； 揭发

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: tender
trans: n. 偿付，清偿；看管人；小船
adj. 温柔的；柔软的；脆弱的；幼稚的；难对付的
vt. 提供，偿还；使…变嫩；使…变柔软

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: benign
trans: adj. 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: virgin
trans: adj. 处女的；纯洁的；未经利用的，处于原始状态的

sentences.english: I was a virgin until I was thirty years old.
sentences.chinese: 我到30岁时还是个处女。

sentences.english: a virgin bride
sentences.chinese: 贞洁的新娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who has never had sex
without sexual experience

name: visibility
trans: n. 能见度，可见性；能见距离；明显性

sentences.english: Visibility on the roads is down to 20 metres due to heavy fog.
sentences.chinese: 道路能见度因浓雾降至20米。

detailed_translations.english: the distance it is possible to see, especially when this is affected by weather conditions

sentences.english: The system used to result in a great deal of food wastage.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法过去造成了大量的食物浪费。

detailed_translations.english: when something is lost or destroyed, especially in a way that is not useful or reasonable, or the amount that is lost or destroyed

name: weird
trans: adj. 怪异的；不可思议的；超自然的

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: welfare
trans: n. 福利；幸福；福利事业；安宁
adj. 福利的；接受社会救济的

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

sentences.english: a wholly satisfactory solution
sentences.chinese: 完全令人满意的解决办法

sentences.english: The report claimed that the disaster was wholly unavoidable.
sentences.chinese: 报告称这场灾难完全无法避免。

detailed_translations.english: completely

sentences.english: Ding Convention and Exhibition (Ningbo Feiyang Convention and Exhibition Services Co, Ltd), is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Zhejiang Feiyang International Travel Group Co.
sentences.chinese: 鼎会展（宁波飞扬会展服务有限公司），是浙江飞扬国际旅游集团股份有限公司旗下全资子公司。

sentences.english: They’re widening the road.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在拓宽马路。

sentences.english: The river widens and splits.
sentences.chinese: 这条河有变宽的河段，也有分流的河段。

detailed_translations.english: to become wider, or to make something wider
to become wider, or to make something wider

name: broaden
trans: vi. 扩大，变阔；变宽，加宽

sentences.english: Mark’s smile broadened.
sentences.chinese: 马克笑得更加灿烂了。

sentences.english: The council decided to broaden the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 地方议会决定拓宽人行道。

detailed_translations.english: to make something wider, or to become wider

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: withdrawal
trans: n. 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股

sentences.english: large-scale troop withdrawals
sentences.chinese: 大规模撤军

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股
detailed_translations.english: the act of moving an army, weapons etc away from the area where they were fighting

name: withdraw
trans: vt. 撤退；收回；撤消；拉开

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: withhold
trans: vt. 保留，不给；隐瞒；抑制

sentences.english: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to give someone something

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: wonder
trans: vt. 怀疑；惊奇；对…感到惊讶

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: wander
trans: vi. 徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: wordy
trans: adj. 冗长的；口头的；唠叨的；文字的

sentences.english: a wordy explanation
sentences.chinese: 冗长的解释

detailed_translations.english: using too many words

name: chatty
trans: adj. 饶舌的；爱讲闲话的；非正式的

sentences.english: a chatty letter about her summer holidays
sentences.chinese: 一封写她暑假生活的家常信

detailed_translations.chinese: 饶舌的；爱讲闲话的；非正式的
detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing that is chatty has a friendly informal style

name: youth
trans: n. 青年；青春；年轻；青少年时期

sentences.english: Despite his youth, he had travelled alone.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然年纪还小，却已独自旅行过了。

sentences.english: The youth of today are the pensioners of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 今天的年轻人就是明天领养老金的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality or state of being young

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

sentences.english: the workers’ revolution
sentences.chinese: 工人阶级革命

detailed_translations.english: the members of the  working class

sentences.english: Women usually live longer than men.
sentences.chinese: 女人通常比男人长寿。

sentences.english: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
sentences.chinese: 通常我都穿黑色、灰色或者棕色的衣服。

sentences.english: The drive usually takes 15 or 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 这段车程通常需要 15 或 20 分钟。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about what happens on most occasions or in most situations

name: generally
trans: adv. 通常；普遍地，一般地

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

name: frequently
trans: adv. 频繁地，经常地；时常，屡次

sentences.english: He was frequently drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他经常喝醉。

detailed_translations.english: very often or many times

name: repeatedly
trans: adv. 反复地；再三地；屡次地

sentences.english: Graham was repeatedly warned not to work so hard.
sentences.chinese: 格雷厄姆一再被提醒工作不要这么拼命。

detailed_translations.english: many times

name: regularly
trans: adv. 定期地；有规律地；整齐地；匀称地

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

name: media
trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.english: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
detailed_translations.english: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

name: medium
trans: adj. 中间的，中等的；半生熟的
n. 方法；媒体；媒介；中间物

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

name: rhetoric
trans: n. 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻

sentences.english: The speech was dismissed by some people as merely political rhetoric .
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为这场演讲只是华而不实的政治空谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻
detailed_translations.english: the art of speaking or writing to persuade or influence people

name: eloquence
trans: n. 口才；雄辩；雄辩术；修辞

sentences.english: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 他天生具有罕见的口才。

sentences.english: On the one hand to expand my insight, on the other hand exercise my eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 一方面扩大我的洞察力，另一方面锻炼我的口才。

sentences.english: I exercise in the race his eloquence and ability to cope, to learn some basic manners.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中我锻炼了自己口才和应变能力， 学习到了一些基本的礼仪。

name: rhetorical
trans: adj. 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的

sentences.english: a speech full of rhetorical phrases
sentences.chinese: 充满华丽辞藻的演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: using speech or writing in special ways in order to persuade people or to produce an impressive effect

sentences.english: In the aftermath of the coup, the troops opened fire on the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 在那次政变的余波之中，军队向示威者开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time after something such as a war, storm, or accident when people are still dealing with the results

name: contingent
trans: n. 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分；代表团
adj. 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的；可能的；依情况而定的；偶然的；有条件的

sentences.english: Has the Scottish contingent arrived yet?
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰代表团到了没有？

detailed_translations.chinese: 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的；可能的；依情况而定的；偶然的；[逻]有条件的
detailed_translations.english: depending on something that may happen in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分；代表团
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who all have something in common, such as their nationality, beliefs etc, and who are part of a larger group

name: dependent
trans: n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者
adj. 依靠的；从属的；取决于…的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: contingency
trans: n. 偶然性； 意外事故；可能性； 意外开支；偶然式

sentences.english: a contingency plan
sentences.chinese: 应变计划

sentences.english: Add up your outgoings, putting on a bit more for contingencies.
sentences.chinese: 把你的经常性开支加起来，再增加些钱用于意外开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶然性， 可能性； 意外事件； 附带事件
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that might happen in the future, especially one that could cause problems

sentences.english: a dual system of education
sentences.chinese: 二元[双元]教育体系

detailed_translations.english: having two of something or two parts

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴收到您的询问函。

sentences.english: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentences.chinese: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentences.english: When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: enquire
trans: vi. 询问；调查；问候（等于inquire）

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

name: epic
trans: n. 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: jurisdiction
trans: n. 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力

sentences.english: The British police have no jurisdiction over foreign bank accounts.
sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力
detailed_translations.english: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists

name: dominion
trans: n. 主权，统治权；支配；领土

sentences.english: the king’s dominions
sentences.chinese: 国王的领地

detailed_translations.english: the power or right to rule people or control something

name: lucrative
trans: adj. 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的

sentences.english: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的退役军官在私人保安公司找到了薪水丰厚的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money

name: sibling
trans: n. 兄弟姊妹；民族成员

sentences.english: Most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
sentences.chinese: 大多数年轻的吸烟者都是因为他们的朋友或者哥哥姐姐有吸烟习惯而受影响的。

detailed_translations.english: a brother or sister

name: brotherly
trans: adj. 兄弟的；兄弟般的；亲切的

sentences.english: brotherly love
sentences.chinese: 兄弟之爱

sentences.english: brotherly advice
sentences.chinese: 兄长般的劝告

detailed_translations.chinese: 兄弟的；兄弟般的；亲切的
detailed_translations.english: showing feelings of kindness, loyalty etc that you would expect a brother to show

name: sisterly
trans: adj. 像姊妹的；姊妹一般的

name: slump
trans: vt. 使降低；使衰落；使倒下
vi. 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: drop
trans: n. 滴；落下；空投；微量；滴剂
vt. 滴；使降低；使终止；随口漏出

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

name: tangible
trans: adj. 有形的；切实的；可触摸的

sentences.english: The silence of the countryside was almost tangible .
sentences.chinese: 乡村的寂静几乎能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有形的；切实的；可触摸的
detailed_translations.english: if something is tangible, you can touch or feel it

name: intangible
trans: adj. 无形的，触摸不到的；难以理解的

sentences.english: The island has an intangible quality of holiness.
sentences.chinese: 该岛屿有一种难以形容的神圣感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无形的，触摸不到的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: an intangible quality or feeling is difficult to describe exactly

name: viable
trans: adj. 可行的；能养活的；能生育的

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的；可能的；可实行的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: practicable
trans: adj. 可用的；行得通的；可实行的

sentences.english: The only practicable course of action is to sell the company.
sentences.chinese: 唯一可行的做法是把公司卖掉。

sentences.english: at the earliest practicable opportunity
sentences.chinese: 在尽可能早的时机

detailed_translations.english: able to be done; likely to be successful

name: aggregate
trans: adj. 聚合的；集合的；合计的

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: aggregation
trans: n.  聚合，聚集；聚集体，集合体

sentences.english: An aggregation of fragments is the only kind of whole we now have.
sentences.chinese: 这种碎片的集合体是我们现有的唯一完整无缺的方式。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of aggregating

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: alphabet
trans: n. 字母表，字母系统；入门，初步
n. Google创建的名为Alphabet的公司，改变Google原有公司架构，旨在使其当下主要业务和长期投资项目间的区别更加清晰。

sentences.english: The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters.
sentences.chinese: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing

name: although
trans: conj. 尽管；虽然；但是；然而

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

name: alignment
trans: n. 队列，成直线；校准；结盟

sentences.english: The church should have no political alignment.
sentences.chinese: 教会不应该有政治结盟。

detailed_translations.english: support given by one country or group to another in politics, defence etc

sentences.english: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

sentences.english: a sports arena
sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena
sentences.chinese: 室内剧场

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: area
trans: n. 区域，地区；面积；范围

sentences.english: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

vt. 筛选；囫囵吞下；（把门、窗等）闩上；突然说出，脱口说出
vi. （门窗等）闩上，拴住；冲出，跳出；（马等的）脱缰；囫囵吞下
adv. 突然地；像箭似地；直立地

sentences.chinese: 这是一笔意料之财呢，还是你本来就知道会有的？

sentences.english: The pig rose squealing and bolted.

detailed_translations.chinese: 螺栓，螺钉；闪电，雷电；门闩；弩箭;（布的）一匹，一卷

detailed_translations.chinese: 筛选；囫囵吞下；（把门、窗等）闩上；突然说出，脱口说出

trans: n. 简洁，简短；短暂，短促

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

sentences.chinese: 该展览反映了国外的同期发展情况。

sentences.chinese: 最多可有20名用户同时登该系统。

sentences.english: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation (= immediate translation, as the person is speaking ) into English.
sentences.chinese: 这些演讲将作现场直播，并配有英语同声传译。

detailed_translations.english: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time

sentences.english: Transitions within states should normally be synchronous, since there is no change of owner.
sentences.chinese: 状态间的转换通常应该是同步的，因为所有者没有改变。

sentences.english: For example, you might have a synchronous replica on another machine in the same data center, and an asynchronous replica on a machine in another data center.
sentences.chinese: 例如，您可以在同一个数据中心的另一台机器上选择同步复制，而在另一个数据中心的机器上选择异步复制。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more things are synchronous, they happen at the same time or work at the same speed

name: concurrence
trans: n. 同时发生；赞同；合作

sentences.english: ...Stonehenge, in southwestern England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.
sentences.chinese: …史前巨石柱群，位于英国西南部，是一座古代巨石阵列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配置， 布局， 构造

trans: n. 布局；设计；安排；陈列

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

sentences.english: a report by experts convened by the National Institutes of Health
sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting
if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

name: summon
trans: vt. 召唤；召集；鼓起；振作

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

trans: n. 大会； 惯例； 约定； 协定；习俗

sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

trans: n. 冠状病毒；日冕形病毒

trans: vt. 使结束；使达到高潮
vi. 到绝顶；达到高潮；达到顶点

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

trans: 以…而结束；以…结束；以……告终

trans: 用一个特定的动作、事件或项目来结束或结束某事

sentences.english: This little book represented the culmination of 15 years’ work.
sentences.chinese: 这本小书是15年工作的结晶。

sentences.chinese: 学习是个逐渐积累的过程。

trans: adj. 累计的；累积的；积聚而成的

sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

trans: adj. 使人畏缩的；使人气馁的；令人怯步的

name: daunt
trans: vt. 使气馁，使畏缩；威吓

sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的

sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: deplete
trans: vt. 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

sentences.english: The influence of light stabilizer depletion in the agricultural film processing on product quantity is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析光稳定剂在农膜生产过程中的消耗对产品质量的影响。

sentences.english: Nitrogen oxides releases directly by supersonic aircraft into the stratosphere contribute directly to the depletion of the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: 由超音速飞机直接排放到平流层中的氧化氮会直接导致臭氧的消耗。

sentences.english: This decreases the device thickness and depletion voltage and consequently reduces material quality requirements and cost of the detector material.
sentences.chinese: 这减少了设备的厚度和电压损耗，从而降低材料的质量要求和探测器的材料成本。

sentences.chinese: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.chinese: 然而，如今是新的时代，这样的攻击只要一枚核弹就完了，因此，这种战术已经不再是威慑。

sentences.english: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们目前尚不明确为什么会这样，但是他们认为这可能是一种进化返祖现象，因为在蛮荒时代，哭泣在骚乱时是对发情男性的一种威慑。

vt. 使分离；使分开；使分居

sentences.chinese: 我谨慎地保持一段距离站在后面。

sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

sentences.chinese: 非法买卖偷来的牛

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by laws or rules, or strongly disapproved of by society

trans: vt. 征求；招揽；请求；乞求

sentences.chinese: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

sentences.chinese: 社会失衡比收入不公平更令他担忧。

sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

trans: adj. 多方面的；多才多艺的

trans: adj. 多面的，多方面的，多边的

name: gadget
trans: n. 小玩意；小器具；小配件；诡计

sentences.english: ...sales of kitchen gadgets including toasters, kettles, and percolators.
sentences.chinese: …厨房小用品的销售，包括烤面包机、水壶和咖啡渗滤壶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小玩意；小器具；小配件；诡计
detailed_translations.english: A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary.

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

name: icon
trans: n. 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像

sentences.english: To open a new file, click on the icon.
sentences.chinese: 要打开新文档，点击该图标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像
detailed_translations.english: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将来临的；迫近的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: imminence
trans: n. 迫切；急迫，危急；迫近的危险或祸患

name: inflict
trans: vt. 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: influenza
trans: n.  流行性感冒（简写flu）；家畜流行性感冒

sentences.english: All the medical workers in the region helped to put down the influenza epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的所有医务工作者参加了消灭流行性感冒的工作。

sentences.english: People should therefore continue to seek seasonal influenza vaccination like any other year.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人们应当像以往一样继续接种季节性流感疫苗。

detailed_translations.english: an infectious disease that is like a very bad cold

name: invoke
trans: vt. 调用；祈求；引起；恳求

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

sentences.english: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

detailed_translations.english: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: Even if a marriage is doomed, the trend in family law is to resolve the dispute out of court, typically through mediation.
sentences.chinese: 即使是一桩婚姻注定要遭受失败，在家庭法中也将是趋向于在法庭外解决争执，典型的是通过调解。

sentences.english: Only solve those existing problems, the people's mediation can play better efficiency and cost advantages, and prevent and dissolve the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 解决好这几方面存在的问题才能更好发挥人民调解的效率与成本优势及预防、化解纠纷的能力。

sentences.english: It has been wisely negotiating with Syria via Turkey, and engaging Hamas on a truce deal through the mediation of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 它明智地透过土耳其与叙利亚谈判，并通过埃及的仲裁与哈马斯达成停战协议。

name: mediator
trans: n. 调停者；传递者；中介物

sentences.english: As a mediator, America could work to prevent what the reportcalls violence created from insecurity in Southeast Asia and the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个调停者，美国可以做一些工作，去防止该份报告认为的在东南亚和中东地区的不稳定引发的暴力行为。

sentences.english: All proposals were rejected by the mediator.
sentences.chinese: 所有的建议都被仲裁人驳回。

detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that tries to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc by discussion

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: advisor
trans: n. 顾问；指导教师；劝告者

sentences.english: This is the role of the coach, advisor, or teacher.
sentences.chinese: 这就是教练、顾问或者老师所扮演的角色。

sentences.english: When you purchase stocks, or equities, as your advisor might put it, you become a part owner of the business.
sentences.chinese: 当你买入股票或者等价物，你的顾问会告诉你说你已经成为了企业的部分所有者。

name: mentorship
trans: n. 导师制，辅导教师；师徒制

name: mentoring
trans: v. 指导（mentor的ing形式）；做…的良师

name: overt
trans: adj. 明显的；公然的；蓄意的

sentences.english: an overt attempt to silence their political opponents
sentences.chinese: 他们想压制政敌言论的明显企图

sentences.english: Overt race discrimination is illegal.
sentences.chinese: 公然的种族歧视是非法的。

detailed_translations.english: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything

name: obvious
trans: adj. 明显的；显著的；平淡无奇的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: overtly
trans: adv. 明显地；公开地，公然地

name: covert
trans: n. 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
adj. 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的

sentences.english: covert operations
sentences.chinese: 秘密行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛
detailed_translations.english: a group of thick bushes where animals can hide

detailed_translations.chinese: 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的
detailed_translations.english: secret or hidden

sentences.english: ...a new paradigm of production.
sentences.chinese: …一种新的生产范例。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear or typical example of something

name: model
trans: n. 模型；典型；模范；模特儿；样式
adj. 模范的；作模型用的

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

sentences.english: The journal accused the professor of plagiarism.
sentences.chinese: 那份刊物指控该教授剽窃。

detailed_translations.english: when someone uses another person’s words, ideas, or work and pretends they are their own

sentences.english: He accused other scientists of plagiarizing his research.
sentences.chinese: 他指控其他科学家剽窃他的研究成果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 剽窃，抄袭（别人学说、著作）
detailed_translations.english: to take words or ideas from another person’s work and use them in your work, without stating that they are not your own

sentences.english: IS that policewoman short or tall?
sentences.chinese: 那个女警察是矮还是高？

sentences.english: A policewoman shot at the helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 一名女警察向直升飞机射击。

sentences.english: In 1984, Libyan gunmen murdered a British policewoman on the streets of London.
sentences.chinese: 1984年，在伦敦的街上，利比亚持枪歹徒杀害了一名英国女警察。

detailed_translations.english: a female police officer

name: policeman
trans: n. 警察，警员； 淀帚（橡皮头玻璃搅棒）

sentences.english: He tried to corrupt the policeman with money.
sentences.chinese: 他设法用金钱向警察行贿。

sentences.english: The thief withered under the stare of the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 小偷在警察的逼视下显得惶恐不安。

sentences.english: I think he must be a policeman, he keeps fishing for information.
sentences.chinese: 我想他肯定是警察，他不断地转弯抹角地打听消息。

detailed_translations.english: A policeman is a man who is a member of the police force

sentences.english: a breach of diplomatic protocol
sentences.chinese: 违反外交礼节

detailed_translations.english: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion

name: propagate
trans: vt. 传播；传送；繁殖；宣传

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: spread
trans: vt. 传播，散布；展开；伸展；铺开

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: proximity
trans: n. 接近，邻近；接近；接近度，距离；亲近

sentences.english: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity (= very near to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

detailed_translations.english: nearness in distance or time

name: quarantine
trans: n. 检疫；隔离；检疫期；封锁

sentences.english: She was sent home and put in quarantine.
sentences.chinese: 她被送回家实施隔离。

detailed_translations.english: to keep a person or animal apart from others for a period of time in case they are carrying a disease
a period of time when a person or animal is kept apart from others in case they are carrying a disease

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ； 查询

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: resilient
trans: adj. 能复原的；有复原力的

sentences.english: Children are often very resilient.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的适应力一般都很强。

sentences.english: The company proved remarkably resilient during the recession.
sentences.chinese: 公司在经济衰退期间表现出惊人的耐挫力。

detailed_translations.english: able to become strong, happy, or successful again after a difficult situation or event

name: resilience
trans: n. 恢复力；弹力；顺应力

sentences.english: And I think what we're seeing in the economy now is the inherent resilience of the American economy and the American people.
sentences.chinese: 而且我认为，我认为，在经济方面，我们现在看到的是美国经济和美国人民一直以来所固有的弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of a substance such as rubber to return to its original shape after it has been pressed or bent

sentences.english: How do we situate Christianity in the context of modern physics and psychology?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何将基督教置于现代物理学和心理学的背景中呢？

detailed_translations.english: If you situate something such as an idea or fact in a particular context, you relate it to that context, especially in order to understand it better

name: situation
trans: n. 情况；形势；处境；位置

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: stagnate
trans: vt. 使淤塞；使沉滞；使萧条

sentences.english: Growth is expected to stagnate next year.
sentences.chinese: 预计明年增长会停滞。

sentences.english: His career had stagnated.
sentences.chinese: 他的事业停滞不前了。

detailed_translations.english: to stop developing or making progress

sentences.english: Is there anything that could protect us from the dangers of stagnation or a double dip?
sentences.chinese: 那么有什么方法能够保护我们免受停滞或二次探底的危险吗？

sentences.english: However, even though unemployment rates will not be as severe, I still predict that we are in store for a miserable decade of economic stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 然而，尽管失业率不会那么高，我仍然认为我们会经历一个悲惨的、经济停滞的十年，现在我们正在为此做准备。

name: stagnant
trans: adj. 停滞的；不景气的；污浊的；迟钝的

sentences.english: a stagnant pond
sentences.chinese: 死水塘

detailed_translations.chinese: 停滞的；不景气的；污浊的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: stagnant water or air does not move or flow and often smells bad

name: stance
trans: n. 立场；姿态；位置；准备击球姿势

sentences.english: a fighting stance
sentences.chinese: 搏击姿势

detailed_translations.chinese: 立场；姿态；位置；准备击球姿势
detailed_translations.english: an opinion that is stated publicly

name: position
trans: n. 位置，方位；职位，工作；姿态；站位
vt. 安置；把……放在适当位置

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

sentences.english: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
sentences.chinese: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done

name: stipulation
trans: n. 规定；约定；条款；契约

sentences.english: Its reciprocity is merely an added stipulation.
sentences.chinese: 它的互惠只是一个附加的约定。

sentences.english: Compared with the legislation of other countries and regions, the stipulation of criminal summon in our country is too simple.
sentences.chinese: 与国外一些国家和地区的立法相比，我国有关刑事拘传的规定过于简略。

sentences.english: After that, we affirmed this abstract concept as the logical starting point of modern archival theories was based on the description and stipulation in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 接着，根据哲学对逻辑起点特征的描述和约定，再将这一抽象概念确认为现代档案学理论的逻辑起点。

detailed_translations.english: something that must be done, and which is stated as part of an agreement, law, or rule

sentences.english: electronic surveillance equipment
sentences.chinese: 电子监控设备

detailed_translations.english: when the police, army etc watch a person or place carefully because they may be connected with criminal activities

name: observation
trans: n. 观察；监视；观察报告

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: temporal
trans: n. 世间万物；暂存的事物
adj. 暂时的；当时的；现世的

sentences.english: the temporal character of human existence
sentences.chinese: 人生的短促

detailed_translations.english: related to or limited by time

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡；转变； 转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

sentences.english: baggage that is lost or damaged in transit
sentences.chinese: 在运输过程中丢失或损坏的行李

sentences.english: transit by air or sea
sentences.chinese: 空运或海运

detailed_translations.english: the process of moving goods or people from one place to another

sentences.english: ...a transitional period following more than a decade of civil war.
sentences.chinese: …十多年内战之后的一个过渡时期。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a period during which something is changing from one state or form into another

name: variance
trans: n. 变异；变化；不一致；分歧； 方差

sentences.english: a price variance of 5%
sentences.chinese: 5%的价格差异

detailed_translations.english: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change

name: venue
trans: n. 审判地；犯罪地点；发生地点；集合地点

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: volatile
trans: n. 挥发物；有翅的动物
adj.  挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: warranty
trans: n. 保证；担保；授权；（正当）理由

sentences.english: a three-year warranty
sentences.chinese: 三年的保修期

detailed_translations.chinese: 保证；担保；授权；（正当）理由
detailed_translations.english: a written agreement in which a company selling something promises to repair it if it breaks within a particular period of time

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: wary
trans: adj. 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
sentences.chinese: 出航前要密切注意天气。

sentences.english: She had a wary expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

name: cautious
trans: adj. 谨慎的；十分小心的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: whereby
trans: adv. 凭借；通过…；借以；与…一致

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: exercise
trans: n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼
vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐

sentences.english: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在日常生活中安排一些经常性的锻炼。

sentences.english: Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
sentences.chinese: 由于在办公室工作，我很少运动。

sentences.english: role-play exercises
sentences.chinese: 角色扮演练习

sentences.english: Horses need to be exercised regularly.
sentences.chinese: 马需要有规律的训练。

detailed_translations.english: physical activities that you do in order to stay healthy and become stronger
to do sports or other physical activities in order to stay healthy or become stronger; to make an animal do this

name: way
trans: n. 方法；道路；方向；行业；习惯

sentences.english: My family was in a bad way financially.
sentences.chinese: 我家当时经济窘迫。

sentences.english: The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it.
sentences.chinese: 这鸡肉很脆，正是我喜欢的口味。

sentences.english: It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 你应该想想如何让现状变得更好。

detailed_translations.english: a particular state or condition

name: even
trans: adj.  偶数的；平坦的；相等的
adv. 甚至；即使；还；实际上
vi. 变平；变得可比较；成为相等

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: state
trans: adj. 国家的；州的；正式的

sentences.english: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .

sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

trans: n. 关怀；照料；谨慎；忧虑
vi. 照顾；关心；喜爱；顾虑

sentences.chinese: “他好像很生气。”“我不管！”

sentences.chinese: 她觉得没有人在乎。

sentences.chinese: 他总是让人担心。

sentences.chinese: 我找不到汽车钥匙。

sentences.english: Hold on while I find a pen.
sentences.chinese: 别挂电话，我找支笔。

sentences.chinese: 后来有人发现她的尸体被藏在了灌木丛里。

sentences.english: I have to find somewhere else to live.

sentences.english: She had almost given up hope of finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 她差不多要放弃找个丈夫的希望了。

sentences.english: Her mother went to the shops, and on her return, Kathleen was nowhere to be found (= could not be found ) .
sentences.chinese: 妈妈去买东西，回来的时候凯思琳找不到了。

detailed_translations.english: to discover, see, or get something that you have been searching for

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

vt. 算出…的平均数；将…平均分配；使…平衡

vt. 支持；后退；背书；下赌注
adv. 以前；向后地；来回地；上溯；回来；回原处

sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

vi. 保持平衡；相称；抵销

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: hold
trans: vt. 持有；拥有；保存；拘留；约束或控制
又作“Hold住”使用，中英混用词汇，表示轻松掌控全局。

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

sentences.english: Our guests have arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我们的客人到了。

sentences.english: Has anyone phoned?
sentences.chinese: 有人打过电话来吗？

sentences.english: We’ve been spending too much money.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经花掉太多钱了。

sentences.english: I hadn’t seen him for 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 我已经15年没见他了。

sentences.english: ‘I hope you’ve read the instructions.’ ‘Yes, of course I have.’
sentences.chinese: “我希望你已经看过使用说明了。”“当然看过了。”

sentences.english: You haven’t done much, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你没做多少，是吗？

sentences.english: They used to have a Mercedes Benz.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾经拥有一辆奔驰汽车。

sentences.english: She sat down and had another drink.
sentences.chinese: 她坐下来又喝了一杯。

detailed_translations.chinese: （与过去分词连用构成完成时）
detailed_translations.english: used with past participles to form perfect tenses
used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: occupy
trans: vt. 占据，占领；居住；使忙碌

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: try
trans: vt. 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验

sentences.english: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: need
trans: n. 需要，要求；缺乏；必要之物

sentences.english: You don’t really need a car.
sentences.chinese: 你其实并不需要一辆车。

sentences.english: Plants need light in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要光才能存活。

sentences.english: The camcorder needs a new battery.
sentences.chinese: 这台摄像机需要一块新电池。

sentences.english: Are you sure that you have everything you need?
sentences.chinese: 你确定需要的都有了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them
to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them

name: fire
trans: n. 火；火灾；炮火；炉火；热情；激情；磨难
vt. 点燃；解雇；开除；使发光；烧制；激动；放枪
vi. 着火；射击；开枪；激动；烧火

sentences.english: The warehouse was completely destroyed by fire.
sentences.chinese: 仓库全给烧毁了。

sentences.english: Thirty people died in a fire in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。

sentences.english: Police think that the fire was started deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 警方认为有人故意纵火。

sentences.english: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores (= made them start burning ) .
sentences.chinese: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

sentences.english: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 士兵朝人群开枪。

detailed_translations.english: uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things
to shoot bullets or bombs

name: right
trans: adj. 正确的；直接的；右方的
adv. 正确地；恰当地；彻底地

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: correct
trans: adj. 正确的；恰当的；端正的

sentences.english: If my calculations are correct, we’re about ten miles from Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 如果我计算得没错的话，我们离埃克塞特大约十英里。

sentences.english: Score one point for each correct answer .
sentences.chinese: 答对一题得一分。

sentences.english: You are absolutely correct, the Missouri is the longest river in the US.
sentences.chinese: 你说的完全正确，密苏里河是美国最长的河流。

sentences.english: Some eyesight problems are relatively easy to correct.
sentences.chinese: 有些视力问题比较容易矫正。

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes
to make something right or to make it work the way it should

name: term
trans: n. 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项

sentences.english: Teachers often feel overworked in term time (= during the term ) .
sentences.chinese: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项
detailed_translations.english: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language
to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

name: advance
trans: n. 发展；前进；增长；预付款
vt. 提出；预付；使……前进；将……提前

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: means
trans: v. 意思是；打算（mean的第三人称单数）

sentences.english: The only means of communication was sign language.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.english: The window was our only means of escape .
sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.english: Do you have any means of identification ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: art as a means of expression
sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: landscape
trans: n. 风景；风景画；景色；山水画；乡村风景画；地形；（文件的）横向打印格式
vt. 对…做景观美化，给…做园林美化；从事庭园设计
vi. 美化（环境等），使景色宜人；从事景观美化工作，做庭园设计师

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: view
trans: n. 观察；视野；意见；风景

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: sights
trans: n. 风景，名胜；视野（sight的复数）
v. 瞄准（sight的第三人称单数）；仔细观看

sentences.english: The practice of hanging clothes across the street is a common sight in many parts of the city.
sentences.chinese: 在大街上晾晒衣服在该市的许多地区是很常见的景象。

detailed_translations.english: A sight is something that you see

name: scenery
trans: n. 风景；景色；舞台布景

sentences.english: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
sentences.chinese: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

sentences.english: Instead of stagehands, the actors will move the scenery right in front of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 演员们将替代舞台工作人员，当着观众的面置换布景。

detailed_translations.english: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

sentences.english: He was surrounded by a group of admirers.
sentences.chinese: 他的身边围了一群仰慕者。

sentences.english: The photo shows four men grouped round a jeep.
sentences.chinese: 照片上是四个男人围着一辆吉普车。

detailed_translations.english: several people or things that are all together in the same place
to come together and form a group, or to arrange things or people together in a group

sentences.english: She has reason to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她有理由感到内疚。

sentences.english: the human power of reason
sentences.chinese: 人类的理性

sentences.english: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

detailed_translations.english: why something happens, or why someone does something
to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

name: remain
trans: vi. 保持；依然；留下；剩余；逗留；残存

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: stay
trans: vi. 停留；坚持；暂住；停下

sentences.english: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
sentences.chinese: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

sentences.english: She stayed late to finish the report.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成报告，她工作到很晚。

detailed_translations.english: to remain in a place rather than leave
a limited time of living in a place

name: society
trans: n. 社会；交往；社团；社交界

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

name: stop
trans: n. 停止；车站；障碍；逗留
vi. 停止；中止；逗留；被塞住

sentences.english: Stop throwing those stones!
sentences.chinese: 别再扔那些石头了！

detailed_translations.english: to block a hole or pipe so that water, smoke etc cannot go through it
if an activity comes to a stop, it stops happening

name: pause
trans: vi. 暂停，停顿，中止；踌躇

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again
