detailed_translations.english: to be very busy and continuously rushing about

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: solution
trans: n. 解决方案；溶液；溶解；解答

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

name: resolution
trans: n.  分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: store
trans: n. 商店；储备，贮藏；仓库

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: style
trans: n. 风格；时尚；类型；字体
vt. 设计；称呼；使合潮流
vi. 设计式样；用刻刀作装饰画

sentences.english: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
sentences.chinese: 将日本的管理方式用于欧洲企业的尝试

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you!
sentences.chinese: 你有一辈子要过呢！

sentences.english: His whole attitude bugs me.
sentences.chinese: 他的整个态度都让我讨厌。

sentences.english: We ate the whole cake in about ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 大约十分钟的时间，我们就把整个蛋糕都给吃完了。

sentences.english: The whole thing (= everything about the situation ) just makes me sick.
sentences.chinese: 这一切简直让我恶心。

sentences.english: We just sat around and watched TV the whole time (= the only thing we did was watch television ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一直都只是坐着看看电视。

sentences.english: I don’t believe she’s telling us the whole story (= all the facts ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为她没有告诉我们全部实情。

sentences.english: It was months before the whole truth came out.
sentences.chinese: 几个月以后才真相大白。

detailed_translations.english: all of something
something that consists of a number of parts, but is considered as a single unit

name: wholesale
trans: adv. 大规模地；以批发方式

sentences.english: wholesale prices
sentences.chinese: 批发价

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: confess
trans: vi. 承认；坦白；忏悔；供认
vt. 承认；坦白；忏悔；供认

sentences.english: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.english: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

detailed_translations.english: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

name: apply
trans: vi. 申请；涂，敷；适用；请求

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

sentences.english: Can I use your phone?
sentences.chinese: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

sentences.english: I’ll show you which room you can use.
sentences.chinese: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。

sentences.english: I always use the same shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 我一直用同一种洗发水。

sentences.english: Use your imagination when planning meals.
sentences.chinese: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。

sentences.english: She booked the flight using a false name.
sentences.chinese: 她用化名预订了航班。

detailed_translations.english: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用， 应用； 用途， 效用
detailed_translations.english: the action or fact of using something

name: article
trans: n. 文章；物品；条款； 冠词
vt. 订约将…收为学徒或见习生；使…受协议条款的约束
vi. 签订协议；进行控告

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

sentences.english: newspaper articles
sentences.chinese: 报纸上的文章

sentences.english: household articles
sentences.chinese: 家居用品

sentences.english: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

name: bill
trans: n.  法案；广告；账单； 票据；钞票；清单
vt. 宣布；开账单；用海报宣传

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: catch
trans: vt. 赶上；抓住；感染；了解

sentences.english: Did you catch any fish?
sentences.chinese: 你捕到鱼了吗？

sentences.english: Early settlers caught rabbits and squirrels and even rats in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 早期移民为了生存而捕食野兔、松鼠，甚至老鼠。

sentences.english: I caught the 7.15 train to London.
sentences.chinese: 我赶上了7点15分的火车去伦敦。

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我没听清楚你的话。

detailed_translations.english: to trap an animal or fish by using a trap, net, or hook, or by hunting it

name: critical
trans: adj. 鉴定的； 临界的；批评的，爱挑剔的；危险的；决定性的；评论的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: double
trans: adv. 双重地；两倍地；弓身地
vi. 加倍，加倍努力；快步走

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

sentences.english: The subjects were given quadruple the normal dosage of the drug.
sentences.chinese: 让实验对象服用了四倍于正常剂量的药物。

detailed_translations.english: four times as big or as many
to increase and become four times as big or as high, or to make something increase in this way

name: duty
trans: n. 责任； 关税；职务

sentences.english: I promise I will do my duty .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会尽到我的责任。

sentences.english: We feel it is our duty to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我们感到帮助她是我们的责任。

sentences.english: Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
sentences.chinese: 地方当局有责任保持街道整洁。

sentences.english: You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
sentences.chinese: 你对你丈夫和孩子负有责任。

sentences.english: She has a strong sense of moral duty .
sentences.chinese: 她的道德责任感很强。

sentences.english: Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的职责包括清洗汽车。

sentences.english: the duty on cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 香烟税

detailed_translations.english: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

name: exercise
trans: n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼
vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐

sentences.english: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在日常生活中安排一些经常性的锻炼。

sentences.english: Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
sentences.chinese: 由于在办公室工作，我很少运动。

sentences.english: role-play exercises
sentences.chinese: 角色扮演练习

sentences.english: Horses need to be exercised regularly.
sentences.chinese: 马需要有规律的训练。

to do sports or other physical activities in order to stay healthy or become stronger; to make an animal do this

name: eye
trans: n. 眼睛；视力；眼光；见解，观点

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他有一双漂亮的眼睛。

sentences.english: There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

name: force
trans: n. 力量；武力；军队；魄力
vt. 促使，推动；强迫；强加

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: power
trans: n. 力量，能力；电力，功率；政权，势力； 幂
adj. 借影响有权势人物以操纵权力的
vt. 激励；供以动力；使…有力量

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

sentences.english: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在后院里玩游戏。

sentences.english: game birds
sentences.chinese: 被捕猎的鸟

detailed_translations.english: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules

name: introduce
trans: vt. 介绍；引进；提出；采用

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的；物质的；天生的；不做作的
n. 自然的事情；白痴；本位音

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: passage
trans: n. 一段（文章）；走廊；通路

sentences.english: My office is just along the passage.
sentences.chinese: 我的办公室就在过道旁边。

sentences.english: We walked down a narrow passage to the back of the building.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。

sentences.english: an underground passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

sentences.english: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥不够坚固，无法让重型车辆通过。

detailed_translations.english: a way through something

name: hall
trans: n. 过道，门厅，走廊；会堂；食堂；学生宿舍；大厅，前厅；娱乐中心，会所

sentences.english: a huge tiled entrance hall
sentences.chinese: 铺着地砖的大门厅

sentences.english: Each floor had ten rooms on both sides of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 每一层在走廊的两边都各有十个房间。

detailed_translations.english: the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms

sentences.english: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这儿走，浴室就在走廊的尽头。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: regard
trans: n. 注意；尊重；问候；凝视
vt. 注重，考虑；看待；尊敬；把…看作；与…有关

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: treat
trans: vt. 治疗；对待；探讨；视为

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

name: wear
trans: v. 穿着；用旧；耗损；面露

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

name: chain
trans: vt. 束缚；囚禁；用铁链锁住

sentences.english: ...a large supermarket chain.
sentences.chinese: …一家大型连锁超市。

detailed_translations.english: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person

name: check
trans: n. <美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对
vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；将一军
vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: examine
trans: vt. 检查；调查； 检测；考试

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金；犯；委任；委任状
vt. 委任；使服役；委托制作

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: sequence
trans: n.  序列；顺序；续发事件

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: calculate
trans: vt. 计算；预测；认为；打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

sentences.english: a newly married couple
sentences.chinese: 一对新婚夫妇

sentences.english: the couple next door
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的那对夫妇

detailed_translations.english: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship

name: cover
trans: n. 封面，封皮；盖子；掩蔽物;幌子，借口
vt. 包括；采访，报导；涉及

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

sentences.english: Angus injured his leg playing rugby.
sentences.chinese: 安格斯在打橄榄球时弄伤了腿。

detailed_translations.english: to hurt yourself or someone else, for example in an accident or an attack

name: doctor
trans: vt. 修理；篡改，伪造；为…治病；授以博士学位

sentences.english: She was treated by her local doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她由她的本区医生治疗。

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment to see Dr Pugh.
sentences.chinese: 我想预约看皮尤医生。

sentences.english: a Doctor of Law
sentences.chinese: 法学博士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to treat people who are ill

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机
vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: feature
trans: n. 特色，特征；容貌；特写或专题节目
vt. 特写；以…为特色；由…主演

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

sentences.english: Two of his front teeth had been knocked out.
sentences.chinese: 他有两颗门牙被打落了。

sentences.english: the front cover of ‘Hello!’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 《Hello!》杂志的封面

sentences.english: the front wheel of his bicycle
sentences.chinese: 他自行车的前轮

sentences.english: the dog’s front legs
sentences.chinese: 狗的前腿

sentences.english: Ricky stepped forward to the front of the stage and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 里基走到舞台的最前面，开始唱了起来。

detailed_translations.english: at, on, or in the front of something
the part of something that is furthest forward in the direction that it is facing or moving

name: import
trans: n. 进口，进口货；输入；意思，含义；重要性
vt. 输入，进口；含…的意思

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: memory
trans: n. 记忆，记忆力；内存， 存储器；回忆

sentences.english: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。

sentences.english: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里

detailed_translations.english: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

name: particular
trans: n. 详细说明；个别项目
adj. 特别的；详细的；独有的；挑剔的

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: sector
trans: n. 部门；扇形，扇区；象限仪；函数尺

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: section
trans: n. 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节
vt. 把…分段；将…切片；对…进行划分
vi. 被切割成片；被分成部分

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: speed
trans: n. 速度，速率；迅速，快速；昌盛，繁荣
vt. 加快…的速度；使成功，使繁荣
vi. 超速，加速；加速，迅速前行；兴隆

sentences.english: I got caught speeding on the A40 yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我在 A40 号干线公路上超速行驶被逮到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰，迅速前进，急行；加速；超速行驶
detailed_translations.english: to be driving faster than the legal limit
the rate at which something moves or travels

detailed_translations.chinese: 快速传送； 促进， 使加速
detailed_translations.english: to take someone or something somewhere very quickly

name: stand
trans: n. 站立；立场；看台；停止

sentences.english: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。

sentences.english: She stood in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她站在门口。

sentences.english: (= do not move ) and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 站好别动，听我说。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there (= stand and not do anything ) – help me!
sentences.chinese: 不要光站在那里，帮帮我！

detailed_translations.english: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

sentences.english: It’s a long walk. Maybe we should get the bus.
sentences.chinese: 走着去很远，或许我们应该乘公共汽车。

sentences.english: Rosanna and Forbes walked in silence.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎娜与福布斯默默地走着。

sentences.english: We walked into the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 我们走进前厅。

sentences.english: I walked a few steps toward the fence.
sentences.chinese: 我向栅栏走了几步。

detailed_translations.english: a journey that you make by walking, especially for exercise or enjoyment
When you walk, you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way

name: weather
trans: n. 天气；气象；气候；处境
vt. 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
vi. 风化；受侵蚀；经受风雨

sentences.english: What’s the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 今天天气如何？

sentences.english: The weather turned bitterly cold.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很冷了。

detailed_translations.english: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind

detailed_translations.chinese: 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: act
trans: n. 行为，行动；法令，法案；（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕，段；装腔作势
vi. 行动；扮演，充当；表现，举止；假装，演戏；起作用，见效

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

sentences.english: There seem to be so many rules and regulations these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像条条框框很多。

sentences.english: regulations governing the safety of toys
sentences.chinese: 监控玩具安全的条例

sentences.english: All companies must comply with the regulations .
sentences.chinese: 所有公司都必须遵守规定。

detailed_translations.english: an official rule or order

name: rule
trans: vt. 统治；规定；管理；裁决；支配

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

name: annual
trans: n. 年刊，年鉴；一年生植物

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: journal
trans: n. 日报，杂志；日记；分类账

sentences.english: the British Medical Journal
sentences.chinese: 《英国医学杂志》

sentences.english: He decided to keep a journal.
sentences.chinese: 他决定记日记。

detailed_translations.english: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: contain
trans: vt. 包含；控制；容纳；牵制（敌军）

sentences.english: The thieves stole a purse containing bank-notes.
sentences.chinese: 小偷们偷到了一个里面有钞票的钱包。

sentences.english: The museum contains a number of original artworks.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆藏有一些原创艺术品。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

name: attain
trans: vt. 达到，实现；获得；到达

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

sentences.english: Where did you learn to cook?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪里学烹调的？

sentences.english: Cook the sauce over a low heat for ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 把这调味汁用低火烧十分钟。

sentences.english: slices of cooked ham
sentences.chinese: 熟的火腿片

sentences.english: a cooked breakfast
sentences.chinese: 做好的早餐

detailed_translations.english: to prepare food for eating by using heat
to prepare food for eating by using heat

name: direct
trans: adj. 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的
vt. 管理；指挥；导演；指向
adv. 直接地；正好；按直系关系

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: dominant
trans: adj. 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: film
trans: n. 电影；薄膜；胶卷；轻烟
vt. 在…上覆以薄膜；把…拍成电影
vi. 摄制电影；生薄膜；变得朦胧

sentences.english: Have you seen any good films recently?
sentences.chinese: 你最近看过什么好的影片吗？

sentences.english: I shot five rolls of film on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 我在度假时拍了五卷胶卷。

sentences.english: a film of oil on the surface of the water
sentences.chinese: 水面上的一层油

detailed_translations.english: a story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television

name: ground
trans: n. 地面；土地；范围；战场;根据
v. 研磨（grind的过去分词）；压迫
adj. 土地的；地面上的；磨碎的；磨过的
vt. 使接触地面；打基础；使搁浅

sentences.english: I found her lying on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她躺在地上。

sentences.english: a football/recreation/sports, etc. ground
sentences.chinese: 足球场、娱乐场地、运动场等

sentences.english: There are strong grounds for believing his statement.
sentences.chinese: 有充分的理由可以相信他的话。

sentences.english: ‘You’re under arrest.’ ‘On what grounds?’
sentences.chinese: “你被捕了。”“理由是什么？”

detailed_translations.english: the solid surface of the earth

sentences.english: a stone for grinding knives and scissors
sentences.chinese: 磨刀剪的石头

sentences.chinese: 你需要减少饮食中脂肪和糖的摄入量。

sentences.chinese: 科学家警告说如果不减少碳排放量，我们可能会面临环境灾难。

sentences.english: Seven hundred jobs will be lost in order to cut costs and boost profits.
sentences.chinese: 为了降低成本，提高利润，将削减700个职位。

sentences.english: The major aviation companies need to cut prices if they are to compete with budget airlines.
sentences.chinese: 大航空公司如果想和廉价的航空公司竞争，就需要降低价格。

sentences.english: Staffing levels had already been cut to the bone (= reduced to the lowest level possible ) .
sentences.chinese: 人员配备已经削减到了最低限度。

detailed_translations.english: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

name: date
trans: n. 日期；约会；年代；枣椰子
vi. 过时；注明日期；始于（某一历史时期）

sentences.english: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
sentences.chinese: 信上的日期是1962年8月30日。

sentences.english: What’s today’s date?
sentences.chinese: 今天几号？

sentences.english: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 一定要在底下签上姓名和日期。

detailed_translations.english: a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
to write or print the date on something

name: period
trans: n. 周期，期间；时期；月经；课时；（语法学）句点，句号

sentences.english: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
sentences.chinese: 明天天气干燥，间或晴朗。

sentences.english: a double period of Science
sentences.chinese: 一连两节的自然科学课

sentences.english: Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注意标点，特别是逗号和句号的正确使用方法。

detailed_translations.english: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 解散；解雇；开除；让...离开；不予理会、不予考虑

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: fire
trans: n. 火；火灾；炮火；炉火；热情；激情；磨难
vt. 点燃；解雇；开除；使发光；烧制；激动；放枪
vi. 着火；射击；开枪；激动；烧火

sentences.english: The warehouse was completely destroyed by fire.
sentences.chinese: 仓库全给烧毁了。

sentences.english: Thirty people died in a fire in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。

sentences.english: Police think that the fire was started deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 警方认为有人故意纵火。

sentences.english: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores (= made them start burning ) .
sentences.chinese: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

sentences.english: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 士兵朝人群开枪。

detailed_translations.english: uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things
to shoot bullets or bombs

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: embrace
trans: vt. 拥抱；信奉，皈依；包含

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: file
trans: n. 文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀
vt. 提出；锉；琢磨；把…归档
vi. 列队行进；用锉刀锉

sentences.english: We will keep your details on file (= store them for later use ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.english: The contracts are filed alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject
to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

sentences.english: Blanche heard a crash as the back door was flung open.
sentences.chinese: 布兰奇听见后门哗啦一声被推开。

sentences.english: Did anyone see or hear anything last night?
sentences.chinese: 昨晚有没有人看见或听见什么？

sentences.english: Old Zeke doesn’t hear too well any more.
sentences.chinese: 老齐克的耳朵已不灵了。

sentences.english: I heard a rumor that he was getting married soon.
sentences.chinese: 我听到传闻，说他马上要结婚了。

sentences.english: The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 最高法院于周二审理了此案。

detailed_translations.english: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears

name: jump
trans: vt. 跳跃；使跳跃；跳过；突升

sentences.english: The cats jumped down and came to meet us.
sentences.chinese: 这些猫跳下来，过来迎接我们。

detailed_translations.english: to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground
to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground

name: soar
trans: vi. 高飞；高耸；往上飞舞

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: lag
trans: n. 落后；迟延；防护套；囚犯；桶板
vt. 落后于；押往监狱；加上外套
vi. 滞后；缓缓而行；蹒跚

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

name: lay
trans: vt. 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
adj. 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
n. 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴

sentences.english: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。

sentences.english: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

detailed_translations.chinese: 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴
detailed_translations.english: a poem or song

name: mark
trans: n. 标志；马克；符号；痕迹；分数
n. . 标志；做标记于；打分数

sentences.english: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
sentences.chinese: 小猫身体基本为白色，背上有黑色斑点。

sentences.english: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在页末做个记号。

sentences.english: A simple wooden cross marked her grave.
sentences.chinese: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of darker or lighter colour on a plain surface such as a person’s skin or an animal’s fur
to show where something is

name: sign
trans: n. 迹象；符号；记号；手势；指示牌

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: narrow
trans: adj. 狭窄的，有限的；勉强的；精密的；度量小的
n. 海峡；狭窄部分，隘路

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见；偏爱；斜纹；乖离率

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: press
trans: n. 压；按；新闻；出版社； 印刷机

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: squeeze
trans: n. 压榨；紧握；拥挤；佣金

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: subject
trans: n. 主题；科目； 主语；国民
adj. 服从的；易患…的；受制于…的

sentences.english: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。

sentences.english: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目； 学科； 主语
detailed_translations.english: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: awake
trans: vt. 唤醒；使觉醒；激起，唤起
vi. 觉醒，意识到；醒来；被唤起

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: administration
trans: n. 管理；行政；实施；行政机构

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。

sentences.english: The health service spends too much on administration.
sentences.chinese: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

detailed_translations.english: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

sentences.english: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.english: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

name: alarm
trans: n. 闹钟；警报，警告器；惊慌

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: appreciate
trans: vt. 欣赏；感激；领会；鉴别

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: appreciative
trans: adj. 感激的；赏识的；有欣赏力的；承认有价值的

sentences.english: There is a murmur of appreciative laughter.
sentences.chinese: 有一阵低低的赞赏的笑声。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing that you enjoy something or are pleased about it

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: arm
trans: n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

sentences.english: Have you made all your travel arrangements?
sentences.chinese: 你的旅行都安排好了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 整理， 排列； 安排； 准备工作
detailed_translations.english: plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen

name: appointment
trans: n. 任命；约定；任命的职位

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: assistant
trans: adj. 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: contribute
trans: vt. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献
vi. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: bank
trans: vt. 将…存入银行；倾斜转弯

sentences.english: Did you bank that check?
sentences.chinese: 你把那张支票存入银行了吗？

name: principal
trans: n. 首长；校长；资本；当事人

sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

trans: n. 规定；条款；准备； 供应品
vt. 供给…食物及必需品

name: pursuit
trans: n. 追赶，追求；职业，工作

trans: vt. 继续；从事；追赶；纠缠

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor

trans: n. 追求者；追捕者；研究者；原告

trans: n. 四分之一；地区；季度；一刻钟；两角五分；节
vt. 将…四等分；供某人住宿

trans: n. 吵架；反目；怨言；争吵的原因；方头凿

sentences.chinese: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

an angry argument or disagreement

sentences.english: All the children will receive a small gift.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.english: Lee received 324 votes (= 324 people voted for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

detailed_translations.english: to be given something

trans: vt. 接受；承认；承担；承兑；容纳

trans: n. 场面；情景；景象；事件

sentences.english: battle scenes
sentences.chinese: 战斗场面

sentences.chinese: 警察很快就到达了案发现场。

trans: vt. 保护；弄到；招致；缚住
adj. 安全的；无虑的；有把握的；稳当的
vi. 获得安全；船抛锚；停止工作

sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

name: sound
trans: n. 声音，语音；噪音；海峡；吵闹；听力范围； 探条
adj. 健全的，健康的；合理的；可靠的；有效彻底的
vt. 听（诊）；测量，测…深；使发声；试探；宣告
vi. 听起来；发出声音；回响；测深

sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

trans: n. 声音；嗓音；发言权；愿望

sentences.chinese: 他立刻听出了她的声音。

sentences.english: I could hear angry voices.

to tell people your opinions or feelings about a particular subject

trans: vt. 阻止；除去…的茎；给…装柄
vi. 阻止；起源于某事物；逆行

sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

trans: n. 诉讼；恳求；套装，西装；一套外衣

trans: n. （一套）家具；套房；组曲；（一批）随员，随从

trans: adj. 彻底的；广泛的；扫荡的
v. 打扫；扫除（sweep的现在分词形式）

trans: vt. 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动

name: voice
trans: n. 声音；嗓音；发言权；愿望

sentences.english: I could hear angry voices.

detailed_translations.english: the sounds that you make when you speak, or the ability to make these sounds

name: wild
trans: adj. 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的

in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people

trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

trans: vt. 承认；准许进入；可容纳

sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

trans: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

name: alien
trans: n. 外国人，外侨；外星人

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: bargain
trans: v. 讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖

sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

name: negotiate

sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

name: betray
trans: vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象

sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露

name: bound
trans: adj. 有义务的；必定的；受约束的；装有封面的

sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

sentences.chinese: 你认为这个病人什么时候可以做肿瘤手术？

sentences.english: Staging of prostatic adenocarcinoma is based upon how extensive the tumor is.
sentences.chinese: 前列腺腺癌的分级是根据肿瘤的浸润程度而定的。

sentences.chinese: 由于他的前列腺肿瘤是在早期被发现的，处在很有可能治愈阶段。

sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通

trans: n. 循环，周期；圆；圈子；圆形物

sentences.chinese: 画一个直径10厘米的圆形。

sentences.english: Johnson was part of the President’s inner circle (= the people who have the most influence ) .
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊是总统核心集团的人。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, fashion comes full circle.
sentences.chinese: 时尚迟早会流行回来的。

sentences.english: This is the road that circles the city.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那条环城路。

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: confine
trans: n. 界限，边界;约束；限制

sentences.chinese: 用于治疗癌症的一种药物

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。
